13. Kusum Rolls 
14. Puchka & Masala Muri at Russel Street 
15. Flurys 
16.Tung Fung 

etc.etc

title: PARK STREET
review_text: The street runs through was a deer park of Sir Elijah Impey, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court in Calcutta from 1773 to 1789, hence the name. Park Street has been the recreation zone for Kolkata people since the British era. However, as in last 2/3 decades new restaurants, malls, 5-star hotels and nightclubs have started operation in other areas of the city, thus Park Street has lost much of its earlier attraction. However, it is still one of the prime commercial and entertainment zones of the city. Park Street is traditionally decorated with lights on Diwali, Christmas Day and New Year's Eve.

title: One of the best in Kolkata
review_text: If you're in Kolkata, then you must not miss this thoroughfare in the hart of the city. Alongwith the restaurants, clubs, bars, book shops just take a walk on this street to feel vibes of this area.

title: one of old street from Indian age
review_text: this street is known by its presence since years you will get every kind of street food here on road side

title: The restaurant road of Kolkata. Anglo Indian heritage sights.
review_text:
Park Street is lined with restaurants on both sides. Absolutely in the heart of Calcutta. Nostalgic memories of the British Raj can be seen in the architecture here. 
Visit the iconic Flurys' for breakfast or a leisurely cup of tea and freshly baked pastries. Have the chelo kebab platter at Peter Cat. Mocambo is the place for continental food with Anglo Indian overtones. Bar B Q and Kwalitys' for really good Indian food . Tantra at the Park hotel if you're in the mood for disco dancing. Of course Olypub offers steaks for the hungry and alcohol for the thirsty. 
Saunter along the street, soaking in the ambience. Drop into The Oxford Book Store for browsing through their immense collection of books and treat yourself to a cuppa chat at their exotic Cha bar as you leaf through the books you have chosen. 
Down the road is the famous Park Streets cemetery 
As you walk down, the road gets more crowded. But don't lose heart. You'll come upon some of the best biriyani joints of Calcutta. One shouldn't leave town without visiting Shiraz or Arsalan for their special distinctive,mouthwatering Biryani. 
Come December the street is decorated with glittering lights. People throng the streets of this Sahib para! Recently food stalls are put up for Burra Din or Xmas in remembrance of the Anglo Indian heritage of Park Street. But be careful about the overenthusiastic tipplers late at night. More

title: Lively place and the heart of Kolkata
review_text: Besides the traditional buildings and the eatry joints from the British Raj era, this street is the heart beat of Kolkata. Books, coffe shops (Flurrys) and Bengali wraps and rolls(Kusum) line up a great experience for the new as well as old travellers.

title: Shopping
review_text: The place is having old world Charm and it's days has gone and place most have seen better days, you can find different shops here and better to avoid buying from hawkers

title: Well Known place..
review_text: The Park Street in KOLKATA is among the one of the famous streets.It is a great MARKET PLACE AND DEFINITELY A TOURIST attraction..

title: The heart of the city. A happening place in Kolkata.
review_text:
Park street is know for the restaurant joint in Kolkata. You name a kind of restaurant where you want to dine, Park Street has that. 
At the time of Christmas and New Year time the streets are beautifully decorated with lights.

title: Good upmarket shops
review_text: Without a doubt there is great upmarket shopping at one end of this street and good eating available up and down the whole street not to mention tourist sights. But, the traffic and lack of footpaths create a hazardous and challenging expedition. As visiting older Australian ladies this was too much for us plus a big difficulty getting a taxi back to our accommodation, in fact, on one occassion required the assistance of a wonderful Traffic Cop to obtain a taxi. Won't be back to Kolkatta unless on an organised tour.

title: Park Street is Park Street!!!
review_text:
The Park Street in Kolkata is one of the most famous and oldest streets in the country.You will see typical British Architecture in the buildings across the street simply because the city and it's people have kept it intact through all these years. Now the Park Street is a great market place to buy anything you want. It is a real shopping street too.And do not forget the delicious and multi-variety street food here. 
I am sure Park Street will give you a unique experience.

title: Park street-Happening but confusing for outsiders
review_text:
I have been in Kolkata recently and generally stay in the park street area. Everytime I go there, it is a bit confusing for outsiders as it is made a one way depending upon the time of the day. 

This particular day the entire street was cordoned off, by the police( not sure ) what the reason was , but no vehicles were allowed in the Park street main area, and thus a lot on inconvenience was caused. 

I had morning early morning flight, and since this was the scenario, I had to walk with my luggage to the mail road ( near the flyover), and then take my taxi. 

Since this is a tourist spots, with quite a few Hotels there, this should be taken care of, specially by the hotels for their guests to avoid these kind of inconveniences. 

Unfortunately for a lot of things Kolkata still has not change. its an old city, with a will of modernization, but still struggling with basic issues. More

title: Park Street Nostalgia
review_text: This is one of the most beautiful and posh areas of Kolkata. Make sure to visit it during Christmas Eve.

title: Most happening place in Kolkata
review_text:
If you are a food freak and that too street food. Visit park street to have relishing egg rolls. 

For a heart felt full course there are a number of happening restaurants and bars. One will enjoy each and every place with friends especially. 

Week ends are amazing , where you can have a wonderful night out with friends.

title: Most happening place at night
review_text: Park Street is the heart of Kolkata especially at night. Lots of pub and Hotel the park at 2 its attraction especially for the people from outside the place caters to all the young and party Mania

title: “Down the bay when the nights are gay”
review_text: Harry Belafonte has never been here yet his words fit in description of this road quite aptly. The nights are always fun and frolic in here. Delicious food pockets with bright lights all around, along with hypnotic illusion of brands and showrooms... that’s Park street. The side alley of darkness , the history all around , the nostalgia ...that’s Park Street. The unwanted incident of Suzette , the chaos of Christmas night, the forced balloons and customised beggars ...that’s Park Street. There’s something about the street which is joyful yet uncanny. So much mystery blended with history ...that’s Park Street.

title: The most famous street of Kolkata
review_text: This is such a great street. All kinds of shops, clothes, crafts, other necessities. Restaurants and cafes abound. Some cafes have been there for decades. Its an enjoyable as well as a rather nostalgic experience at teh same time. No one should leave kolkata without visiting Park Street

title: Busy Bazar
review_text: The shopping paradise of Kolkatta, ideal for Crafts, Sarees, Dress materials and artefacts. If you need a break, stop over for local snacks and tea.And not to forget the famous bengali sweets. A foodies dream come true.

title: A place to be in Kolkata
review_text: Park street evokes nostalgia. Though the romantic era is completely gone along with its beautiful atmosphere of crowded streets full of charming dames, wonderful restaurents, bars, excellent food and music, carnivalistic ambience, particularly during christmass and new year, still it retains some of the old world charm. Still we have the legendary mocambo, petercat, bar-b-q and other bars and restaurents and also moulin rouge running to full houses,the streets brightly lit up during christmass and new year and music and revelry in abundance during that period of the year. The Park, a five star hotel still dominates the road.Its in the center place in kolkata and all places of interest are very near to this area e.g. Indian Museum, Victoria Memorial, Eden Gardens, Raj Bhavan Birla Planetarium etc. A place to visit for sure in kolkata. For old Cacuttans a must visit place. More

title: Lovely - could do with some make over though!
review_text: In my opinion, Park Street is the heart of Kolkata. Right in the centre of the city, Park Street has the best street shopping and best eateries in town. I was here recently with my family and we really enjoyed the Park Street experience of walking down a street as old as time.

title: Restaurants, shops and book sellers
review_text:
Great street, very interesting. Many restaurants of good quality serving great Bengali food. Prices good. 

Nice to wander along just sightseeing. 

Pathway book sellers with old and latest books, all wrapped in their own plastic....prices good, bargaining also. Also book shops with the latest books.....computer categories so they know jus what they have and very helpful staff.

title: Park street
review_text: The street of Kolkata which transforms itself during Christmas and New Year eve, it has all what a people require to spend thier leisure time

title: Lovely place
review_text: It's a lovely place to go and hang around with friends. End number of famous restaurants of Kolkata are seen around.

title: Good for shooping
review_text: This place all the stuff from roadside eateries to shopping at reasonable prices which provides a decent collections and accessories are at their best

title: Shopping, dining or leisurely stroll
review_text: Park street has a special place in Kolkata culture and history with shops, restaurants, nice apartments and a park at park circus. Although crowded, it is a good spot for an evening stroll with window shopping and perhaps a cup of coffee or even dinner at one of the restaurants. Lot of saree shops there, which makes it a magnet for ladies. Park street is always very busy in the evening and known to be a safe spot in the mega city.

title: Place to be during evenings
review_text: This place is very lively in the evening, A lot of cafe's, restaurants, bar's and a good place to hangout.

title: Excellent place for food and shopping
review_text: Best place in Kolkata for shopping and food, variety of restaurants and lots of street food options. Tried a variety of rolls, yummy it was.

title: Just some brands stores
review_text: A lively Street having almost all the brands, some old famous sweet shops, swanky restaurants, bars and Kolkata attractions. Can be called Connaught place of Kolkata. Wouldn't have minded skipping.

title: Shopping and food heaven
review_text:
Park street is very old and happening place in Kolkata. 
You can shop till you drop in the bylanes and and their extremely delicious food range restaurants area available out there. evening and night is quite better to be there

title: Great place for food and shopping
review_text: Come to park street for upmarket shopping, cheap eats, top class food and great vibe. You must have a egg chapati from the street sellers, its amazing.

title: Park Street is all time best !
review_text:
Park Street is located in the central Calcutta , where I frequently visit for shopping. It's one of the most crowded market places in city, where any one will find out followings : 
1. Varieties of products i.e. clothes , garments, leathers , foods , beauty etc. 
2. Presence of Multi-cuisine as well as specialty restaurants 
3. Presence of one five star category hotel named as Grand Oberoi and one four star category hotel named as Peerless (Under Sarovar group) 
4. Presence of people from different domains, cultures , traditions and behaves. 
5. You will enjoy integrity. 
6. You will enjoy this place as little World.

title: Great place to soak up the contrasts of Calcutta
review_text: We enjoyed our stay in Park St area - the street and surrounding area is a lively mix of stylish eateries and clothing stores mixed with great street food and historic points of interest - like the fabulous oxford bookstore , Flury's bakery and top notch Mocambo as well as the atmospheric cemetery ... we tried some of the best samosas we've had in India along with delicious masala chai standing with crowds of locals on the street after their day at work ...even ducked into a hip little nightclub. This area has lots to offer!

title: Park street (heart of the city kolkata)
review_text: Part street is the place which we can call the heart of the city kolkata. Its the best place to hung out with friends specially in the time of Christmas. Even its a amazing destination for the photographer specially for the photo walk. Park Street give us different types of experiences beside cafes and restaurants luxury shops to allen park to Park Street cemetery. A lot of things to explore visit recommended

title: One of the most happening place in Kolkata
review_text:
Hi 
When i came here in Kolkata for the first time and visited Park Street and found its very much similar to European countries and the good part is that here government is keeping it fresh and upto date. 
The park Street of Kolkata is the heart of the city and majority of attraction points are very nearby for e.g. victoria place is hardly 500meter , Birla planetarium etc. 
So if you are travelling to Kolkata then you can't miss this place.

title: Chill out place
review_text: Great place for nightlife and parties. Young and happening crowd, very good architecture buildings. Definitely a place to chill out with friends

title: road to Kal
review_text:
Park Street is basically popular for its variety of Saris shop. Very popular for Bangladeshi tourists and west bengal local ladies. 
The street is very convenient for shopping and hangout.

title: Nice place
review_text: Nice place with many options for food restaurants shopping etc. The place is connected by mertro railway.

title: Great to Shop , Grab a bite and enjoy the Kolkata Vibe
review_text: Visited this place twice in a day and was greeted by a inter school Christmas parade during the afternoon and lovely holiday lights in the night. A walk with friends is definetely fun as you have several shops as well as snack counters , restaurants and bars. Make sure you get a Kati roll from a street vendor and enjoy the live music at one of the several bars on the street. Loved the laidback vibe this place had.

title: Great place for Shopping
review_text:
It's a great place to shop, filled with a range from quaint local shops to branded shops. 
If you want a quick fix for your shopping needs you should visit this place.

title: Famous shopping street of Kolkata
review_text: If you love shopping or you are there to just grab a bite (KFC, Burger King, Mc Donalds, the famous "Kati Roll") or cheap nice books to read , Park Street is worth the visit.

title: It's truly amazing
review_text:
This is the nerve centre of Kolkata and busy, moving always. You may find most of the attractions required as a tourist here. Have best of Pubs, bars, eateries, and all needed. 
Must look around for shops selling local art and handicrafts. 
Walking down the lane in the evening is a real treat.

title: The Iconic Calcutta Street
review_text: Once a hangout of British Colonial masters, the Park Street always was the place to shop, eat and party. The restaurants, shops and the night clubs still exist but the street is no longer the gravitational center as shopping malls and restaurants have sprouted all across Kolkata. Its still magical during Christmas with lights and decorations

title: Market in Kolkata
review_text:
One cheap price market for cloths handicrafts and other items 
Many shops both local and brands items

title: Used To Be the Most Happening Place of Kolkata
review_text:
Park street used to be synonymous with night life, music and great food as the best restaurants were located here like Mocambo, Peter cat, Trincas, Moulin Rouge, Blue Fox, Barbeque etc but after the restaurants opening at various places it lost its sheen. Despite that it is home to some of the best food places and pubs today. It starts with Asiatic Society and extends till the Assembly Of God Church School. 

I visited park street along with my friends to have lunch at Mocambo restaurant and we explored the whole street by walk. It is home to Park Hotel, kusum rolls center and the iconic "Flurys" restaurant.

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text:
This place is surrounded with restaurant, restobars, hotels, shopping mall and nearby beautiful and historical places like maidan, Victoria palace, Eden gardens, Museum, shaheed Minar etc. etc. 
Should visit at the time of Xmas or 31st December night.

title: It's got the buzz!
review_text: There is something about Park Street. The hustle and bustle is decorated by the beautiful colourful neons all through. Plus the shops, the watering holes and the restaurants all of whom have character. It is good!

title: Best place for hangout and food
review_text: We visited this place during diwali time. Its best place in kolkata for food shopping and for hangout with friends. There are very good restaurants, cafes and bars for hangout. But you have to hire cab to reach here or other option is metro train.

title: Old place
review_text: It is a old place. It is from british government. Here you find cemetry. Hotel resturent also. Road is clean. Light abilable.

title: Interesting road!!!
review_text: Both sides of this road are lined with restaurants, bars, bakeries and other food joints. It is also a good area to stroll around in the evenings

title: Great shopping experience..
review_text: The street is full of shops and restaurants. The buildings are typical of British era construction. However the place is crowded..

title: Lunch on Diwali weekend
review_text:
It was a nice walk... since it had been raining... it was refreshing and a pleasant walk on Park Street... being a holiday ... the traffic was very less. 

Walked about across restaurants and food establishments with patrons waiting on there turn to get a table. 

We finally picked fast food as we were famished and McDonald's did the trick.

title: "Let Us Visit"
review_text: I visited this place with a friend of mine. Both of us had a great time. We were basically taking a walk through this place to explore this part of the city. This place has everything in it, like bookshops, restaurants, cafes and huge buildings. One can say that this is one of the important business area of Kolkata. This place is also famous for well-known restaurants. Without any doubt this is the most happening place of the city. Night life is very active out here.

title: kolkat's foreign heritage
review_text: this area is famous as saheb para. this area is very good for different types of restaurants. this is the most happening place in the time of christmas. if u r in bengal u should experience christmas eve in park street at least once in life.

title: Have to visit
review_text: They have some cafes, restaurants, hotels and book shop. It's a nice place to visit and walk. You can find different side of Kolkata here

title: If you love to eat,party,roam around then Park Street is the place for you
review_text:
This is one of the regions of Kolkata that is famous for it's restaurants(Peter Cat,Trincus,Kwality,Mocambo,KFC to name a few).This area is also famous for it's night life specially during festive seasons. 

What I like about this place? 

1. Very easy to get there. Park Street metro station is present nearby(near the restaurants).Lot of buses are there to drop one at Park Street.Taxis are also easily available.One can take ones own vehicle too. 

2. Places like St. Xavier's college, South Park Street Cemetery, Victoria Memorial, New Market, St. Paul's cathedral,Jawaharlal Nehru doll's museum, Nandan, Academy of fine Arts,Shaheed Minar are located nearby. 

3. This place is extremely popular among-st the younger generations. 

What I dislike about this place? 

1. It is very difficult to park one's private vehicle. 
2. If you forget the road to enter Park Street, you may end up going round and round through the different roads. 
3. This is a one way road(at-least it mostly stays the same) 
4. Traffic jam is a huge problem here. 
5. One may end up in getting fined/cars taken away by police if traffic rules are not properly obeyed. More

title: Roaming
review_text: Its a awesome place which I often use to visit.....great thrilling atmosphere ahead....that I had even seen....

title: Kolkata tour's
review_text: It is a metro station in Kolkata near national museum and new market, it means you can enjoy three things at one place. First go to museum then ride Kolkata metro and last not the least have marketing at new market.

title: Nostalgia
review_text: It is only due to nostalgia of my college days,I make it a point to visit this stretch of road whenever I visit Kolkata to refresh my memories of Calcutta.Nothing much changed except increased vehicular traffic.Many old eateries are around sticking to traditional style of functioning.Those who like to live in the past for a while,this place is ideal.

title: Nice
review_text: nice place to visit especially for shooping and hangout with friends. fresh fruit juice is very much tasty

title: Bookshops
review_text: O Kolkata, i do love your bylanes. Its book lovers paradise. On one hand you have the oxford book shop, which needs no comments and on the other hand you have the pavement sellers who have everything that has been written. The whole experience of book buying feels enriching

title: Food zone of kolkata
review_text:
Park street, located at Central Kolkata, is basically the Restaurant zone of Kolkata. Once upon a time, during the British regime, this area was one of their favourites. Even now, quite a number of Anglo Indians live here." 

This place, very much accessible from all parts of Kolkata, is a must visit place, because of the multi cuisine foods that are available here, in some of the best restaurants of Kolkata. 

There are a number of heritage buildings on this road and most importantly the Royal Asiatic Society is located here.

title: hub
review_text:
the park street is main 
posh street of kolkatta 
must visit 
all gud restaurants and shopping places are on d street

title: Stroll in park street
review_text: A walk after vijay dashami can be very calm. Most of the shops would be closed though. But it would be a hastle free stroll at the colonial central Kolkata. There are plenty of restaurants around serving food from different parts of world for generations with very high reputations which can serve one well. If one wishes to experience the actual busy park st he/she can visit on a working day.

title: Really nice place
review_text:
For the first time I felt like I am again in mumbai. Feel like Colaba causeway road. 
So many restaurant, stalls, almost everything available here for foodies. If you are in Kolkata must visit this place. It also have Metro connectivity. So you can easily get down by metro also. Not sure about station name. i visited here by walking. But nice

title: Party Street
review_text: This is the best place to party in East zone. You get best of all worlds here. Continental, Mughlai, Thai, Chinese.. You ask for it and you have it there. It is so vibrant that it's bound to enhance your experience about the city.

title: Visit to The Park
review_text: We had a visit to hotel the park in regards to tat we to reach to park street at first.the distance between park street n railway station is abt 45mins from the railway station as well as the bus station by local communication.Easy access are available to this place.we had a business meeting in hotel The park.The vry busy n moderate street it is "The Park Street"..nothing more to say..u can enjoy night lyf ovr here..is a modern kolkata infact...enjoy

title: A regular shopping area with some of the best restaurants
review_text: Park Street is the heart of Kolkatta nightlife. Great gastronomic delights keeping in the reputation isbthe city as a foodie paradise. Has a number of new and sime old nightlife options

title: Interesting street
review_text: This street is very interesting for many reasons. There many different categories of hotels ,restaurants, pubs, coffee shops etc. Many young hang around here. They take the street convenient for smoking as they can't smoke inside the places. You avoid noticing beggars and other different types crowds. During the holy Durga puja the street were decorated in very attractive manner. If you compare with others street the park street rather more clean.

title: Contrasting
review_text: This is a famous street that houses many old establishments, old bakeries, hotels, shopping and so on. The street offers contrasting sights and sounds. One can see a mixture of elements from the rich and poor all in the same place. Noisy and crowded of course.

title: Beautiful architecture
review_text: A tree lined street with some beautiful buildings and nice restaurants including the iconic Flurys. I like it in the morning, there are lots of places to get a coffee, and it isn't has crowded as the rest of Calcutta. During Christmas it is worth coming down in the evening to enjoy the lighting.

title: Food and fun and the wonder of Puja lights await
review_text: Plenty of choices of shops and restaurants here and plenty of happy locals around encouraging you to buy their festive trinkets

title: Posh Area
review_text: Kolkata one of the posh and happening places. though its very busy and its just a vibes of great place due to restaurants and foreigner visiting

title: Heart and soul of Kolkatta
review_text: Park Street is the heart and soul of Kolkatta. The most happening place of Kolkatta. It is also known for its restaurants and night Clubs. It is most vibrant area. It contains all sort of life- Business hub, shopping, , hotels, restaurants, road side eateries . It is a shoppers paradise and one can get everything in any price range here. It is highly crowded specially on Friday evening and Saturday.. it is to be explored on foot rather than using any kind of transport. Adding to the beauty of the place is the old British era buildings

title: Interesting world
review_text:
Park Street has all its charm to like it. Business hub, shopper's paradise, hotels, restaurants, road side eateries - everything is there including a metro station. I walked through Chowrongee point to Park Circus 7 points in Park Street. That was amazing to get a picture of street life. The poorest of the poor manage to lead their happy life on this street. They cook, eat, sleep, sell, buy on this street. Had great opportunity to take photographs. 
To ease the traffic jams, the flow of vehicles are changed to two times a day, the one way movement is left to right in the morning and then right to left in the evening. Parking is difficult. No cars can be parked on the street. The metered Taxis take advantage of this system. More

title: Too much of Hussle Bussle
review_text: Good place for tourist...A happeningvplace for teenagers and foddies n shopping enthusiests...Lots of food joints and restaurents...Good place around for shopping...Too much of hussle bussle n too much crowd...If you are a person who prefer calm n peace this place is not for you....Yes very dirty foothpats n walk ways

title: Happening place
review_text: Park street is a very happening place in Kolkata. They have all sorts of shops and eateries. We had a nice shopping spree down there.

title: The Most happening place in Kolkatta
review_text: Bustling with all kinds of activity this is a must visit street if one visits Kolkata. There are several restaurants, bars and high end fashion outlets all along the long street. One notices a distinct developed image of Kolkata when one visits this place. This would be in contrast to many other locations in Kolkata. It is also a shoppers paradise and one can get everything in any price range here. Friday evening and Saturday are the two most crowded days at this place. Parking is a big problem and it is best to walk the street to explore rather than using any kind of transport. Adding to the beauty of the place is the old British era buildings. More

title: memories and memories and disappointments
review_text:
I grew up on Park Street and so, it is but natural that the street would hold memories for me. As I no longer live in Calcutta, every time I visit, there are a number of must-do things on my bucket list. As is but natural, population density has grown astronomically. Calcutta has still preserved much of its personality but unlike Bombay, where the corporate sector has joined hands in preserving the cultural heritage of the city, this is woefully rare, even absent, in Calcutta. Some of the iconic restaurants are still there, such as, Bar-be-Que, Mocambo's, Peter Cat and Kwality's and continue to live up to their reputation, other iconic eating places have become disappointments, such as, Flury's and Trinca's, and good new ones have joined the space, such as, One Step Up. Barkat Ali continues to flourish, Oxford Book Store remains a Mecca for book lovers, and Rajniklal has grown bigger and better, and Victor Bros still has wonderful antique stuff. The small shops selling all kinds of trinkets, especially tobacco related items, continue and appear to be doing well. Vendors selling books on the pavements still flourish and it is possibly the only city where copies of books that one has read but forgotten are still to be found. The legendary Hobby Centre has gone to seed and only occupies space. But it Park Street still remains a lovely street to spend time in. Colonial and British,... I grew up on Park Street and so, it is but natural that the street would hold memories for me. As I no longer live in Calcutta, every time I visit, there are a number of must-do things on my bucket list. 

As is but natural, population density has grown astronomically. Calcutta has still preserved much of its personality but unlike Bombay, where the corporate sector has joined hands in preserving the cultural heritage of the city, this is woefully rare, even absent, in Calcutta. 

Some of the iconic restaurants are still there, such as, Bar-be-Que, Mocambo's, Peter Cat and Kwality's and continue to live up to their reputation, other iconic eating places have become disappointments, such as, Flury's and Trinca's, and good new ones have joined the space, such as, One Step Up. Barkat Ali continues to flourish, Oxford Book Store remains a Mecca for book lovers, and Rajniklal has grown bigger and better, and Victor Bros still has wonderful antique stuff. 

The small shops selling all kinds of trinkets, especially tobacco related items, continue and appear to be doing well. Vendors selling books on the pavements still flourish and it is possibly the only city where copies of books that one has read but forgotten are still to be found. The legendary Hobby Centre has gone to seed and only occupies space. 

But it Park Street still remains a lovely street to spend time in. Colonial and British, it is different. And why not. 

The side roads like Short Street, Camac Street, Middleton Row, Russel Street, Free School Street all have their own attractions. 

But it most certainly could be improved significantly. Imagine if Saturdays were a car free day allowing for festivities and European style food, veggie and trinkets markets to be set up. Imagine if the corporate sector got together and gave the street and the adjoining streets mentioned above a face lift. Imagine if the shops and the residents on both sides of the street invested in greenery and flowers. Imagine if.... 

Nevertheless, I will go back again and again, even though I would always remain disappointed that the residents never quite appreciate what a gift they have. More

title: Restaurants of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street Kolkata is known for it's restaurants and night Clubs.The best Indian restaurant is Peter Cat .One has to wait for One hour to get a place.This is the case of best Restaurants.Another favourite place is Mocambo which is almost opposite Peter Cat.Here the waiting time is about 30 to 40 minutes.One can give your name and walk about 5minutes to someplace else and have a drink listen to some music and get back.There are number of Chinese restaurants as well.Christmas time is the best best time when the Street is fully illuminated till New Year.

title: Park Street kolkata
review_text: If you're New or old in kolkata , Park Street kolkata is a must visit place. 1 . you have a choice of restaurants to choice from. 2. You get a chance to revisit British era buildings. 3. Apart from the restaurants you get a Oxford book shop, a hobby house good shop's to buy be it a authentic Bengali dress or North Indian dress. Park Street has disco open till 1 am where you can shake your leg. If you want to do nothing only window shopping is a treat to eyes. For kolkattans park street is a must be it Christmas, new-year or during durga puja. You can reach by metro, bus, cab or car . More

review_text: Starting from the Asiatic Society, founded in 1784 for Oriental studies, this road is the most aristocratic avenue of Kolkata.With 5 star hotels and a number of mouth watering restaurants, bars and coffee shops, most elegant showrooms and a parc in the middle it ends up in the Park Circus seven crossing. title: vintage calcutta
review_text:
as i said in the title, this is probably one of the few remaining places where the eternal CALCUTTA still leaves , breathes and mesmerizes. one of the very few roads in the city which is still closed to the clutter of uniformly unruly auto rickshaws, and the ugly alligatorlike private and public buses, you can still take an aimless stoll on its mostly unencroached pavements lined by spreads of beautiful, long stretches of not so tall, colonial architecture. Home to the jewels of the city's academic institutes, the St. Xaviers and the Asiatic Society, with the Loreto, \La marts, in the byelanes a stones throw away, and the Art college and Calcutta MUseum, a 5 min walk from the western end, this no doubt is an intellectual's paradise.The buildings, in themselves glorious structures,call for a happy stroll around, to be followed up amongst the pavement book sellers or the cool comfort of the Oxford book house, And then if you are hungry, there is food, some or other fare for all segments. The high end trincas at the park, or Mocambo, Peter Cat, Berbeque Nation and many more new entrants with the very popular Mamagoto being the latest. my personal favourites are a bit different, the oly pub, with its massive steaks and beer, a little unpolished probably, but the true pub it is,next in my list would be Barbeque, and qwality, the eternal family resturants,, budgeted, very prompt,... as i said in the title, this is probably one of the few remaining places where the eternal CALCUTTA still leaves , breathes and mesmerizes. 
one of the very few roads in the city which is still closed to the clutter of uniformly unruly auto rickshaws, and the ugly alligatorlike private and public buses, you can still take an aimless stoll on its mostly unencroached pavements lined by spreads of beautiful, long stretches of not so tall, colonial architecture. 
Home to the jewels of the city's academic institutes, the St. Xaviers and the Asiatic Society, with the Loreto, \La marts, in the byelanes a stones throw away, and the Art college and Calcutta MUseum, a 5 min walk from the western end, this no doubt is an intellectual's paradise.The buildings, in themselves glorious structures,call for a happy stroll around, to be followed up amongst the pavement book sellers or the cool comfort of the Oxford book house, 
And then if you are hungry, there is food, some or other fare for all segments. The high end trincas at the park, or Mocambo, Peter Cat, Berbeque Nation and many more new entrants with the very popular Mamagoto being the latest. my personal favourites are a bit different, the oly pub, with its massive steaks and beer, a little unpolished probably, but the true pub it is,next in my list would be Barbeque, and qwality, the eternal family resturants,, budgeted, very prompt, wide fare, and perfect ambience for a small family with children, 
start your true journey in the late afternoon and drag it through the evening into night , and if possible start with the old burial ground in the eastern end, from the beautifuuly kept abode of the spirits and the past , and walk down to the western end flowing into the chaos and crowd of Chowringhee, and you will sure know what life in Calcutta was all about, and how it is mingling with todays Kolkata More

title: Busy street
review_text: Park Street is one of the busiest streets in calcutta. You can find a number of great restaurants that you must try when you are in calcutta such as - peter cat, BBQ, mocambo.

review_text: Jom-jomat, that what can be said to describe the life and the hustle - bustle of Park Street. It is a eater's paradise, with all varieties of food in all categories of price. This place though reaches it pinnacle of liveliness during the Christmas!

title: Vibrance of Kolkata
review_text: May be the most vibrant part of the biggest city in Eastern India, Kolkata. The best and famous restaurants, cafes, cake shops, bakeries, pubs, night clubs all are present here in and around Park Street . Especially the best restaurant street in Kolkata I must emphasize with all cuisine and best quality. Without these also it is a lovely street to walk around. Being a Kolkatan I still live in the moments when I used to visit here during Christmas when it is decorated beautifully or used to chill with friends at a bar or cafe. The best shopping district of Kolkata (New Market, Esplanade) is also just one stop (metro) away. So the place is just perfect for best food and then shopping. Lot of tourist attractions are also nearby Birla Planetarium, Victoria Memorial Hall, The Monument (Shaheed Minar) etc. To enjoy the vibrant Kolkata you must need to be at Park Steer for sure. More

Major bars are open throughout day and as Sun begins to set. The crowd changes swiftly and this place is filled with party mongers. Park street is full of good places to dine and paradise for people who would like to dance and drink till they drop. 
Restaurants and bars cater to all class.

Visitors will love it as I always do.

title: I have been to this place many times because I belong to the city

Many famous restaurants have their outlets by this road like Marcopolo, PeterCat, Flouries etc. You will find western flavour in this area because the British used to stay here during British Raj. St Xaviers College, Park Street cemetary are the few places you may take interest in.

title: Park Street the Heart of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is the Heart & Pride of Kolkata. way back, the new year lighting used to be great, Street were very clean. Even now this place has retain its beauty. This place if full of restaurants and nice place to be around after dinner as well.

title: Down Memory Lane
review_text:
Growing up in Kolkata during to 1950 - '60 was like a dream. However the real heart of Rocking Calcutta / Kolkata was & still is the wide street called Park Street. 
Along this famous street are the most famous restaurants & Night clubs. The famous Mocambo, Flurys , Trinkas , Kwality's & Chinese Restaurant to be found in this great City. This street also links other important locations of Kolkata, like 
Loretta School / College , Lower Circular Road , Free school Street etc towards the East & towards the East one can get to the huge Midan, Red Road, Alipore Race Course & the Zoo, not forgetting the Planetarium etc. More

title: The place in Kolkata which will give u a western touch amidst a traditional Kolkata flavor
review_text: This is a place where people generally goes out for dine outs. It has most of the traditional old and western restaurants of Kolkata. the iconic Park hotel stands in the middle of Park Street. It has the finest eateries of the city along with many bar cum restaurants.

title: Park Street is never Dark
review_text: Park street is the heart of Kolkata metro. There is no other place where the modern stands next to the old with equal grace, where one can find some thing to eat entirely depending upon the disosable amount at head. And there is a nice park to freshen up the lungs! A visit to Kolkata is never complete without a trip to Park street, one end to the other. The hallowed St Xaviers University, the park street cemetery and the Asiatic society on the other end - completes the trip.

title: This is the Rambla of Kolkata, if I dare compare with Barcelona
review_text: Park Street is the old high end hang out, very popular in the Post Independence period when Calcutta was going through great pains of political upheaval, and then recovering. Somehow many of the old restaurants and bars survived and the Oxford Bookstore is still there. One can walk off of the side streets and see a few old clubs (the Bengal Club for example), or explore a back lane running into the New Market area. Park Street is fun for people who like to explore, but not for fragile tourists!

title: Great place

title: Visit with friends
review_text: This is very interesting place forcouples. An couple can enjoy there . There is many footpath restaurant.

title: The STREET that NEVER SLEEPS
review_text:
park street is a street where you park all your tensions and rewind and relax. 
It has something for everyone. Be it the book stores to leisurely reading at oxford book shop or to the partying places galore. It has car showrooms and then the Legendary Flurys.

title: Happening place
review_text: Park street is quite a nice place to hangout with family and friends. Centrally located with loads of food and shopping choices.

title: The mother of all Streets!!!
review_text: This is the main street in Kolkata with many delicious & vintage restaurants, nightclubs, Shopping malls, schools & colleges nearby. Its located in the central part of kolkata & a must visit place in Christmas & newyear when the whole street is decorated with lights & throng by millions. It also has many prominent offices in its vicinity.

title: The Centre of Kolkata's Night Life
review_text: True Kolkata has many new shopping malls and many posh restaurants, but Park Street will always be Park Street. If you are visiting Kolkata for the first time, do take a walk down the road from St Xaviers School right up to Park Street metro station. The street can be crowded with broken pavements and panhandlers, but it has a unique vibe. This is where Kolkatans congregate for rum balls (Flurys), chicken chipolata (Mocambo), sweet and sour prawns (Bar-B-Q) and chelo kebab (Peter Cat). Listen to live music at Trinca's (where Usha Uthup once sang), drop into Oxford Book Store and try the double chicken roll at Karnani Mansion. If you have children with you, the book store has a separate wing for children's books plus there's a McDonald's nearby. Good to visit around the year, but at Christmas, Park Street turns magical. By the way, the restaurants here, although iconic, are very reasonably priced. Must visit for foodies, nostalgia lovers and visitors keen to glimpse the spirit of Kolkata. More

title: Buzzing with Life
review_text: A happening place at night, very lively with scores of families spending quality time in restaurants, bakeries, pastry and ice cream parlors......Flurrys, Au Bon Pain, etc. Even some of the best hotels are located here, like; Oberoi Grand, Park, Lalit (earlier The Great Eastern approx 200 years old). A must visit place. Check out the had crafted shoe shops.

title: Century-old glory vanished
review_text:
At the beginning when this road was built by British it was named 'Burial Ground Road' because of a cemetary situated near the east side of the road, Later it was named 'Park Street' due to a deer park built here. Though at present the name has been changed to 'Mother Teresa Sarani' by the municipal authourity. no one uses this name. Park Street started to become famous from late 1800. It was full of huge mansions and many restaurants. This street was the prime dinning area of the city even long after the independence in 1947. During British era almost all the customers of these restaurants were British and a few wealthy Indians. There were live bands in many restaurants. Since 1970 gradually Park Street started to lose it's class and charm. Many company's opened their offices in the mansions which were vacated by the British, Armenians , Parsis andd Muslims. Hundreds of shops were also opened. Since the last decade of 1900 many famous restaurants closed down. Though a number of new restaurants and cafeterias opened the character of the street changed totally. Moreover, with the opening of innumerable restaurants throughout the city Park Street seized to be the best dinning area. A few old restaurants are still operating and still maintaining the age old standard of food and service, their number is dwindling. However during weekends, holidays and festivals it's still very difficult to get inside a... At the beginning when this road was built by British it was named 'Burial Ground Road' because of a cemetary situated near the east side of the road, Later it was named 'Park Street' due to a deer park built here. Though at present the name has been changed to 'Mother Teresa Sarani' by the municipal authourity. no one uses this name. 
Park Street started to become famous from late 1800. It was full of huge mansions and many restaurants. This street was the prime dinning area of the city even long after the independence in 1947. During British era almost all the customers of these restaurants were British and a few wealthy Indians. There were live bands in many restaurants. Since 1970 gradually Park Street started to lose it's class and charm. Many company's opened their offices in the mansions which were vacated by the British, Armenians , Parsis andd Muslims. Hundreds of shops were also opened. Since the last decade of 1900 many famous restaurants closed down. Though a number of new restaurants and cafeterias opened the character of the street changed totally. Moreover, with the opening of innumerable restaurants throughout the city Park Street seized to be the best dinning area. A few old restaurants are still operating and still maintaining the age old standard of food and service, their number is dwindling. However during weekends, holidays and festivals it's still very difficult to get inside a good restaurant without reservation. For last 15 years or so Park Street is being decorated with varieties of lights from Chistmas tonew year. On 25th December, 1st January and the sunday in between Park Street becomes car-free zone. One has to walk if he or she wants to see the lights or dine. Most of the restaurants and discotheque stay opened till dawn. Nowadays it's even a very tough task to walk in Park Street after 7 pm on 25th December due to the massive crowd. I suggest one should visit Park Street on a weekday aprt from 25/12, 01/01, Saturday and Sunday. And if anyone wants to dine there during the last week of December an early reservation will be very helpful. Otherwise one has to register the name in a waiting list and has to stand outside for indefinite period for his or her turn to get a seat. More

title: This place became alive in December

title: Kolkata's Centre of Gravity
review_text: Must visit - especially in winters to feel the romance of Kolkata and old world charm! British era buildings and century old shops...Eateries, Pubs, Bookshops, Star Hotels...Don't miss the sweetmeat and mishti doi shop on the opposite side of the Post Office (Balaram Mullick and Sons)...Drop in to Oxford bookstore to browse a book and rub shoulders with Kolkata's utterly cultured people..Have a chicken roll from Kati Roll shop, have breakfast or snacks at Flury's and lunch at Kwality's or catch the crooners at Trincas while having a drink...Visit A N John for haircut ( Satyajit Ray used to frequent this place) or shake your leg at Someplace Else Disco at the Park...You would not feel bored here. title: Heart of Kolkata

title: CHRISTMAS AND NEW YEAR ON PARK STREET
review_text:
A place when we all (people living in Kolkata )are together to celebrate Christmas and New Year. I have been here with my parents too since my Childhood to witness Christmas - then it was not so grand but had lovely decoration beside The Park Hotel and another inside the compound of The Archbishops' residence (which in itself is a landmark building besides St Xavier's College). Now the celebration is much more grand with Allen park decked up with live performances and lip smacking anglo-indian cuisines and entire Park Street lit . So its a place to be with friends here during Christmas and New Year Apart from this Park Street has its charm of having the best and iconic restaurants like Flury's; Petercat; Bar B Q; Mocambo; Waldorf; Trincas; Kwality; Moulin Rouge; Oasis;Oly Pub; Tung Fong; Teej. In my Childhood going for fine dining with my parents was always at Park Street which is the Pride of Kolkata for food lovers. In the recent years there are some new Restaurants that have come up which has fortunately maintained the Standards of Quality Food on Park Street for food lovers Apart from Restaurants the famous Kolkata egg rolls by the roadside is yummy as are the Puchkas (pani puri) which you can also enjoy if you have reached a bit early and then head for dinner in one of the iconic restaurants The famous Oxford book store; The Park Hotel... A place when we all (people living in Kolkata )are together to celebrate Christmas and New Year. I have been here with my parents too since my Childhood to witness Christmas - then it was not so grand but had lovely decoration beside The Park Hotel and another inside the compound of The Archbishops' residence (which in itself is a landmark building besides St Xavier's College). Now the celebration is much more grand with Allen park decked up with live performances and lip smacking anglo-indian cuisines and entire Park Street lit . So its a place to be with friends here during Christmas and New Year 

Apart from this Park Street has its charm of having the best and iconic restaurants like Flury's; Petercat; Bar B Q; Mocambo; Waldorf; Trincas; Kwality; Moulin Rouge; Oasis;Oly Pub; Tung Fong; Teej. In my Childhood going for fine dining with my parents was always at Park Street which is the Pride of Kolkata for food lovers. In the recent years there are some new Restaurants that have come up which has fortunately maintained the Standards of Quality Food on Park Street for food lovers 

Apart from Restaurants the famous Kolkata egg rolls by the roadside is yummy as are the Puchkas (pani puri) which you can also enjoy if you have reached a bit early and then head for dinner in one of the iconic restaurants 

The famous Oxford book store; The Park Hotel ; Giggles; A N John are some of the places I have seen while growing in Kolkata and still remains my favourite place to stroll in Kolkata on any evening round the Year - so beat Park Street to experience it yourself More

title: The life of the city!!!
review_text:
Hi Guys!!! 
I had an opportunity to be here in Kolkata for some work and so following my tradition of visiting the must-go places wherever i work, I took a cab straight after work. 

It was 9pm, its Prime time Buzz!!! 
Its teeming with the youth of Kolkata. 

The Park hotel is the best property on the street. 

Thers shiny restaurants on both sides of the lane here like 
The famous "Trinca's" 
Bar B Q 
Mocambos restaurant 
Mamagoto 
Barbeque Nation 
Au Bon Pain patasserie 
And many more.... 

Its the happening spot of the city. 
In the Park Hotel, They have thier own club Tantra, which is just amazing. 
Great crowd and amazing music. 

You caan also chill out in "Someplace Else" 
Its basically a lounge but they have a good english touch to it. 
They got live band performances on somedays of the week. 

This place is lively till like mindnight and a little post that. 

Overall, 
If you want to spend some quality time in kolkata at night, one must visit this place. 

Thanks for reading and Enjoy life!!!! More

title: The food street of Kolkata
review_text:
Park street is located right at the middle of Kolkata. This is usually a hang out place of kolkata people though few offices and colleges and institutions also there. 
The world famous Asiatic Society is situated at the junction of Park Street and Jawharlal Neheru Road. Famous Calcutta museum is also just beside Park Street. St. Xaviours college is also situated here. Park street cemetery is a famous cemetery. 
This street is famous for its restaurants and food stalls. You will get every kind of delicious food here... from biryani to sizzler. There are 2 very famous shop where you will get rolls.. kusum and hotkati. 
Last but not the least.. park hotel is also there. More

Why visit this place? 

If you love Shopping. 
Street food is excellent. 
Crowd, but that's what its famous for. 

Why not to visit this place? 

If you don't like happening places. 

Any recommendations ? 

Try Biryani, Kathi rolls and Puchkas. 

USEFUL TIPS / HACKS : 

While shopping, shopkeepers know you're a tourist by the way you talk and they charge you more. Always quote a minimum of 40% less than what is quoted by them If they ask 100 rupees, you say 60. And your life will become easy :)

title: Oxford Book and Tea Store

To think that St. Theresa walked through every area of the building and me having walked there as well left me feeling very blessed that I got the opportunity to see the home of our beloved St. Theresa of Kolkata. May she rest in Peace.

title: Old but remains true
review_text: There is nothing like Park street anywhere in the world. Its character changes as you walk along it. To begin with, there is the famous Oxford Book Store where you can browse for hours. Then you can get drunk at Olympia, have any kind of food from smoked hilsa to chelo kabab in some of the finest eating places. Then there is the grave St Xaviers college. And during Christmas and the new year, millions descend on Park street but there aren't instances of uncivil behviour. Park Street encapsulates a bygone era as well as the best of modernity.

title: The heart of Kolkata - Park street
review_text: If you are in Kolkata and not visited Park Street then you have not got The pulse of this huge city. review_text: All my clients offices located in Park Street , I have been visiting this place last 10 years on my business trips to kolkata. Hotels, Restaurants,Shopping Centers,Corporate Offices,Book Shops and many many other attractions makes Park Street a finest place for business traveler.

title: Happening Street of Kolkata!
review_text:
Park street is one of the most happening street of Kolkata , consisting of Shopping malls , pubs , bars, spa, fast food and so many things to do. Best time to visit is evening where you will find colourful time along with local touch. 
Happy travelling!

title: You must come here.
review_text: If you've come to visit Kolkata and not come to park Street,you are losing out on some of the finest ancient but modernized culture if Kolkata. Some people might consider Park Street the heart of Kolkata. The buildings in which most of the stores are located belong to the British ages and are some of the prettiest in the city. You can binge in coffee shops like classic Flury's or the recent Au Bon Pain. There are several restaurants along with KFC and McDonald's for those who are interested. Best restaurants are BBQ, Mocambo and food at the Park hotel. There is the Oxford bookstore which may lure the bookworms. If you are interested,there is also the Park Cemetery where you can get a graveyard tour,but remember to check timings. This place is a must if you're visiting Kolkata. More

title: A street that remains happening forever
review_text:
If you are in Kolkata for the first time, make it a point to be at Park Street. If you are foodie then try out those good restaurants on that Street or its adjacent ones, Peter Cat, Flurys. There are night clubs, pubs. It is a happening place and you can pick what time of the day you want to be there based on what you like. 
Throughout the day you will find lots of people walking on pavements. So you Kolkata will accompany you on Park Street. 
I would have rated this Street 5/5, I keep 1 point away because of the constant rate of vehicular movement and also difficulty to find a place to park anywhere nearby. If you are visitor in town, try taxis to this place. More

title: THE HEART THROB OF KOLKATA
review_text:
If you come to Kolkata and do not have a walk down Park Street, you have missed something. Way back in the seventeenth century, the road was known as Burial Ground Road. This road stared on today's Chowringhee Road, renamed J.L. Nehru Road and ended at the South Park Street Cemetery. Horse drawn funeral corteges could come up to a certain distance and the coffin had to be carried for the rest of the distance on foot. Subsequently, it was named Park Street as the road ran through a deer park of Sir Elijah Impey, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court in Calcutta from 1773 to 1789, Now, it is known as Mother Teressa Sarani and connects J.L. Nehru Road with the seven point crossing at Park Circus. Till the late end of eighties, entertainment meant Park Street. Many noted musicians had played at popular night spots such as Trinca's, Blue Fox, Mocambo and Moulin Rouge. Names like Pam Craine, Louis Banks and Usha Utthup come to ones mind when one refers to the Park Street of those days. Park Street has many notable showrooms, and several notable buildings such as the Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, Calcutta, a Seventh-day Adventist Church,to name a few. There are lots of restaurants on both sides of this road serving all sorts of cuisine - Continental, Chinese, Thai, North Indian, South Indian, fast food joints and the Park Circus end one will find... If you come to Kolkata and do not have a walk down Park Street, you have missed something. 

Way back in the seventeenth century, the road was known as Burial Ground Road. This road stared on today's Chowringhee Road, renamed J.L. Nehru Road and ended at the South Park Street Cemetery. Horse drawn funeral corteges could come up to a certain distance and the coffin had to be carried for the rest of the distance on foot. 

Subsequently, it was named Park Street as the road ran through a deer park of Sir Elijah Impey, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court in Calcutta from 1773 to 1789, 

Now, it is known as Mother Teressa Sarani and connects J.L. Nehru Road with the seven point crossing at Park Circus. 

Till the late end of eighties, entertainment meant Park Street. Many noted musicians had played at popular night spots such as Trinca's, Blue Fox, Mocambo and Moulin Rouge. Names like Pam Craine, Louis Banks and Usha Utthup come to ones mind when one refers to the Park Street of those days. 

Park Street has many notable showrooms, and several notable buildings such as the Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, Calcutta, a Seventh-day Adventist Church,to name a few. 

There are lots of restaurants on both sides of this road serving all sorts of cuisine - Continental, Chinese, Thai, North Indian, South Indian, fast food joints and the Park Circus end one will find the famous Biryani restaurant Arsalan. 

However, in the last 20 years, many new restaurants, malls, 5-star hotels and nightclubs have come up in other areas of the city and Park Street has lost much of its earlier sheen. 

Come Christmas and New Year, one will still find the Park Street of olden days decked up with lights and welcoming happy revellers through out the night. More

title: Diners' paradise at Kolkata
review_text: The street is famous for a number of good eateries viz. Park Hotel, Mocambo, Trincas, Moulin Rouge, Peter Cat, Flurry's, McDonald and so many others. The street connects to J.N.Road in the western side and A.J.C.Bose Rd. in the eastern side. Kolkata's night life is mostly around this place. Mother House ( St. Teressa) is not very far from here. Kolkatans throng here on the 24th. Dec night and 31st Dec. night to enjoy.

title: Pretty Park Street
review_text: This is nearest location to my hotel heera where i stayed 3 days , park street is a good shopping location , i had to attend conference hotel the parkk which is located in park street, i enjoyed street food which is available every where in park street.

This will always be the best because of the nostalgia attached. You can have the classic English breakfast at flurys, sumptuous dinner at other great restaurants, or just have a drink.
