review_text: It is a nice posh area with lotsa eateries, heritage buildings etc. A cauldron of new and old. Saw a Lamborghini and an Ambassador parked next to each other.

title: A lively street by day or night
review_text: I visited this street with Calcutta Walks. The guide was thoughtful and informative. The visit to the cemetery took us away from the hustle and bustle of the street into a historical time warp. Here were family graves from the 1700's which demonstrated the impact of the development of trade with Calcutta by the British on family lives. A very moving experience.

title: Can be missed
review_text: This street is mixed and not what I expected. The shopping is not that good. If you have limited time , don't bother visiting Park St.

title: A very good place for shopping particularly for Sarees
review_text: Park street is one of the prime location for shopping in Kolkata specially for sarees. One should not miss this place while visiting this great traditional city.

title: Downtown of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is considered as the north and south devider of Kolkata. North of Park Street is considered as north Kolkata and similar the south of Park Street. This is the central district of Kolkata. It is also a commercial district having number of offices and a hosts of eating joints. The whole Street is decorated by colourful lighting during Christmas and New year celebration.

title: Park Street, the street with all major restaurants in Kolkata
review_text:
Park Street starts from Mallick Bazaar at one point and end at Chowringhee Road at the other, the length is around 2.5 Km. 
It has few best eateries cum Bar in Kolkata. 
Peter Cat, Flurys, Mocambo, Bar B Q, Trincas, Barbeque Nation, Moulin Rouge,Tung Font and Park Hotel, to name a few. 
It houses St Xavier's college , Loreto College, Allen Park and few good Schools like Assembly of God Church, St Xavier's Collegiate School, Apeejay school,The seventh day Adventist Sr secondary school. 

It also houses the famous Asiatic Society at the Chowringhee end and Park St cemetery near Mallick bazar. 
It is also the habitat of one of the best Pathological Diagnostic centres in Eastern India-Pakistan Dr Roy and Trivedi. 
The interesting part is, no public transport plies through this 2.5 Km stretch other than private vehicle and self walking. More

title: Taste of old wine
review_text: Magestical, iconic street of kolkata, it is the nerve center of the central business district of Kolkata, where everything.is available,especially the street towards park street metro station,filled with great restaurents, hotels, bakeries, pubs, street food etc, there are many bylanes emerging from park street like russell street,camac street where majority of offices and business is located.Just walking up and down this street would give you immence pleasure, if you happen to be having visited the place more than once.

title: The heart of Kolkata...
review_text: This is the best place to stay if visiting Kolkata...Shopping, fine dining, foodie hub and well connected by the Metro.

title: One of the iconic streets
review_text: One of the iconic streets of kolkata where in you can get every thing.especially the street towards park metro station/park hotel is filled with great restaurents.many bi lanes emerging from park street like russell street,camac street etc are also quite interesting.

title: CBD
review_text:
This is the central business district of the city, infact it is the most important area of the entire eastern region. 

The place is full of offices and equally good for shopping and fooding. Everything is available there and is very easily accessible.

title: Best for shopping and eating
review_text:
One of the most famous and busiest street of Kolkata, home for many great showrooms for saree and suits. If you have come to Kolkata to shop then it would be incomplete without visiting Park Street. 
Also it has numerous restaurants and cafes which are quite popular.

title: Street with buzz
review_text: One of the main streets from the raj era. High end shopping and restaurants, many catering to western clients and speak English.

title: Popular with Place for Saturday Night
review_text: Very popular for party night. Everyone has busy at Saturday night. For romance it's a perfect place..

title: Best place for shopping
review_text: This is one place in calcutta where you'll find everything, one stop destinationfor shopping,eating and exploring old lanes of this city where you can find wall grafitti and traditional food of the east india. Also it opens in the morning around 8am and goes on till night 9pm and has wide variety of places in the by-lanes and truely will make your time worth spending.

title: Visit during Christmas time
review_text: The park street crossing and surrounding places like allen park is beautiful during Christmas season. Please come to this place during Christmas time. However the crossing is somehow risky due to fast traffic. Also an accident prone area. So be cautious also.

title: Fully corporate
review_text: This is the mostly corporate area of the region and mostly developed area as per my knowledge. You will get good accommodation and foods with brand and branded shopping experience from here.

title: Live and Young Street
review_text: The only place in the heart of Kolkata-Park street, where we can see all the different culture, class, environment, right from the younger generation to middle age and even the older age enjoy in full at park street. very lively and friendly ambiance at Park street. if any body is visiting Kolkata please visit Park street, other wise your visit to kolkata in incomplete.

title: Happening place
review_text: It's very beautifully decorated with lots of lights during Christmas and new year. The place has very good restaurants around.

title: Mother Teresa Avenue
review_text: Park Street, renamed is a long avenue.Main attraction part is nearer to Esplanade area.There are some historical buildings such as Asiatic society,St.Xaviers college & park st.symmetry where Dirozio,an educator was burried.The street, never refuses anyone is always young.When the night is deep,is always young.It is the leading dining & pub destination.It is the unique place for fashionable shopping & for readers,Oxford bookstore.Park st. means renewal of life irrespective of any age.Specially in last 10days of any year,it is fabulous.Specially mentioning Flurys food quality,Tantra for disco.

title: Park Street a Nostalgia inside the Kolkata.
review_text: I am the son of soil.I use to roam the lane & bye lane of Park Street and feeling very much nostalgic.I am a man of 56.Whenever I go to Park Street I become a man of 22 years. Every shop,resturant and hotels attract me like a magnet .Its night life & its colonial cuisine and heritage of British culture & sculpture remember me that good old days when Park Street was the center of Britishers & Bengali Babus must dayout place.I feel proud to be a Bengali that till date park street is gorgeous.

title: "Charm of kolkatta "
review_text:
Must visit street in kolkatta 
Bustling with age old confectionery Flury, 
For Chinese food lovers Bar-b-q, kusum Kathi rolls !!! Oxford book store with cup of tea ? other restaurants to try Peter cat, Hakuna Ma Tata , Mocambo!! For Sandesh Misti doi, sweet curd visit Ballaram Mulick sweets joint!! 

And at one end do visit Asiatic society on 1 Park street.. and on other end visit South Park cemetery!!

title: Too crowded
review_text: Shopping and dining options of all sorts on a street which has lots of vehicles and people. Maybe overrated.

title: The street that never sleeps !!
review_text:
The most happening place in Kolkata. Park Street is Kolkata's leading dining destination, with many restaurants and pubs; shopping destination with showrooms to casual road vendors. Just be prepared for the crowd :) I went there in Dec (was visiting Kolkata from Perth, Australia) and and it was decorated with Christmas lights as a sight that one would not like to miss. Just Perfect !! 
Christmas memories one would like to take back home.

title: Good place
review_text: park street is lime light of Kolkata.lots of tourist spot such as zoo,Victoria memorial,kalighat etc near to this place.lots of budget hotel are here to stay.

title: Main Street in Calcutta...
review_text:
One of the main streets in Calcutta, you can find various kind of transportation and restaurants here, also Vodafone for sim cards ;) 
One place that I would really recommend to visit is the Oxford bookshop. There are a chai shop and souvenir shop inside, it is very easy to spend few hours there.

title: The heart of Kolkata
review_text: With the street decorations and various old eateries,Park Street has something to offer everyone.Though for people from other major metros in India, the brands etc might not present anything new but the distinct buzz around the place especially during festivals is worth experiencing.

title: Beautiful street lined with chic stores
review_text: This is one of the iconic streets among the cities of India, famous for the range of shops and restaurants to be found here. The street itself is wide and beautifully maintained, and during the midday period when I went there it was uncrowded. The pavements are wide and it is a pleasure to stroll along, window shopping or just waiting for your table at the crowded restaurants.

title: Historical
review_text: Very nice place to see in western part of India. very amazing to see with many attractive building and thank you.

title: Walk down Park Street on Christmas Eve 2016
review_text: I have walked/driven on Park Street numerous times during my visits to kolkata and was always impressed with the variety of dining and shopping options available. Surely it is the main street of Kolkata. However in December 2016 i was there for christmas and was wondering where all the hundreds of people walking on Jawaharlal Nehru Road were going to. Decided to take a walk on christmas eve with my wife and younger daughter. Was really shocked that such a sight can be in India, More so in Kolkata. The entire stretch of Park Street begining from J.L.Nehru toad junction was lit up with bright lighs and hundreds of people both young and old were thronging the footpaths on both sides , while cars were leisurely moving taking in the wonderful lights of the decorations that adorned the whole street. It did not feel at all this was Christmas in India. The shop associations in collabration with the Government did a excellent job to light up the entire area. Police presence and organisation was Top Class and one felt secure amongst the crowds. Surely will do it once more if in Kolkata during Christmas. BYW the street was lit up for a good Two to three weeks from before christmas to after New year. If you do not like crowds then visit any day other than Christmas eve and day or new years eve and day. More

title: Heart Of Kolkata...
review_text: This palace is the heart of kolkata city. In chritsmas day and new year eve all people come all over kolkata to celebrate. You can get too many hotels, bar, disco.

title: The most happening street of Kolkata
review_text: If you are at Kolkata, Part Street is a must visit place. Enjoy coffee at Flurry's and Dinner at Bar-B-Q or Mocambo.

title: My Park Street Office
review_text: Key location in Kolkata with all type of Restaurants/Metro Station/Main location of Kolkata and easy to go any where in kolkata from this location.25th December is special days every year

title: Nothing extrordinary..
review_text: It is one of the busiest streets in Kolkata & most happening place. We went there on the new year eve and it was fully crowded! If you are not interested in pub-hopping you can probably skip this place!

title: Food street of Calcutta
review_text:
It is well known since inception of Calcutta. Earlier it was frequented 
by Anglo indians & europeans.But 
it is now equally popular amongs all 
creeds. Many old Eateries of name 
& fame are located here. Nightlife 
is also vibrant here. Alas , no more 
cabaret due to govt rules but bands 
prevail.

title: A must if in calcutta
review_text: All the good restaurants are located on park street, its the only place to get a beer! We ate in a very good chinese and several indian restaurants on park street! Mcdonalds is here too!

title: A business area
review_text: Best place in Kolkata for a cheap, affordable and best quality product shopping. Clothes are best for buy in lowest price all over Kolkata. Wholesale market is very crowdy.

title: Park street hustle bustle of the metro shopping
review_text: If u adventurous and can do narrow streets and push n shove it's got everything from fast food too street food alittle for every one shopping similar to the Thai night markets with less organization of cross watch your set the road side restaurants dump everything on the pavement and nasty smelling gutters ....Otherwise a quick tip whatever price u quoted cut it in half there's that much bargaining room

title: A must attraction
review_text: I loved this peaceful cemetery jam packed fill of every sort of tomb of the British, and am sure a few others, from tiny babies (many) to grandees. Very interesting reading the inscriptions. Spent not long enough there.

title: This is in-your-face life
review_text: A moving mass of humanity, especially at peak hour. It has cafes, relatively cheap restaurants, pavement shops selling junk and every sight is eye popping. Crossing the road is an adventure, as no vehicle stops. Indians use horns instead of brakes.

title: Charming Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is where u can taste of Kolkata. U can roam around, shop, go for street food or fine dine. This street got everything. Best place to be with friends or as couple or even solo.

title: Great place to walk and find popular spots to eat
review_text: Park street was the first place my friends and TripAdvisor recommended to visit in Kolkata. There are lot of spots to get a coffee, snacks, and meals. The best times to visit is around christmas and new years when the whole street is lit and decorated

title: Nostalgic location with some oldest restaurants around
review_text:
Park Street is one of the nostalgic locations of Kolkata which reminds of the British era. Huge mansions, broad roads and best bakery in Town. The street truly reflects the soul of Kolkata. It houses some of the evergreen restaurants and hotels like Moulin Rouge, Trinkas, Peter Cat, The Park and above all Flurys. Probably the best place for English Breakfast so far I have been. 
And if you are reader hop on to Oxford Bookstore right in the middle of the street. Its a Paradise for book lovers. Inside there is a small coffee place where you can relax and read.

title: Hustle Place for the Youth
review_text: This place offers all the things to the youths. Eateries, shopping streets, Fine Dine areas & every thing a youngster will love. Get down at park street metro & explore.

title: Heart of Calcutta
review_text:
The park street is the most happening place of Calcutta and houses number of restaurants, corporate offices, Book stores, Market and hotels. 
If you are in Calcutta and want to explore Calcutta and want to have a local taste of it, you must stay at park street. Walking down the busy lanes of calcutta, one can easily spot the British era buildings. Calcutta is still very influenced from British architecture which is pretty visible. Also, there are n number of restaurants and book stores and roll shops. Must visit area of Calcutta.

title: Awesome Location, Great Place for an evening
review_text:
1. Nice restaurants at this location 
2. Nightlife is good e.g Park 
3. Street Food specially Kathi Roll worth trying 
4. A very pleasant location to stay as have many good hotels nearby

title: Busy as you would expect
review_text: The street is a busy with many yellow taxis, tramps, bicycles, buses and pedestrians. I was there after a rainy day and it was muddy. So make sure that you put on your walking shoes instead of sandles or slippers.

title: The buzzing lane of Kolkata
review_text: The place is evergreen,every time I come and see and roam around the street it reminds me of the amazing energy and liveliness ,it's been like this for decades ,the restaurants roll shops bars magazine stores flurrys all are an integral part of this street ,must go place if you are in Kolkata

title: The most happening place in Kolkata for a tourist, even locals
review_text: This is a place where excitements never cease. If you are in X Mas or New year time, there are additional features like roadside stalls , decorations all around. Otherwise you have eateries, some like Flury's are a century old, pubs, Chinese and Mughlai restaurants, sweet shops, Trinca's where Big B And Usha Uthup used to perform in early years. Saree shops, offices, Epitome of tradition"New Market", Shoe marts are just a few steps away from the main street. Definitely a half day activity, justice will be to devote at least a full day!

title: historic walking street of kolkata
review_text: Park street is a must visit for a visitor to kolkata, my first visit was almost 40 years back and even now you find the street reflecting nostalgia, busy with lots of shopping , souveniers , food, taking pictures.

title: Market
review_text: A busy ,Crowed market .Many famous brand shops are here.A good shopping street ,many famous eateries are also there

title: Park street is Fantastic and superb
review_text: We visited 25th of December 2016wao kiya nazara hain? Park street is decorated look like a London Street.whole Street was full of people.everyone enjoyed restaurants every tables is full we wait more than 1 hours for table.really that moment of park Street is real memorable.

title: Crowded area in kolkata
review_text: It's a great place or area at kolkata, fully enjoying place lots of hotels bar and old building by British colonial

title: Good place to visit, central part of city
review_text: Central part of city full of restaurants and shops, the road to park street from New town is traffic prone and can take up to 2 hours as there is a flyover under construction and the same will take another year to complete, way back to new town is better as the flyover on return is complete and operational.

title: Shopping and Food
review_text: Kolkata's most happening street. Shopping of sarees,ladies dress,menswear etc may be done here. Its famous for various restaurants,live music, pubs, hotels etc. One may find good number of day spas here offering various therapies and exclusive men's entertainment.

title: Calcutta, Good Food, Great Ambience!
review_text: There are a plethora of restaurants in Park street, a lot many interesting shops as well. But what makes it stand apart is its old world charm and the potential to completely blow you away with its ambience.

title: Fun
review_text: Lot of funs are available here clubs disc pubs if you want to go there thats a great idea. Really enjoyed.

title: Park street
review_text: If you are old residential of kolkata then your lots of memory attached with this place..now days this place is crowed lot and lots of activity happen here like market ...rally ...program etc

title: British architecture meets modern India
review_text: I am a lover of architecture and especially of heritage. It was fascinating to see beautiful British edifices being restored and seamlessly adapted to the modern age of businesses. Lovely street to shop, eat, read and be merry.

title: Busy street in Kolkata
review_text: Busy street in Kolkata with churches and schools but gets busier near the park with a few restaurants and bars and plenty of street food stalls

title: a piece of london in kolkata
review_text: i used to go here on every xmas eve,it is really looks like london in that time,all thr street decorated with light and many ore,here many disco and bar and club where you can enjoy a lot.

title: Shopping and foodie
review_text: It has grest restaurants and has shopping malls. This is J.L. Road in central kolkata. I am a regular visitor and it also as colleges and Hotels.

title: the most happening place of kolkata
review_text: this is times square of kolkata. most happening place full of different types of restaurant,hotels,bars,disco,park anything you say you will find it. and specially from 20 th dec to 5 th of january every year its look like at its best full of party enthusiast. must visit

title: Good for exclusive Saree shopping and good restaurants
review_text: VERY VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: When you exchange money, and receive Indian currencies in new 500 and 1000 Rs notes, make sure you check each and every 500 and 1000 note, if there is any ink mark, pencil mark, or any other damage, DO NOT ACCEPT IT, because no shop, no restaurant, no hotels and no other institutions (including banks) will accept them; your money will be totally invalid. I am mentioning it, because I am a first hand sufferer of this problem.

title: Buzzing Street
review_text: Great buzz on this Street with some Excellent food places like Moulin Rouge, Mocambo, Flurry's and drinking places like the Olly Club and all the aforementioned eating places.

title: nice place
review_text: it is a place from 7 minutes from dharmatala bus stand and from 25 minutes from belgachi ftom metro. good place

title: Lots of movement and places to see
review_text: Great area to see all types of Kolkata life. New Market is just up the street. Lots of movement all around this area. During the Christmas and New Year Season, lights are all around. Walk around, take an Auto-Rickshaw, take a taxi. Try it all!

title: Most happening street in Kolkata
review_text: This is a most lively place in the heart of Kolkata just near to other chief attractions of the city like Victoria Memorial, National Museum, etc. This street is full of restaurants and bars, from book store to antique show-piece outlets, to best of beauty parlours. This is an attraction spot for most of the city youths for hangouts.

title: Good place for Shopping
review_text: Found this place neat and good compared with other parts of Kolkata.You should check quality of leather goods before bargain and buying other wise you will end up buying cheap goods.Before buying visit some more shops and buy it .

title: Food hub
review_text: Many restaurants of different cuisines and budget are available. Pete Kat, marco polo in chaina, flurys, Bar-b-q- nations, arsalan etc. are great.

title: Night lights
review_text: It was good to see the Park Street at it's usual vibrant colours, specially at night. it was busy and noisy. But we love it as it is. The Christmas and new years lights are still on at night. we thought we will miss the lights this year, but luckily it stayed.

title: Stroll along Park Street
review_text: It is a MUST for any one visiting Kolkata to get a feel of liberal culture of Kolkata supported by the down trodden side of the city population; every body you meet on this street look happy and the numerous eating places for all kind of budgets window shopping at Antique shops, Book sellers both on street and outlets , heritage buildings . wlel known disco at The Park hotel and a lot more to see and enjoy -- may be 2hr investment

title: Best place to hang out with buddies.
review_text: Hang out with friends & hope in to neumerous bars & restaurants to have great time.Hang out with your spouse for a great variety of shopping experiance.

title: An evening in Kolkata
review_text: Park St is a must do for anyone visiting Kolkata. A number of storied destinations beckon, including eateries (a number of whom have been around for generations) to cater to every palate and purse; and watering holes of assorted kinds.

title: Park Street.
review_text: .Park Street(Mother Teresa Sarani Marg)" is definitely the best decorated street in entire India during the year end festivities of Christmas and New Year akin to major City's of the Western and First world Country's. Visited Allen Park which organizes various functions during the Christmas/New Year.All the best Nightclubs and restaurants of Kolkata are situated on Park Street.

title: Walk thru
review_text: Nice illumination, great weather nice stroll down the road. Had a hunger stop at kusum rolls, gr8. Must visit when in kolkata

title: Happening, classic, modern
review_text: Most happening place in Calcutta. Mixture of a old classic heritage and modern architectural style. Most of the popular dine in places are located here. You will also find brand shops to do shopping. Some very good pubs are also located here. Definitely a must visit place during your stay in Calcutta.

title: Busy street
review_text: This very busy street is studded with restaurants, bars and interesting things to see. I was fortunate to visit during Christmas time when the street is lit up and extremely festive.

title: Unexpectedly Beautiful !
review_text: This was the first time I had visited this part of Kolkata in the evening and to my great surprise comes up a street which is full of colourful LED lights all throughout. Completely contrasting to Old Kolkata, this is where the young Kolkatians come to life as the sun sets down. I was pleased to visit the Park Street and spend one of the best evenings in Kolkata !!!

title: Gr8 place to Roam.
review_text: Gr8 place to wander. There are many restaurants and pubs. Esplanade is at walkable distance. You can do shopping and roam in Park Street or vice versa. Easy accessible by metro and bus.

The most famous district of parkstreet . One of the most pretty and well maintained roads of Calcutta. It has good restaurants and cafeterias . One of the famous 4-star hotels -'The Park' is situated at the deck of this road

title: Foodies place
review_text: This street is full of restaurants, cafés and hotels. You can find big names such as Rajdhani and cream centre to small vendors such as puchkawalas, fruit kulfiwala and jhalmuriwala. Do not miss having a plate of puchka and fruit kulfi. It is tasty and different. You can get jain food here too.

title: The pub street of Kolkata !!
review_text: The mecca for pub crawlers and revellers, this place is quintessential victorian Kolkata. Adorned on both sides by century old buildings, you can find all kinds of places to wine and dine, right from road side roll joints to five star night clubs. Must visit when in town.

title: Food Street
review_text: It has lots of eateries in the street. U have trincas, flury, Rajasthani, McDonald, Bar B Q Nation and Kolkata Street food. Two evenings spent walking and eating was really enjoyed by whole family. It is well connected by road and metro. Must visit place in the city.

title: True spirit of City of Joy !
review_text: Visit to the street anytime of the year is a must for all fun lovers. Walking down the street during CHRISTMAS celebrations is an unforgettable experience. It is something to be experienced. The joy , the celebration, the enjoyment, the excitement ... all mind blowing.

title: Always my favorite
review_text: Christmas and New Year celebration at its best at this place. Music, food and crowd will ensure high vibration touch everyone's frequency. An all nighter for sure. Must visit.

title: Great place to spend your evening
review_text: Park street the one place is Calcutta which is best for food parties and entertainment.. I was there around Christmas .... And the whole street was decorated amazingly with lights... It looked like mini Vegas... Street filled with best restaurants, bar, night clubs, hotels... It has everything ... Truly the heart of Kolkata

title: The historic restaurant street of Kolkata
review_text:
For over half a century, Park Street has remained the 'eat street' of Kolkata. With its several restaurants - from cheap eats to fine dining, Park Street caters to all types of food lovers. 

It is the must visit place during the Christmas Carnival when it is decked with lights and lively with entertainment shows. 

Some of the popular places to eat/visit in/near Park Street - Flury's, Peter Cat, Mocambo, Someplace Else, Kwality, Trincas, Oly Pub, Bar-B-Q, and Oxford Bookstore.

title: Nostalgic feeling while walking through part street today
review_text: Christmas & New Year decoration is still there on the road, gives you a nostalgic feeling while you walk down this road in the evening.

title: Busiest thoroughfare in Kolkata
review_text:
During my year end trip to Kolkata along with parents, we got to Visit Mother Teresa's House at Park street. Entire street was beautifully lit for Christmas and New year celebrations. 

Lot of branded shops, restaurants etc., are available in this street. It was the busiest thoroughfare in Kolkata..

title: Fantastic must see during xmas
review_text: One of the must see places. Beautifully lit during xmas. Is very crowded. But which place isn't. Try flurry s bakery and balram Mullick sweet shop. Try street food on Russel st.

title: Christmas light spectacular
review_text:
The Christmas lights on Park Street make Bond Street lights in London pale into insignificance. 

About halfway down, there is a small park that has been transformed into a Christmas grotto, complete with nativity scene. Wonderful! The Indians really know how to decorate for Christmas.

title: Park Street
review_text: We were staying at the Kolkata Grand Hotel so a short walk to Park Street mainly to experience a Indian MacDonald's. Which was very good. No beef burgers though!

title: Prime Hot spot for coming to Kolkata
review_text:
The whole Street packs oll topend posh restaurants, diners, cafes, and shopping point. Comes almost centre of the whole city hence far from nowhere. 
Not at all to be missed of you are visiting Kolkata.

title: An iconic street so synonymous to Kolkata .
review_text: It's now lit 365 days like Christmas. It's a nostalgic just to walk from end to end . Many well known restaurant dot the footpath. A must visit.

title: Its The Party Street
review_text: The quintessential happening street of Calcutta. Though the architectural character of (the structures of) the street is fast changing but a good part of it is still dotted by buildings of the raj era. Landmarks such as The Asiatic Society Building, The Park Hotel, Flury's , St. Xavier's College (my Alma Mater) are on this very street. The street changes its character beyond the Flury's if one traverses from west to east. This street is also famous for the food joints / restaurants dotting from The Park up to the Flury's - that's on the western flank. The eastern flank is full of shops (retail as well as wholesale) selling traditional Indian attire in Zardozi, especially for women. More

title: Extra special at Christmas and New Year
review_text: Park Street, Calcutta's original food street, looks extra special with scintillating lights during the Kolkata Christmas Festival and the New Year. Beautiful visual displays add to its charm every evening. The restaurants and nightclubs are a perennial attraction. But come December-January, this is the place to be!

title: The heart of kolkata
review_text: Park st. Is a place where people love to walk , gather , gossip . Also each and every occasion park street makeup differently . Shopping as also good over there specially for bridal, but a bit expensive then other markets / malls sometimes.

title: good food, crowded
review_text: We were there during Christmas break, so it was very crowded. It was impressive to see all the Christmas decorations. Lots of restaurants but very difficult to get in without reservations,

title: Brilliantly lit up in the evenings
review_text: Park street was a foodies delight with various food options right from bakeries, Barbecque, local Bengali cuisines and not to forget sweet shops. The street looked lively in the evening with all the Christmas and New Year lightings.

title: Happening place for foods
review_text:
This is good area of city. 
Good restaurants are their. like Gangaur ,Raj dhani, 
MacDonald, & so many...... 
Even street food is very good like puchkawalla, & 
Jalmuri, kulfi, ice cream parlour so on....... 
Many shopping is also their. 
2 hours can spend easily.

title: Busy side of kolkata
review_text: This place is known for restaurants and shopping malls. Its a bit expensive area. Mocambo, Quality and BBQ.

title: The beating heart of Kolkata
review_text: With bookshops and restaurants and pubs and other shops, Park Street has remained the throbbing heart of Kolkata for decades.

title: Park Street On Christmas Week..
review_text: An otherwise busy street, plying with office goers (most of British era Companies, banks and corporates have HQ offices here)..was throbbing with activity..with masses of people, sellers of Christmas decoration materials and lights all over the place..

title: Park Street
review_text: Always a pleasure to wander along this street, visit good quality restaurants, hotels and the famous bookshop

title: Reminiscent of British Era in India!
review_text: Park street is the icon of Kolkata, which gives the glimpses of Colonial Architecture during British Era. This more than 200 years old street is one of the most lively place in Kolkata with various eateries and restaurants around like Moulin Rouge, Barbeque Nation etc. This place is must visit during Christmas and New Year as the whole area is lit and looks awesome during night.

title: Christmas time !! FUN TIME !! PARK STREET IT IS
review_text: this street has always been known for its christmas revelry. now it is very well lit and hosts a live show at the garden where it is a christmas mela - a fun filled evening strolling down this street is a must

title: Vibey
review_text:
This street is vibey. 
Lots of restaurants and some shopping available here . The street is lit up at night . Very crowded at night .

title: Chirstmas Celebrations
review_text: Visited Park Street on the Christmas Day. It's great fun to explore the culture of Kolkata. Once you step into Park Street on Christmas, you cease to belong to any particular community. Thousands thronged the illuminated corridor leading to Free School Street, Russell Street, Rafi Ahmed Kidwai Road and Camac Street. It is just the kind of Christmas memories one would cherish throught the life.

title: Awesomm lively place
review_text: We visited this place close to New Years and the place was buzzing with lighting and all pomp & show! Great ambience and decent crowd! Fit for all nightlife lovers! You can visit the popular clubs like Tantra, Roxy etc or go to live music venues like someplace else around or just take a stroll of the buzzing streets full of eating joints and limited street food! Overall a great place to spend the evening in Kolkatta!

title: A street with places to eat on either sides
review_text: Generally speaking its a street with a lot of restaurants on either side. Specifically speaking its a great place to be around Christmas with all the light decorations and the festive spirit. Very crowded, noisy and bustling with life. Houses the famous Flurrys Bakery.

title: MOST LOVED IN CALCUTTA
review_text: This locality is probably the Chamelon of Calcutta. The same area, the same buildings , the same people transform themselves during different occasions. Whether it be Durga Puja, or Happy Streets, or Christmas this area is always among the top on the list of Calcuttans. A lot of restaurants are there. A slight walk might be appreciated. Nice place

title: Most lively place in Kolkata
review_text: I remembered being here in 1986 and wanted to relive those experiences. Park Street is still the same most lively and happening place, with innumerable eating places and some of the best shopping areas. A must see for tourists.

title: Visit at christmas
review_text: If you want to be anywhere at Christmas it has to be park street! Fantastic lights, food, everyone in Santa hats....and a lot warmer than Trafalgar Square!

title: Festive
review_text:
What a street , wow , wow , wow. 
Bubbling with festive spirit . All good eateries and bars of the city are here . 
Flurys , Kwality, Magnolia , Hotel The Park , Gangaur and the famous Russel Street nearby . Superb decoration for Christmas to New Year's throughout the street .

title: Crazy Busy
review_text:
We were here on christmas eve and honestly I've never seen anything like it. 

People were queuing just to walk on the street and when you did manage to walk it was elbows and pushed from all sides. 

The shops are very nice and provide a full range of choices as well as restaurants and bakeries.

title: Best street of India
review_text: I have been to Kolkata a dozen times, but never before on Christmas.. I can say that there can be no other street in India on/around Christmas.. forget delhi/mumbai/bengaluru.. visit Kolkata next Christmas..

title: HangOut Place
review_text: We went to visit this place on Christmas time. The entire road was decorated and a concert was organised on park circus circle. we enjoyed their street side food festival also.

title: good and happening place
review_text: park street is very famous and must a visit please in the city and some good restaurant are also their 20th December to 31st December this a happening place lighting and other attraction is there

title: From destination to a thoroughfare
review_text: In the past Park Street with its five star hotels (on park street or nearby), numerous restaurants with their live bands and big showrooms was a destination for a fun filled evening and shopping at kolkata. But today it is more of a thoroughfare connecting Howrah/esplanade/maidan area with park circus /EM Bypass/Saltlake. The fun & frolic of evening & shopping has now shifted out of park street to shopping malls and hotels in suburban area. The Iconic restaurants are still there so park street is still a destination for foodies. It also becomes destination of fun & frolic for all occasionally like during Christmas.

title: The best happening place in Kolkata
review_text: Park street is the heart of Kolkata. It has many magnificent buildings most of which are from the British Era. The eating joints and restaurants are special. One can enjoy the street by window shopping or walk into one of the several stores.The street is where one can enjoy night life of the city. The Christmas and New Year time is something which makes the city come to its prime. The only issue is the jostling crowd.

title: "C.P OF KOLKATA"
review_text: Park Street is one of the 2nd best place I saw in Kolkata after Victoria Memorial. I am from Delhi and as we have C.P in delhi same way it is Park Street in Kolkata. A must visit if some one is planning to come to Kolkata.

title: The Street that never sleeps
review_text: Visiting Kolkata without strolling at Park Street will remain an untold story about the city. A place where one likes to dine, have a nice time to spend with the friends. Starting from Chowringhee Road to a stretch up to Park Circus in the morning to late night is an absolute dream to anybody. Line of dining places, Park Hotel and Flurys, where one can get Swiss Confectionery. Places like Asiatic Society, Park Street burial ground, Allen Park, St. Xaviers School are obviously added attraction to its visitors.

title: Oxford Books
review_text: Collected unique stationary and books from the store. Love the ambiance and smell of new books. Staff are very courteousness. You can pick up all new arrival of books from here

title: the heart of city of joy
review_text: its one place who have to visit when he/her is in the city , from shopping to indulging your self to food this place offers u all

title: Heart of the city-Park Street
review_text: This place is the heart of the city and this is the perfect time to go to Park Street. You see a lot of restaurants and cafeterias. Specially in December month they decorate entire Park Street with lights because of Christmas and New Year. Every year they have count down on 31st Dec. People gather there with their family and friends. It's a very fun place to hang out with.

title: A must place to visit if you are Kolkata
review_text:
One of the oldest and most popular commercial district will take you back to the British from elegantly designed buildings to churches, offices and the most popular bars, pubs, restaurants and sweet shops. 
I had pleasure of visiting this place on the brink of Christmas and hence had the opportunity to experience brilliantly lighted and elegantly decorated 1 km long corridor of Park Street. A brilliant experience and must visit place for every one if you are visiting to Kolkata.

title: The Cultural heart of Kolkata
review_text:
Maybe the best time of the year to visit Park Street is the Christmas! It will steal your heart. 

But for the rest of the year, land at Park Street Metro Station and have a short walk towards Esplanade, visiting New Market in between which is the ultimate food and shopping destination for a trendy Kolkata! Don't forget to visit the Underground Mall!!

title: Awesome
review_text: Part Street beautiful place n December is must visit wit lights n food stall..fun fair n many more..lots of good n best hotel in park street..it looks like ur in sum u.s city when u visit dis in Christmas

title: Eat and drink to your heart's content
review_text: It's the only street with plenty of bars and restaurants in Kolkata. It's busy and popular with locals and visitors alike.

title: good place to visit
review_text:
Heritage place 
Lots of restaurant 
Heart of city 
you will get good ambiance 
lots of fun 
near new market

title: Old world and modern goes hand in hand
review_text: Still holding on to its old world charm. One of best streets in the city to explore some of the finest food the city has to offer. The options are many with the legendary ones still holding the fort.

title: Walking and eating forgetting dieting
review_text: Just keep walking along the narrow footpaths crowded with vendors often selling books. So many old famous & restaurants of Kolkata luring all with their sizzling delicacies. I love it in Park Street, especially during the winter of Kolkata. My favourites are Sizzler dishes of the restaurants near the Metro station end of Park street - Trinca's, Ming, Moulin Rouge Kolkata, Bar-B-Q, Mocambo, Kwality - to name a few.

title: Amazing place
review_text: It was a fabulous experience with the Christmas Celebrations in progress. Seemed like being on the 'Orchard Street' in Singapore, very similar. Had some quick bites on the food stalls as part of Christmas festival. Attended the music concert on the Camac Street.

title: Christmas all the way
review_text: The jingle of santa begun in park street a week before with beautiful lighting all over and colorful caps and masks all around its pleasure to visit park street from mid month of December the roadside stalls are pleasure to watch.

title: So good place
review_text: So good place .you guys realy visit this place.me and my family enjoy this place.this place is oasum!!!!!

title: Pride of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is not only a road which connects important parts of the city, it has numerous very good restaurants, hotels, night club, shops and it virtually teems with life, all thru the year. But it is must see especially in the month of December, and especially the 3rd & 4th week. Park Street lights up for Christmas & New Year and there are programs in the park and hordes of food & other stalls. Must visit at this time, not only for tourists but also for Kolkatans

title: Its became alive at 31st December
review_text: I visited there at new year eve with my friends. The croud is so loud and you can feel the new year is comming

title: Western influenced
review_text:
On my first trip to India from Australia I elected to stay at the Park Hotel (reviewed also). The understanding was that Park Street was the main shopping street of Kolkata and a good central point from which to explore the city. 

It is a good central point, but do not expect as I may have to have close to a western shopping experience. 

There are bars here, and restaurants and shops too, but if you are from any major western city you may be surprised at the state of the pavement. Yes it has a pavement unlike most of the rest of India but it is in a terrible state with most of it dug up and in a state of constant repair. Pavers give way to sand mounds, paver stepping stones and deep trenches. On a busy day, navigation in anything other than proper shoes can be treacherous. More

title: Make a point to walk this street while in Kolkata
review_text: A very interesting street. Some good restaurants and people watching. Worth taking an hour or so the walk up and down it.

title: Great street
review_text: Vibrant with good food and the best bookshop ever: the Oxford Street Bookshop. Air conditioned and you can sit down and have a browse...

title: Park Street - The London of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is the glamour quotient of the City of Joy - Calcutta [ Kolkata ].Its a panoramic high street which stretches few kms . All the famous Hotels / Restaurants are situated over here . My personal favorites are Flurrys and Trincas , however there are excellent Chinese Joints also . The famous St.Xavier's College , Park Hotel is based out over here . The buildings are truly reflective of Calcutta's colonial rule and the British influence of the city . Street vendors , rickshaw pullers and pedestrians constitute a major portion of the area . Park Street - a slice of Europe in India . Must must visit when you are in Kolkata. More

title: Nice Place to stay
review_text:
Wonderful Experience. 
Every time I visited Kolkata must visit Park street . Awesome place for shopping, dinning, stay as well. Good time to spent the night club at Park Street.

title: A Must When In Kolkata
review_text:
Any trip to Kolkata would not be complete without a walk down Park Streeet (the end nearest Chowringhee Road). Great shops and eating places, some which have been there for years. 

The pavements need to be cleaned up but otherwise it is a great walk.

title: Must visit place if you are at Kolkata!!!
review_text: Park street is one of the oldest and very popular and busy area in Kolkata. Most buildings are old reflecting Kolkata’s British-Indian past. It is no more the most posh neighborhood of Kolkata, but one feels great walking along the Park street with full of great restaurants and cafes. I especially enjoy Kolkata’s traditional Hilsha-Biriany whenever I visit Park Street Kolkata. It might be a good place for shopping as well but not the best and you may have to bargain a lot especially when it comes to the Saree shops. New market is walking distance from this place and a good number of bars and night clubs are connected with this road. Although not the cleanest part of Kolkata, I consider Park street as a must see place if you are visiting this city. More

title: the street of kolkata
review_text: Park street is one of the first things which people recall when they think about kolkata. The street is lined with some of the iconic restaurants (flurys, peter cat to name a few!!!). Office building, hotels and colleges, retail shops also add to the line. the hustle bustle created by the multitude of people who walk on it everyday adds to the character of the street. a must visit if you are in the city of joy!!!

title: Park street
review_text: A most popular and posh market area of kolkata and houses sweet shops, bakery, showrooms and hotels of important brands.a good price lace to stroll for two three hours and enjoy shopping eating, and relaxing. Park hotel Hindustan international and Oberoi grand are all nearly. Bengali sweets and savouries available.

title: Posh area
review_text: Well this is a posh area in kolkata where you will find all those legendary restaurants such as Peter cat, Arsalan , Hot kathi rolls etc. Basically this place is a foodie's delight albeit the higher cost!.This place is adjacent to esplande and also has its own metro station.

title: Street with free Wifi and lots of Bar and Hotel.
review_text: Park street is one of the busy street in Calcutta. As most of the city hotels, bar, night club, connect this road. The place lies on center point between north and south Calcutta. The place is accessible form metro and and Local bus. The St. Xavier College also lies in this street. With lots of bar and hotels it is a tourist hub. The city's largest disco also is located here. You can enjoy local, Nepali, Western, Chinese etc food in these area. Most of the buildings are made by British in this place and modern business complex occupies in the new land area. Best place to celebrate Christmas and New year if you are in Calcutta. More

title: Time out place
review_text: Park street is the best place for our frn to go out there n enjy lots of hotel n restaurant are der at a good price ...

title: A well stocked street
review_text: The city revolves round the street .. One can walk down the memory lane.. Great restaurants and coffee shops.. Some lovely feed for the shoppers too..

title: A place in kolkata having high standard of living
review_text: Part Street is located in the centre of the city of Joy, Kolkata. There are many malls, branded shops, 5 star hotels like Park Hotel, etc around it.. People often visit park street to taste the metro culture of the city.. The famoun Indian Museum is also nearby park street metro station.. During Christmas, the whole of the Park Street is decorated and everybody celebrates Christmas at Park Street.. many events takes place.. many concerts are also being arranged every year at Park Street.. One must visit it during Christmas week...

title: Park street
review_text: It's best place for if you want to see daily life of Kolkata..here almost have many type of showroom of brands..and some building are in british architecture

title: "Anglo Indian" Kolkata
review_text: This street used to be an excellent example of Anglo Indian Kolkata. It still has vestiges of that older culture. Many nice restaurants and a few excellent shops e.g. Oxford Book Store, Rajaniklal, or Ananda on Little Russell Street.

title: Awesome
review_text: Really, a amazing place in Kolkata. U can say that there is a life in that place. It has all the best brands,shops, restaurant's, metro, building's etc etc... Kolkata is city of joy, n that place defines it lot.

title: Food & Shopping
review_text:
Park street area is a must visit in Kolkata. 
Best restaurants and markets are located here. 
Park street is extremely popular among tourists.

title: Central kolkata
review_text: I visited for shopping. I love the KFC in park Street. It's good. You can watch movie. It has one particular empire cinema in Lindsay Street. Maidan is very near from that place. You can visit Elliot park.

title: Heart of kolkata
review_text: This is the most hot & happening place of kolkata.Everyone should have to go once for sure.You will find anything here.

title: The heart of the misery
review_text:
Park Street is the heart of Kolkata. There is a few luxury hotels and some of the best and most expensive places of night live in the city (this doesn't mean they are good). This is also an old business district, with several offices and government buildings with a characteristic colonial style, but musty and rotten as the rest of the city. 

Unlike the rest of the city, sidewalks are practicable in most of the street, so there is plenty of space for beggars pesting both tourists and locals. 

If you go to Park Street in the night you will find it full of poor people sleeping in the ground, even little child's covered with plastics, so you will understand how awful Kolkata is. 

I hope that the quick economic development of the country will be able to eradicate the extreme poverty of this place. More

title: Walk down the park street
review_text: It is somewhat like the Oxford Street of London. It has its own charm.there are a number of restaurants on both side of the street offering a variety of cuisine. MOCAMBO, PETER CAT, BAR-B-A,Oasis, Marco Polo, Bar b q nation, KFC, MAC D, Flurys, Aou Bon Pain and many more.Public buses and trucks are not allowed to ply on park street. St Xaviers college and Loreto house and Loreto college are the 2 most reputed and oldest of the convent institutions are there.In short it is the food hub of Kolkata.

title: Beautiful....feels lyk there is a festival in kolkata...so many lights...i lv park street..
review_text: Everyday seems lyk diwali in parkstreet...soo beautiful..lights and lights...good for college people..discs..eating joints..brands...nd safe..

title: Very very good
review_text: Its awesome to visit this parkstreet place. All things are available in this area. Easy to reach from bus stand or railway station. Must visit.

title: A land mark
review_text: When we were going around my cab driver showed me this location . It is a very busy location and the buildings reminded me of the preindependence days. Well maintained

title: Eating out...!
review_text:
Had a great time wondering through this area. We were there to find some lunch. We found a great selection of international eateries and shops. 
Aside from the very forceful touters and some beggars, it is a very interesting place to visit. 
We found access to this via the metro subway very easy. 
Worth visiting if you find yourself in these parts.

title: Busy
review_text: We had to come to Park street for many reasons and shopping was one important parts. Some named shops and malls have good things to offer. We enjoyed movies also. Park street is well known to all and easy to find this vibrant street bubbling with life.

title: A nice shopping and dining street. Be there at 1pm each day for a big surprise!
review_text: I went to Park Street to visit the famous Oxford Bookstore. This street has a number of attractions, including a Bengal craft store, colonial architecture, cafes and restaurants, and at 1pm the one way traffic reverses direction!

title: Nostalgia
review_text: This place brings nostalgia to every Bengalis heart. Cristmass time is best time to visit here. Many eateries and pubs are nereby.

title: The Food Street
review_text: There are lots of food shops, pubs and so many things. Night life of park street is amazing. Shopping malls of this street are fab. One of the most cool place in Kolkata.

title: Shopping, dining or leisurely stroll
review_text: Park street has a special place in Kolkata culture and history with shops, restaurants, nice apartments and a park at park circus. Although crowded, it is a good spot for an evening stroll with window shopping and perhaps a cup of coffee or even dinner at one of the restaurants. Park street may very well serve as a recreation spot when you got time and opportunity.

title: Business
review_text: Nice place....very attractive outlook at evening....Nice place form visit in Kolkata...plsss spend some time at this place

title: Food is delicious
review_text:
Went to park street on my friends request. 
Long journey from airport to park street but I can say I was worth it. 
Was told to go for rolls as it is the best there. Aftr going there I would like to go again so the rolls was yummyyyy. 
Worth every effort and every penny I spent.

title: Check out New Market Area near park Street.
review_text: Google New Market Area and head there if you like shopping. Some people say Park Street instead of New market area as roads are linked but if you google and go reach directly New market area on google for shopping.

title: 5th Avenue of Kolkata
review_text: This is the 5th Avenue of Kolkata. A major thoroughfare in the city of Kolkata formerly known as Calcutta. We can see some colonial British architecture in Park Street along with an arrays of Restaurants, museums, fancy boutiques, shops, coffee shops, books shops and the list goes on. If you are visiting Kolkata, you gotta be here at least once. This place has so much more life than Connaught place in New Delhi. The architecture is way better, well maintained, no pan stains in the wall corners and some great Kolkata restaurants. Do visit Mocambo, Peter Cat, Kwality, Oxford Book store, Flurys or the Park Hotel once in Park Street More

title: wonderfull--- no parking
review_text: In day time you can walk freely on the busy street. Entire life of the city is there. At night its a party & hangout spot. colourful lights out side the hotels coffee shops. free space to walk, hawkers.

title: Park Street
review_text:
Park Street is situated in central Kolkata. It is a must visit for any traveller visiting Kolkata. One end of the road is at 7 point crossing called Circus Avenue and other end is at JL Nehru Road where Metro railway station is available. Buses and Autos are not allowed in Park Street. It is most famous for Restaurants serving all types of food. Some of the Restaurants are of British regime like Flurys, Mocambo, Blue Fox etc. Park Hotel is situated in Park Street. St.Xavier's college is also situated in Park Street. There is also a famous Christian burial ground where lots of famous British personalities were buried. 
Park Street looks the best during Christmas. Major part of the street is illuminated with lights. Food stalls are erected on the street. 
Park Street is the favourite joint with the Foreigners. Most of them stay around Park Street area. 
Park Street is a pride of Kolkata. More

title: Old Kolkata
review_text: A recommended place to have a round in evening time. lot of shopping and food. you can get some local stuff for shopping as well as street food and branded chain of restaurants. old books are also available

title: Street is awesome without Airtel network
review_text: So I keep on visiting this place when at Kolkata and it's an awesome place to roam around but the biggest issue here is you will not find or find very poor network of airtel which makes life difficult .

title: Modern City Lane with rich heritage..
review_text: A popular handouts for food lovers in Kolkata. day time very busy business centre but later part of the day can see a lot of people around..

title: So So
review_text: For tourists, this is not a must visit. There are many modern western chain restaurants around such as KFC, Au Bob Pain, etc and some clothing stores. If you don't have a lot of time, it is not a must visit. There are far more nicer shops in Forum shopping mall which is about 3-5 km away.

title: ADORABLE HEART OF THE CITY
review_text: The place really attracts ur attention the moment u move through. All kinds of food courts, restaurants, shopping malls. A huge collection of variations at one place. The place z worth adoring during christmas eve.

title: Heart of the City
review_text: Greatest place in Calcutta. Best hotels are there that's why foodies like me love Park Street. I think there is nobody in the city who never visit park street at least once in their child hood or at young age with girlfriend. It has is own charm. Starting with Hot Kati Roll where you can enjoy best Chicken or Mutton Rolls in Calcutta. Mocambo, Peter cat, Flurys, Trincas, etc are the landmarks of this street. You can find every cuisine like Japanese, Italian, Indian, Mexican, Continental, and Chinese here. During Christmas and New Year Parks Street is looking sublime with the lightings and decorations. Best place for the night life in Calcutta. Still Park Street remains Calcutta's prime dining destination with many restaurants and pubs. It is often known as "Food Street" and "The Street that Never Sleeps". More

title: Buzzing
review_text: It's really a buzzing street with a variety of options to shop eat n drink. The old world charm of Kolkata coupled with some modern set ups.

title: PARK'S BEAUTY
review_text:
OMG 
I didn't even know that where I am roaming in Kolkata after the study of my course.Roadside you can see the beauty of Indian culture with the taste of western civilization.A good place for couples.

title: The heart street of Kolkata, party, books, food, stroll, old Kolkata
review_text:
Maidan is the lungs of Kolkata, Park street is the heart of Kolkata. 
Truly a haven for foods - Peter cat, Oasis, Kwality, Bar-b-q, Mocambo 
Haven for drinks and discussion - Olypub (those who have not gone there should, at least once), Trincas 
Party - Roxy (Park), Tantra 
Books - Oxford Bookstore, Street vendors in front of olypub 
Stroll around - Sudder street and others 
Gives a unique mix of old and new worlds. 
Love the atmosphere.

title: The food lover's lane
review_text: Park Street has been special for every one who grew up in Kolkata, especially for the range of restaurants located here. My favourites are Peter Cat, Bar-b-que, Tung Fong. Come during Christmas and New Year and the place is lit up in festive mood.

title: Trendy but expensive shopping
review_text: Designer shops are great. A bit expensive for kolkata. Bought a few things. Overall quite good! One problem is that the shops are a bit scattered. So one has to walk here and there and across streets to shop.

title: Street-full delight
review_text:
Shop. Eat. Explore. Do what you love, this place is for shoppers, readers, explorers, foodies. Travel around and enjoy this space. 

Best time to visit is Durga Puja and Christmas

title: I went on christmas and it was super gorgeous then
review_text: People were everywhere... nice hotels, restaurants, bars, pubs etc on both side. One of the best place to hang out in Kolkata.

title: A heritage of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street was to be the house of Kolkata's night life. From the British time it has been home for a verity of cuisine and hosted some timeless gems like Trincas, Peter Cat, Flury's, Mocambo, Blue Fox etc. But that prolific night life of Park Street has presently lost its sheen due to several reasons. Still Kolkata visit is incomplete without a visit to Park Street.

title: busy market place
review_text: An upmarket place suitable for high end shoppers as you will get most of the fashion brands here and find every thing you wanted to have

title: A buzzing hub of life and activity - Commerce and Culture
review_text: Park Street is the nerve center of Calcutta - a strange potpourri of tradition and modernity - Hub of hotels restaurants, showrooms, hotels, varied commercial centers, churches and Victorian structures. The youth, the intellectuals, the gawky country bumpkins, tourists, students and other people with nefarious trade intent flock here. You can stand and watch life whizz by or get sucked into the vortex

title: Nostalgia in one street
review_text: This is a wonderful walkable road, with modern shops jostling for space with old hotels and eateries we have known since childhood, like Flurys. A must-stroll.

title: This is where the action is!!
review_text: A whole street lined with upscale shops and eateries, Park Street is heaven for both the shopaholics and foodies.

title: Lovely lively place
review_text:
Business hub restraunt hub students hub 
Lively and buzzing 
Must visit 
Flurys. Breakfast 
Barbeque 
Mama goto 
Peter cat 
Park hotel 
And much more

title: AMAZING PLACE
review_text:
This is an amazing place to hang out in Calcutta. 
Has a number of Shops and Cafes in lanes on either side and is the Heart throb of Calcutta.

title: Glorious
review_text: All the showrooms and restuarants are posh and elegant. A good place for spending evening in Kolkata. No crowd!

title: Good place in Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is the heart of Kolkata and is currently famous for the large number of restaurants of all cuisines.

title: Old Kolkata Charm
review_text: Park street is probably the best place to spend a full day at kolkata with loads of options for both shopping n dining. Almost all buildings carry traits of the old british architecture and makes you feel like youv'e gone back in time. You also get to see the only age old yellow ambassador taxis running here. On the whole a busy street n a must visit place in Kolkata, especially during festivals.

title: Shopping and walking
review_text: Nice place for window shopping.. evening walks in the crowded streets and good food at the restaurants and cafes nearby...

title: The dining hub of kolkata with the exclusive touch of the royal and rich culture of british heritage .
review_text:
The most popular and exclusive dining street of kolkata where every evening the food lovers publovers arrives in thousands to have great time and fun. 
Great food drinks gets carried over as night progress. 
So many options of pub.bar restaurants and hotels in this area.more are adding every now and then. 
One can try the new once for a change..all serves good food and service except few .

title: Happening place
review_text: Since it was just out of gate of peerless inn hotel ,very convenient to hop in market.full street occupied by hawkers.close to new market.clothing stuff in abundant quantity of low budget.

title: Amazing place, with good food and wine
review_text: I stayed a few time at "The Park Kolkata" on park street. The street is lively with lots of food option and is the most happening place in Kolkata.

title: Kolkata Classic:)
review_text:
It's not a fancy street, it's not comparable to Bandra or to 5th Avenue, but it stirs an inexplicable warm fuzzy feeling when you visit:) 
This charming street has tonnes of history and legacy! Be sure to visit!

title: work place of city of joy
review_text: this is the entertainment hub of kolkata.. lots of specialty hotels and restaurants , clubs, have opened here.. in day time it is the busiest working place but when the sun sets it becomes more attractive by its street light..

title: Kolkata dines here...
review_text: It's true.... you walk down the Park Street and you will find all the finest restaurants lined up on both sides of the street... Peter Cat, Tong Fong, Olipub, Mocambo, Moulin Rouge, Park etc... Beef steak from Olipub, Chelo kebab from Peter Cat, Smoked Lamb from Tong Fong, pastry from Flurrys .... a heaven for foodies.....

title: Full of life
review_text: It's difficult to imagine Kolkata without Park Street. It assumes same importance to the City of Joy as heartbeat to a human body. Trincas, known for live music and enjoyable evenings, Flurys the great cafe, Hobby store, the list of jewels on the street are endless. It adorns one of the biggest book stores and at the same time is almost a home to countless pavement book sellers. A MUST to visit location while in Kolkata.

title: Most happening place in Kolkata
review_text: When the sun sets and specifically when the yellow signal lights are turned onn... This place is one of the most happening place in kolkata.

title: Lively
review_text: Park street is filled with restaurants, pubs and night clubs. This street is the heart of Calcutta. Park street is at its best during Diwali, Christmas and New Years. With the lightings and decorations it is a spectacle.

title: Elite place
review_text: Park street is for the elite crowd - all brands available, bigger shops, fine dinning with all the yummy places.

title: Happening Place
review_text: Itz one of the most happening place in kolkota. Itz a place with gud resturants hotels pubs sweet shops and much more. Itz the most centrally located place and called as the heart of the city

title: Evenings
review_text:
A good place with variety of shops to keep your stomach and mind entertained. 

expensive and affordable, both possible, depends on your choices

title: Walk to enjoy
review_text: From my college days at St Xavier's I was in love with this street. So many things to see and experience as if one can get the entire taste of Kolkata on this street. The street connects JL Nehru Road(Erstwhile Chowringhee Rd) and APC Road (erstwhile Lower Circular Rd) and is full of history, literature, food , night life and much more. This street reaches another level of grandeur during the Christmas!! One should simply walk this street to experience Kolkata. Do find an excuse to pamper yourself with great coffee and snacks at Flury's or gorge into junk food at Macdonald's...Enjoy!!

title: The Hottest Place in Town!
review_text: Looking for a pub, a club, a traditional family restaurant? Look no further. This place has all of it. You cannot miss this place during Christmas!

title: Must go place during Chirstamas
review_text: Park Street, one point in time was Kolkata's Premier Restaurant District. This place has good no of restaurants on both side of street, the famous being Bar-B-Q, Flurrys, Mocambo etc.

title: A relaxing environment for a nice evening
review_text: After a long day at work, Park Street is the place which makes you feel quite relaxed, for its variety of restaurants and the general ambience for the place. One has to visit to get the feel of the place and the city of joy. Try it , you would live it.

title: Central location ... The place to be
review_text:
Everything you need is around. Hotels at your budget , food ..fancy restaurants, old ones, street food ..., 
Just a walk around and there is so much you will find when you explore. 
Very hot now during the day so cover your head and wear sunblock :) and walk and sweat. Worth it i would say

title: Its heart of kolkata
review_text: Good place for night life lovers, bunch of restaurants. Best time to visit is from 23rd of december to 31st.

title: The Most happening street that i have visited while on Kolkata
review_text: A fun street to visit while in Kolkata; central in location, yummy places to visit, book stories for the literary inclined, all in the all a fun place to browse, watch, eat and enjoy.

title: Posh Area of Kolkata
review_text: Park street is a region where the iconic Park Hotel stands along with the famous restaurants like -- trincas, bar-b-q,mocambo, hakuna matata, peter cat stands. The St. Xaviers college is also situated in this place. Confectioneries like Flurys and Au bon pain are also situated here. The best time is to visit during Christmas.

title: Explored the neighborhood
review_text: My dear friends live in Park Circus. So, I stayed in that area. Explored the neighborhood for three days. Loved it. Wonderful warm memories.

title: Kolkata's everything
review_text: Shopping street, night life, all at one place. Every city has a place where people flock together and hang out. well this is Kolkata's that place!

title: The happening place of central kolkata
review_text: The street is well known for its restaurants (which are old and some are considered as legacy as well). The street is well decorated during new year and christmas. It's quite popular with locals and tourists.

title: Park Street during Christmas, New Year-a wonderful site
review_text: Park street is dotted with fabulous restaurants and hotels on both side and is in the heart of Kolkata. During Christmas and New Year it is decorated with colourful LEDs giving it a heavenly look in the evening. Nice area to spend your time particularly on Christmas and New Year.

title: The Entertainment hub
review_text: Park street is such an interesting and important place in this city of Joy. With iconic restaurants like Flury's, Trincas and Marco Polo it is the best address for spending nice quality time withfriends and family.

title: One of the post areas of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is a very posh area of Kolkata having a chain of new as well as heritage restaurants like Veda, BBQ, Peter Cat, Mocambo, One Step Up, Marco Polo in China, Park Hotel etc. It has also a range of exotic saree store making this place a prime attraction. A number of pubs having decent liquor prices are also present here. A must go.

title: Many visits to summarise
review_text: If you are not from British era then go to park street, look at the colonial building and wonder how they would be when built and were in their full glory. Are you hungry there? Great thing to happen yo you...Just name a cuisine and its there. Go for Indianised continental food as a suggestion. For chinese my preferred place is Oasis.

title: great place
review_text: All types of food available safe to travel at night 1 km from hotel the lindsay Barb Q restaurant is really good for north indian food lovers

title: Happenning Street
review_text: Please be early for every meal planned as all restaurant area will jammed with long queue especially lunch and dinner time.

title: It is a awesome place in kolkata
review_text: It's a nice place for tourism. You can have a try with your family and friends. Espacially in christmas it is decorated as a Bride. Awesome place to visit

title: Best place in Kolkata
review_text: All the best restaurants, shops, and hotels are located in this area. Go for a walk late in the afternoon and enjoy the sights and sounds.

title: Fun and safe
review_text: The street to be at or around. Lovely restaurants, safe to walk around (also at night), and everything is located within walking distance. Book your ho(s)tel near here and you'll be a happy camper!

title: If you have come to Calcutta & have not been to Park Street then you have not seen Calcutta!
review_text: The coolest place to wind up your evenings after a tiring day-PARK STREET! ......once it was a place where live bands were there in open. Nowadays the most popular pub among the music lovers is SOMEPLACE ELSE of Park Hotel-the only 5 start hotel in park street with a host of points for your all busy evenings like ROXY-the DJ jamming place, AQUA at the rooftop for a relaxing drink beside the pool side and the disco - TANTRA!........in the park street you will get books in OXFORD & can enjoy a cuppa too, get one of the best tailors in town BARKAT ALI, a line of pubs and eating places where you can get from continental to chinese to Indian cuisines and must try indian fast food from KUSUM's Roll (indian bread with chicken or meat or egg or a mix of all these rolled into it) located just beside the famous OLY Pub. The best continental can be had at MOCAMBO & for confectionaries/cakes/Darjeeling tea try the very old Flurys beside another famous restaurant called PETER CAT (try out their signature dish Chelo Kebab). Located at the corner of the street beside the park street Metro (undergroung rail) is the famous ASIATIC society formed during british period in 1784 by sir William Jones is a centre for asian studies including almost everything concerning man & nature within the geographical limits of the continent. Its a mine of knowledge.... The coolest place to wind up your evenings after a tiring day-PARK STREET! ......once it was a place where live bands were there in open. Nowadays the most popular pub among the music lovers is SOMEPLACE ELSE of Park Hotel-the only 5 start hotel in park street with a host of points for your all busy evenings like ROXY-the DJ jamming place, AQUA at the rooftop for a relaxing drink beside the pool side and the disco - TANTRA!........in the park street you will get books in OXFORD & can enjoy a cuppa too, get one of the best tailors in town BARKAT ALI, a line of pubs and eating places where you can get from continental to chinese to Indian cuisines and must try indian fast food from KUSUM's Roll (indian bread with chicken or meat or egg or a mix of all these rolled into it) located just beside the famous OLY Pub. The best continental can be had at MOCAMBO & for confectionaries/cakes/Darjeeling tea try the very old Flurys beside another famous restaurant called PETER CAT (try out their signature dish Chelo Kebab). Located at the corner of the street beside the park street Metro (undergroung rail) is the famous ASIATIC society formed during british period in 1784 by sir William Jones is a centre for asian studies including almost everything concerning man & nature within the geographical limits of the continent. Its a mine of knowledge. Just near to Asiatic Society is again another landmark called Government Art College from where the best of the artists emerge out in the world of contemporary art. At the Park street's other end one should visit the very old cemetry (park street cemetry) - it is really a place to look back on the people who have gone down in the lanes of history-some famous some common folks.......and if you don't want the pubs & the restaurnats then can just cross the road and enjoy the greenery of the esplanade-Maidan......enjoy ! title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text: Although it has lost some of its old charm, this is the place you want to be if you like to party. Its got fancy restaurants, bars, pubs, discotheques, cafe joints... list continues.

title: A place to relax with good food, coffee, tea and confectionery.
review_text: Park Street was the happening street of Calcutta ( now Kolkata) . I have been visiting this place from my childhood days with my Dad , Mom and my maternal uncle. It was a place we love to go as a child. It was not that frequently those days it was only during birthdays or any special occasions . Christmas and New Year was good - absolutely rocking. Late 60s and early 70s - there used to be good music in some of the places. But the musicians moved out of the city and there was s communist govt in place - gradually things changed. Park Street lost the feel. But again from end of 90s - things started improving . Today Park Street is somewhat improved with good music in Someplace Else at Park Hotel. Some coffee joints , some restaurants are still continuing and remains a Calcuttans fav like Peter Cat , Bar - B - Que , Trincas , Kwality, Magnolia , Mocambo and so on . There are some new restaurants and coffee bar also there. Flury's is still there with the old world charm. But the upmarket people are visiting elsewhere . Yes Park Street still has a loyal crowd but mostly people from the periphery and other cities still makes it a point to visit Park Street. I still love the place and have few of my fav restaurants there like Bar b que,... Park Street was the happening street of Calcutta ( now Kolkata) . I have been visiting this place from my childhood days with my Dad , Mom and my maternal uncle. It was a place we love to go as a child. It was not that frequently those days it was only during birthdays or any special occasions . Christmas and New Year was good - absolutely rocking. Late 60s and early 70s - there used to be good music in some of the places. But the musicians moved out of the city and there was s communist govt in place - gradually things changed. Park Street lost the feel. But again from end of 90s - things started improving . Today Park Street is somewhat improved with good music in Someplace Else at Park Hotel. Some coffee joints , some restaurants are still continuing and remains a Calcuttans fav like Peter Cat , Bar - B - Que , Trincas , Kwality, Magnolia , Mocambo and so on . There are some new restaurants and coffee bar also there. Flury's is still there with the old world charm. But the upmarket people are visiting elsewhere . Yes Park Street still has a loyal crowd but mostly people from the periphery and other cities still makes it a point to visit Park Street. I still love the place and have few of my fav restaurants there like Bar b que, Peter Cat, Other Room , Trincas , Oasis, Tung Fung , Golden Dragon ( small place ) Woldorf and so many more places. You can take a small walk towards Free School Street and try the Biriyani at Arsalan , Bengali Food at Koshe Kasha and Kasturi. If you are visiting Cal you must visit Park Street for some good food.
