title: Connaught place of Kolkata
review_text:
A very good market to buy good quality clothes for wedding and other functions. 
A long road with buildings and almost all building have clothes shop inside.

title: Good tourist attraction in Kolkata
review_text: Located in the heart of the city Kolkata. Best visiting time would be last week of December every year - totally in festive mood. Famous restaurants are located in this area.

title: Just a famous street, nothing much
review_text: Just a famous street in Kolkata, nothing much. Although it is known as business center of Kolkata, but all shops gets closed by 9, restaurants and bars are open only till 12.

title: Busy street gr8 for shopping and eating
review_text: Shopping malls on both sides. Gr8 for shopping indian ethnic wear. Some good eateries like Peter Cat and Barbeque Nation too.

title: Fun Zone
review_text: Getting bored with daily life come and enjoy the evening at Park Street. You can spend the evening just by strolling, dine in some of the best restaurants, have some ice creams, enjoy some fast food.

title: Good time
review_text: Park street is considered to be mostly liked by youngsters. Decoration during Christmas here is breathtaking. Good number of restaurants and fast foods are seen here.

title: Famous street
review_text: This is one of the famous street of Mumbai where you will find all big shopping mall and reputed designed clothes.

title: worth
review_text: the place here is very good the road trip is very good and there are many things to do here athe hub of many companies showroom there are very good scene the place here is good is christmas and the new year is nice

title: Was once the most elite street in the country
review_text: The thrill of going to Part Street is no more. Much more bourgeois; the Blue Fox and Moulin Rouge and Peter Cat have had their day. It is a good street to stroll, party - shop a little and still remans a good place to go.

title: Good street in Kolkata
review_text:
On this street you can find some good restaurants and international chain shops.. If you are in Kolkata this street and the streets that run off Park Street should not be missed.. 
This street is also good for "people watching"..

title: Park street...the best part about kolkata
review_text: The thought of park Street makes me a little nostalgic and memories of college days flash in my mind. The entire Street has a charm of its own. Right from the beginning I.e. the metro station ...U walk down the street and u will get a view of renowned restaurants serving different cuisines. The famous 'flurys' is also in park Street known for its breakfast since British times. As u move ahead u get a glimpse of youngsters walking down the lane with smiles on their faces. The famous 'St. Xaviers College's is also in this Street. During Christmas the entire Street is so beautifully decorated that it's a must visit if u happen to be in Kolkata during Christmas. More

title: Park Street where the City's Heart is Beating
review_text:
Park Street remains Kolkata's Elegant dining district, with many restaurants and pubs(Park Hotel, Peter Cat, Mocambo, Olypub). It is known as "Food Street" and "The Street is Always lively". 

Park Street has many notable showrooms, and several notable buildings such as the Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College. Prominent Heritage Sites from the British Raj era. 

Park Street is the recreation zone for Kolkata people since the British era. However it also host new restaurants, malls, 5-star hotels and nightclubs. 

The street has some exclusive brand showrooms along with some Street fashion vendors so the choices could always be realistic. 

Preferred places: 
Flurys, Subway,KFC,McDonalds,Barista,Cafe Coffee Day,Oly Pub,Park Hotel,Golden Dragon,BBQ Nation,ArsalanResaturant,Mocambo,AN John(Salon),Oxford Book Store.

title: The most happening street of calcutta (Kolkata)
review_text:
The street has some of finest food joints and multi cuisine restaurants and several landmark buildings and heritage sites of Kolkata. 

The street celebrates christmas and new year every year with very beautiful decoration and lighting and it is perhaps the best celebration of christmas and New Year in India.

title: Park Street
review_text: Park Street is known for all the lovely restaurants on both sides of the road, During Christmas and New year, the place is really enjoyable

title: Shoppers paradise
review_text: Park Street is not only a Foodies paradise but a Shoppers too. Most of Kolkata's best restaurants are around here. And New market . You can find the most amazing things to buy here at very very reasonable rates. My go to place to pick up night wear. And I had the most amazing Tea in a Kullad (cup made of clay) the design way to go from a street vendor. A fun place and another must visit in the kolkata list .

title: Must visit street of Kolkata
review_text: Historic road, with innumerable hotels, restaurants and eateries. Lots of heritage architecture and historic buildings in the area. A must visit area of Kolkata

title: Nice place in Kolkata
review_text: there are lots of shops around this road and good brand show rooms makes shopping easy. Easy to get Taxi from all across the city.

title: Enjoy the street
review_text:
Park Street ...a must walk down the street from the maidan side to the park circus side. 
You get to see a few lovely buildings and the st Xaviers college. 
Suggest to do an early morning walk so you avoid the office rush. 
In the evening choose a restaurant and spend a great evening. 
Please do try the roll shops ...the golden spoon and kusum are a must try....

title: Best place to buy lovely Saris and Lehengas
review_text:
This is the best place with newest fashion and designer saris lehengas. The kinda of stuff you can buy for money you spend has the best proportion in india. Best value for your money and best quality. 
Latest designs. 
I always go there for any weddings shopping. 
Shops provide snacks and at times meals to make your shopping experience less stressful.

title: Good place for shopping
review_text: It's a nice and sophisticated place where you can find most of the branded outlets. Things are not very much expensive in general and designs are really exclusive. However need to check the traffic since it's one-way sometimes.

title: One of the known place of kolkata
review_text: Park street is one of the known place of kolkata. With number of big brand shops and luxury hotel. Park street is best to visit during christmas. The whole area is made ready like a bride.

title: Our lovely Park Street
review_text: Park street is a fast-paced, fun environment. No two days are ever the same. Great location in Brickell. Free parking, good snacks, good benefits. Management is always accessible and willing to listen. Company has grown almost 50% in the last year. Room for growth - self promoting organization but recent growth has made space tight.

title: parks street
review_text: Good place for you if you are shopoholic.the rates are cheap and things are nice.Also nice place to eat streat food.

title: old world charm..
review_text: my whole life has been in and around this area..vibrant place with lots of dining options. the most happening place in the city.

title: Park Street
review_text: This is called one of Kolkata's industrial hub where we have big organisations and business offices. It's one of Kolkata's famous area to visit in the evening. At the time Christmas till new year this place looks awesome.

title: Nhyj
review_text: Park street is the best place to visit in kolkatta. All the restaurant,bar,eatery,hotels,Shopping are nearby. The place is really happening with all types of crowds.

title: Nice place in Kolkata
review_text: This place is main attraction for foodies and shoppers..You will definitely enjoy because of nice restaurant there ..Local S hoping area is also near by from park street

title: "The" street in Kolkata. Why go?
review_text: Well, *because*, that's why. It's so worth the short stroll simply for the history. I'd suggest walking from the west from the intersection of the main road, river at your back, and walk east. Stop at Peter Cat while you do & kill two birds with one stone:)

title: The must-see street of Kolkata
review_text: Park street continues to be the heart of night-life Kolkata with restaurants and shops. If you are travelling around Christmas, Park Street is festively adorned with lights, reminding you of it's colonial past.

title: Neat and posh street in Kolkata
review_text: I spent 10 days in Calcutta with my family, in connection with my daughters admission at Indian Institute of Management Calcutta situated in Joka. We stayed in a hotel in Roland street, and another Astoria hotel and finally in IIM campus Joka. In most of the areas the roads were not neat crowded with street vendors etc-. But when we reached Park Street, it was a different experience. Neat place with posh buildings and hotels etc. I can say say that this is the very special place we liked.

title: Busy commercial street
review_text: Lots of western style food joints, shops, bars, hotels, etc. Very expensive by local standards but always busy. For tourists like me from England and similar countries it's not especially interesting for sightseeing, although it's definitely a focal point for lively bars/clubs in the evenings...

title: Old Kolkata
review_text: You can visit this place as most of the good food joints are in this place as well as the old heritage buildings.

title: Good place
review_text: I like walking through parkstreet specially on Christmas Eve it is fully decorated and on 31st December night the road is full of 1000 of peoples

title: THE Street of Kolkata
review_text: This is THE Street of Kolkata, the equivalent of Orchard Street of Singapore. Its packed with restaurants of all cuisines and shops and auction houses, the Park hotel, Flury’s , Moulin Rouge, Au Bon Pain, Barbeque, offices, hair-dressers, book shops. Ít joins the equally famous Chowringhee Road at one end. The highlight of Park Street is Christmas season when the street is literally lit up like a Christmas tree.

title: Very busy!
review_text: One of the busiest streets of Kolkata and houses most of the commercial complexes and the evergreen St. Xavier's College. Has recently been renamed as Mother Teresa Sarani!

title: Symbol of City of Joy- Always lively
review_text: One of the happening places in Kolkata with all the eatery chains and happening pubs in town. Also a place to window shop as well as street shopping. Best time to visit is during Christmas when street is decorated like bride and can see good crowd enjoying the joy of kolkata

title: Food Street, office Street and hard to find parking Street ?
review_text:
Charm of old kolkata and a sprawling eateries and restaurants. It's hard to find parking on and around the street especially when you want it. Better to ride a cab or Metro... 

Park Street is the place to go during Christmas and new year. The entire Street is decked up. The main stretch is a crowd puller and lots of Christmas decorations. I like to go in spite of all the rush..

title: Mesmarizing
review_text: This is the heart of city and most popular among the locals and tourists for many reasons; namely shopping, all types of eating, drinking - kind of restaurant and bar area with great night activities for fun lovers

title: Always buzzing
review_text: Perfect place for having some time out with friends, partying or having some good food at some of the quality restaurants there.

title: Amazing place for trendsetters
review_text: This is the ultimate destination for the people of Kolkata. The best time to visit this place is during christmas, the whole place is crowded like anything even in the wee hours. This place also has many famous restaurants like Arsalan and many of them specialize in mughal food. A must visit place when you are in Kolkata

title: Fun on the Street...
review_text: Park street is the place to ride on your own legs & enjoy the city. The place is full of restaurants & shop for doing some local & branded both shopping. Its a great place for those who like to explore the city on there feets.

title: Awsome
review_text: Great place in kolkata for booze lovers and party people whatever u want its here. A must visit if u r a party animal and ur in kolkata

title: Good Shopping
review_text:
Very busy a lot of the time - and the traffic in this area can be bad (you can use the metro). 

Great selection of shops.

title: Experience Feet to Flight
review_text: Here you are your own boss for doing your own things be it purchasing or be it Spending.from footpath to the elegant Malls. From tasty Rossogollas to mouth watering continental food, you can enjoy here.Traditions and Trends are park of this Park Street.

title: upmarket shopping and eating
review_text: this is for the ones looking for western style high street kind. Many upmarket hotels and restaurants. Good shopping places.

title: Lovely shopping area with iconic restaurants
review_text: Park Street has some wonderful restaurants that you must visit. Peter Cat, Flury's, One Step Up and Barbq are institutions in themselves, with food to look forward to. Recently, it has undergone a makeover. Visit Park Street during the Christmas-New Year weekend to remind yourself of the Raj era.

title: Park Street
review_text: All about the Saaheb heritage of Calcutta. What restaurants! Sadly, the music [ that we had heard so much about from the old timers] is almost not there. But food is still great. Terrific options. Full of life.

title: city of joy
review_text: very nice place to hangout. it was very good place to move around with friends. there very good no of hotels were there around this place like the park hotel. which is a very good hotel to stay and a bar at its ground floor which was very good. simply i love this place.

title: A journey through colonial past of British Calcutta
review_text: Whenever I visit Park Street, I become nostalgic. I feel the colonial past come alive. The age old buildings, Church, mansions, graveyard take me to the forgotten era. I think this happens to everyone, and which makes lots of people visiting Park street on the occasion of Christmas. I visited Park Street in different times of the day. Early morning and evening up to mid night is great. It is a great place to dine out, has the best choice of restaurants. During office hours it's a busy place, many big business centre is located here. It's the only big Street in Kolkata, which is free from hawkers.

title: Vibrant hang out and shopping destination
review_text: During our 2 times stay at Park hotel we have the chance to roam around this vibrant location full with hangout joints and shopping options. It's a must visit if you plan to visit Kolkata.

title: Never happened that I went to Kolkata but didn't visit Park street
review_text:
It was nostalgic for me to walk through the Park street, we had bit of a shopping in mind. Few saree shops were open, managed to get some good collections from RANGULI. 

You can find McDonalds and Pizza Hut somewhere in that street.

title: MOST HAPPENING PLACE IN KOLKATA
review_text: always love to be around. has a diff charm which one will miss if they don't walk down d road. old moren charm and the eateries are all class apart.

title: Most happening place in Kolkata....
review_text: Park Street is a beautiful area to visit. Its definitely one of the most happening place in Kolkata. Lots of good restaurants/bars to give your taste buds a new taste. It is a posh area. The best of restaurants with choice of all cuisines. Pubs, Discos all very well reputed ones make it really very special. Practically all attractions can be reached easily from here.

title: Park street (Mother Teresa Sarani)
review_text: Park street or Mother Teresa Sarani, the best hang out place for Kolkata's real night life. The famous Park Hotel, St. Xavier's college, Burial ground road, Park Mansion and many more notable landmarks are here. Many corporate offices also present @park street. the Best restaurants/bars everything is present and during the day time you will find 100+ street food vendor serving Indian, Chinese, and local food which is of great taste with less price. Really one can say Park Street is the heart of Kolkata. even Victoria Memorial, Maidan etc are very near to Park Street.

title: Kolkata's Posh Area
review_text: Park Street was a beautiful area inhabited by rich and elite class. It is frequented by well off, wealthy class of Kolkata for dinning , entertainment in night clubs and business purpose.It is a posh area.Park Hotel is just at the entrance to the street from Chouringi side. It is also famous for reputed Chinese restaurants which attracts a large no. of guests of various nationalities.We had dinner at one of our favourite restaurant.Food was excellent and tasty . Park Street has coffee shop's, Indian snack shops and Indian restaurants as well Some private companies have their offices ,thus it is a very busy street.Accordingly traffic regulations are enforced strictly.This place is nearer to the Kolkata Maidan,Bila Planetarium,Victoria Memorial.God place for window shopping as well. More

title: Most happening place
review_text: Its definitely one of the most happening place in Kolkata. Lots of good restaurants/bars to give your taste buds a new taste.

title: Busy and noisy
review_text: Park street has it all, coffee shops, book stores, restaurants, The Park Hotel. Practically all attractions can be reached easily from here. Don't bother with yellow ambassador cabs, they rip westerners off something terrible. Use Uber or OLA apps for cabs. Cheap as chips. I spent two hours travelling in an uber for 6 UK pounds.

title: Dissapointed
review_text: Was hoping to see a much modern take but it was still eerie. Very old and dirty streets. Managed to find a bookstore though.

title: Park Street.. a place to be nostalgic !!
review_text: Park Street is the heart of 'City of Joy' Kolkata. You will find every thing here as per your choice. Best hotels are there. Best cafes are there. Best market is there. Best sellers are there.. You will be mad to see the spontaneous crowd over Park Street. Calcutta lives with Park Street.

title: park street
review_text: this street has many good restaurants and is definitely a god place to go to if you want to enjoy your meals in Kolkatta

title: Last place to miss while in KOLKATA
review_text: Park Street is the most happening place. The best of restaurants with choice of all cuisines. Pubs, Discos all very well reputed ones make it really very special. Under the imposing presence of great LIC Queens Mansions building the corner of park street and Russel Street is a two hundred meter stretch each way which is worth hanging around in the afternoon to late nights

title: Dine out
review_text: Place of lights place of intellect place of good food and everything good. Name any restaurant pub disc this is superr place ...

title: Must visit place while in Kolkata
review_text: This is the most oldest and famous street in Kolkata. You will find each and every thing you need that too from budget to luxury. All big brand stores shopping malls Restaurants Pubs . Can watch night life of this historical city here.

title: One of the most happening place in kolkata
review_text: One of the most happening place in kolkata. Everything is available here. You can call it as 'Las Vegas' of Kolkata. Park Street is a famous thoroughfare in the city of Kolkata. Night scene in Park Street is amazing. Most of the famous branded shops are available here. Night life is awesome.

title: Food Street of Kolkata
review_text: One can feel the heartbeat of Kolkata in Park Street. With its many restaurants and pubs, it is the most popular dining destination in Kolkata. People lovingly call it "Food Street" and "The Street that Never Sleeps". Park Street, officially now Mother Teresa Sarani, was earlier known as Burial Ground Road. Kolkata’s night life is centered around this famous thoroughfare. Popular joints are Tantra-The Park, Moulin Rouge, Trincas Ming Room, KFC, Peter Cat, Flurys etc. Important buildings on this street are Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, and a Seventh-day Adventist Church. The South Park Street Cemetery has cenotaphs and tombs of famous personalities of British era. Park Street is colourfully decorated for Diwali, Christmas Day and New Year's Eve celebration. More

title: Crowded and dusty
review_text: While this is still the bustling glittery heritage path of the city, it needs to clean up the streets. The cafes and stores are delightful to be in.

title: Slightly disappointed
review_text: I was hoping to taste some lip smacking street food, didn't find much except the classic calcutta egg rolls. May be I was not given right directions.

title: Best Kolkata can offer
review_text: It's not just a street. It's a complete area. It has everything you need and something for everyone. It's Kolkata's major corporate district . But it also hosts the best clubs , pubs cafes and hotels. It is also a good location to shop. Connectivity is good.

title: Most happening Street of Kolkata....full of life !!
review_text: Park Street is the most happening Street of Kolkata....worth visiting for enjoying food, road side purchasing, pubs etc

title: Happening place
review_text: Wine and dine are the two words one can associate with park street. Plenty of restaurants to choose from, with varied cuisines, and a lot of good party places definitely lights up the place especially during weekends!

title: a must visit
review_text:
a very busy centralized official area - with a combination of educational places and a good night life. 
morning meant for education hub 
afternoon for business hub 
and evening and dinner for relaxation and night life including all sort of restaurant and clubs and all.

title: A must see if in kolkata
review_text: A place that has shops shops and shops ... And so muh heritage buildings around .. U realise you are in the part of kolkata that has a history to it.. Flurys is still around and looks lovely.. It was raining when we visited and that lend a more romantic mood to the street .. Very busy .. Very bustling .. But walking down the street you can almost expect to hear the victorias and carriage of old kolkata.

title: The 3 different areas and times of the same street
review_text:
Every Kolkatan must have been there on a number of occasions. What amazes me is the diversity here. If you are nearer to the Mallikbazar crossing early in the morning, all the educational institutions are abuzz with pupils. Spend a a couple of hours and move to the central area of the street, it wears a look of serious business district with lots of sales showrooms and offices of old, medium sized companies. As the sun sets down, the side on JL Nehru Rd becomes the party center of the city. 
Everybody interested in the city should walk the entire street at least once in their lifetime (Not suitable as a summer / monsoon activity) More

title: The Highlight of Kolkata
review_text: This was the highlight of our trip to Kolkata!! We walked the entire stretch of Park Street just to get that 'local feel'. It certainly wasn't for the faint-hearted, I can say for sure. The traffic is EXTREMELY chaotic, the driving in India isn't like in Europe, but the whole experience was FANTASTIC!!! We enjoyed the chaos, and think that this is the BEST way to see how the locals go about with their daily lives. Highly recommended to all the adventurous souls out there!!

title: Hectic
review_text: It is one of most elite place in Kolkata. You will get everything in Park Street from roadside hawkers to exclusive showrooms. Many famous restaurants, bars and clubs are situated there. Parking is a big hassle so going by cab is the best option.

title: New Market place.. Thats all !!!
review_text: Nothing New, But good Market to explore and buy few things in kolkatta. But please bargain all. Pretty Crowded place. Be careful of pick pockets.

title: christmas area
review_text: in kolkata it is the place where all the christmas celebration is done.many toys,caps etc were being sold during christmas.

title: Great bookshops & tasty Kali rolls
review_text: You can definitely kill a few hours strolling down Calcutta's buzzing main street with its great bookshops, restaurants, cafes & street food. Try a Kali roll at one of the stalls there great. The old cemetery down the end of the street is also good for a visit...

title: the heart of Calcutta
review_text: a must visit if in Calcutta. the original retaurant street of Calcutta, with bars, nightclubs, great shopping including books from the street. Old colonial buildings , The iconic Flurys for tea , or breakfast, and on taking a turn one can walk to new market in 10 minutes.

title: park street
review_text: there are lots of shops, centally located area , nice and clean area, newly modern shops, availability of every need, in evening traffic problem advise to visit by walk

title: Nice feel

title: An iconic area of Kolkata
review_text: I have been to Park Street many times- sometimes for work purposes & sometimes for leisurely activities. This can be seen on special occasions like Durga Puja & Christmas where it seems like people from all over Kolkata or nearby places have left their homes & gathered there to enjoy the merriment. One can also attribute Maidan's closeness to this place as one reason.

On X-Mus time, this place is better than most European Tourist spots. Whole street is decorated at the time of Xmas Festival and cultural program is organized here.

title: heritage party street
review_text: this is kolkatas heritage party street with a zillion restaurants, bars and hotels around this place.

title: Vibrant Old City

title: Feel the charmth of the city

title: A blend of Traditional living with Modern lifestyle
review_text:
This was the most recommended place by friends, before I visited Kolkata. 
We ventured in on Park Street on Sunday Night for the first time and then almost everyday for the rest of the week. Was interesting to find a queue of loyal customers standing in front of Mocambo on Sunday night, They preferred to sweat in the sweltering humidity than try any other place. 
That place gives a glimpse of how Kolkata has a mix of intelligentsia, anglophiles and the quintessential Bengali Babu. Eating in a Kolkata restaurant is not just food , 
but also the chatter of all othere present in the Dining room, yes the hum is louder than most cities,but kind of blends with the settings and is much unobtrusive. 

Park street, has beautifule art deco buildings, Many modern steel -glass concrete buildings, and many old buildings from 1940s revamped to accommodate the modern living. 

I found myself wondering how it must have been to live here in the 40s in the relaxed times. Today Park street is a noisy place, Flurry's is full of hustle bustle.Marco Polo stares in quiet elegance, and there is a hum of so many eateries and shopping places with the ever increasing traffic and foot fall. This is a great place for trying out new cuisine and experience the essence of Kolkata, where little time capsules from the earlier century continue to thrive with the fast paced modernity. More

title: Gm
review_text:

review_text: The daily visit in park street started in my life since March, 2007. So in the last 9 years I am visiting this place everyday. The place is always brings happiness in your life, U can see all the very best restaurants in this location. The famous Fluris is also located here. All the branded restaurants such as Macdonald, KFC, Bar-b-queue, Peter cat have their presence here.

title: Foodie's Paradise
review_text: Walk down the Park Street and hog on the delicious breakfast at Flury's, dinner at Peter Cat and Lunch in Shiraz

title: The Heart of Kolkata
review_text: The pubs and the restaurants on this street are very well-known and even now on major occassions people throng this area with friends and family in the evenings to enjoy the fantastic food and great atmosphere.

title: The City of Joy
review_text: This photo was taken at the very popular Metro city in India known as Kolkata. One of the most busy, beautiful and well arranged city I have ever seen in my life. This is also known as "The city of joy"

title: Nice hangout place
review_text: With all good food joints and pubs this is one the most happening place in kolkata. Very well connected with rest of the city by bus and metro. Tram can also be taken from esplanade. Apart from all bug brands showrooms, Next to it there is an bargain market called new market which offer good clothing option at reasonable price.

title: Visit to Flurrys is a must
review_text: Only went to Flurrys which was a wonderful experience. Bought several of their famous bakery items which my family enjoyed when I returned.

title: Old Charm still alive
review_text: This heritage street of Kolkata was and is synonymous of Kolkata's night life. A small stretch contains number of bars and restaurants. Despite number of new malls coming, and not even one on this street, this still retains its charm and warmth. This is very attractively illuminated in Christmas and New year.

title: Not for us Americans
review_text:
I happened to have ended up in Kolkata and had to walk through Park St may times during my one week stay... and let me tell you, I went through all of the reviews for Park Street, most are written by Indian citizens. 
Us Americans have much higher standards and different meanings for "tourist attraction." If Park St at all catered to foreign tourists, they would try to minimize the horrible smells and disgusting dirt on this street, just to give an example. 
Yes, if you have nothing to do in Kolkata, suck it up and walk Park Street - as an experience - to see the stark difference of what a popular street by Indian standards looks like, in comparison to a popular street by American standards (Lincoln Rd Miami, 34th St NY, Rodeo Dr LA, etc) 

Sorry for sounding like a spoiled American, but I want the perspective of a foreign tourist to be a part of the reviews here - while more than 90% of them are written by 'Indian tourists' who have different standards. More

review_text:
This street is famous. It has all the expensive shops the western world knows. It has very good restaurants and clubs to party in. Prices are high but for a good reason. I come here often to go eat with my friendsm thats the best aspect of Park Street, its food! 

J

To name a few, we have the iconic Flurry's, Mocambo, Peter Cat, Magnolia. There are many more major attractions along with old auction shops and the Park hotel.

title: Park Street area -a must visit

Where to eat? 
(1)Peter Cat Restaurant- for great Kababs and shaslik platters. 
(2) Bar-B-Que- for Mughlai and nonveg stuff. 
(3) Kati Rolls- a small take-away near Apeejay House /The Park ...this place is for Chicken-Egg rolls which is very filling at a reasonable rate.

title: The street of Everything

title: So-so
review_text: I expected more given the rave reviews, but was a little disappointed. Most people appear to drive from point to point in Kolkata so it does not really have a typical vibe of a pedestrian shopping street.

title: It's OK street.
review_text:
Spend one full evening. Street is full of book sellers and street food. Decent restaurants and bars also on the street. 
Walked entire street from beginning to the Xavier's but to be honest, it's decent street nothing great as its mentioned by the people. Mumbai, Chennai, Delhi or Bangalore have many places like this and it's not unique. Sorry Kolkotians.

title: Search and You Shall Find
review_text:
What you hear about Park Street will depend on whom you are ask! 

Walk down this street and you encounter fabulous wealth and painful poverty, grand old shops and tiny kiosks, fancy cars and battered taxis, aristocrats rubbing shoulders with beggars, old and new in maddening juxtaposition... I have been visiting Park Street for over thirty years and each visit has been different: starting from the Metro Station, Asiatic Society building, Oxford Bookshop, Flury's, Park Hotel, GKB Opticians, the new Coffee Day and McDonald's outlets, pavement stalls selling magazines, the mysterious Masonic Lodge and the aroma spreading from the tiny kiosks selling rolls... 

If you really want to go behind the superficial sights and sounds of Park Street, you should try the walking tour offered by Calcutta Walks. More

title: Combination of Old & New - Park Street...
review_text: Full of Hustle & bustle. Here you can find majestic old buildings which belongs to an historic era and new towering buildings of new heights. Street hawker to branded show rooms. Hawkers selling indigenous Bengali street food are treat to try for. It also possess posh restaurant and dining places. Other important attraction which is worth visiting include Oxford bookstore, Birla Planetarium, Indian Museum, Victoria Memorial, St. Paul's Cathedral, Isckon Kolkata, etc which are few Km away from the main. One would never get bored covering each streets and rows. Its a majestic place. During Durga Puja or Christmas this place is lighten with beautiful lights and place becomes most happening area of Kolkata. More

title: Very good, nice
review_text: It is a nice place for marketing, things are good and value for money. You can get everything for every day needs right from clothes to kitchen appliances in this area..

title: A road to walk on
review_text: If you are visiting Kolkata then you must walk on Park Street once. You would cherish the moment forever.
