title: This is where it happens
review_text: Park street is the centre of the hip and happening part of Kolkata. Great fro people watching, shopping, and eating. It is lined with department stores, an air-conditioned market, plenty of restaurants, and an antique store.

title: Interesting
review_text: This is one of my favorite places to visit in Kolkata. Espcially the Oxford Book Store, which houses a vast array of books and a cafe as well. The streets are filled with interesting stores and its a more upbeat part of the city. Make sure you visit Flurys as well, which is a very old cake shop that can make you very nostalgic as well. There are lot of old and interesting buildigns to look at and the place is filled with charm. There are also some great places to eat here and this place pretty much caters to every budget. The street side stalls are equally good for the more adventurous and budget conscious foodie. The place also looks different in the night as it gets lit up by the night lights and is worth checking out More

title: One of the best places in Kolkatta
review_text: If you are visiting Kolkatta, Park street is must for you to experience the hustle and bustle of the city. This place is the soul of the city and needs to be explored!

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text: This is the heart of Kolkata, totally cosmopolitan area with friendly atmosphere. A great place for eating and roaming around.

title: The Happening Place of Kolkata
review_text: A perfect hangout for young and old alike! Its regal which is very modern yet retaining the traditional values of one of the oldest cities!

title: Nice place for shopping and snacks
review_text: Nice market place with variety of shops : with budget as well as costly. Local administration needs to maintain more cleanliness of market area.

title: great bustling street with many shops/restaurants-- a highlight
review_text: We wandered around this street with shops and restaurants. A nice way to see the city, and its business hub. Well worth a visit and stroll.

title: Park street
review_text: A good place to hangout for street shopping and varieties of street food, but a lot of crowd and noise, so sometimes irritating

title: I live I the city and its my favourite street to stroll down
review_text: There's just something about this street. It's like every kerb has a story to tell - restaurants, fast food outlets, sweet shops, old buildings belonging to the British era - this street has it all. And oh yes, it will always be Park Street to me

title: A city street .....
review_text: There is a lot along Park Street. Stopping in at Flury's for a lemon tart and a cup of tea is a nice treat after walking all the way from South Park Street Cemetery to New Market area. Mother Teresa's is close by. So for whatever you are into there is variety along this street.

title: Place for food lovers.
review_text: This is one of the most happening streets of Kolkata. It is dotted with numbers of restaurants and eateries of various types. During Christmas the street is specially decorated.

title: Fantastico. .
review_text: A foodies and stylists paradise in the East. Loved the place for crazy food joints and shopping, shopping and shopping with Victoria memorial nearby this place is good for shopping, eating and site seeing too. What more do u need

title: Centrally located
review_text: Every time I go to Kolkata, I try to stay on Park Street. It is centrally located and walking distance from a lot of shops and restaurants, especially my favourite restaurant, BBQ. Traffic in Kolkata has become horrific, so any place that has walking distance to shops and restaurants is a must! Worth paying more too

title: Must visit
review_text:
Although at the outset, this may seem like an exaggeration, Park Street at times reminded me of the streets of London. There is this primitive British charm to the little eating joints and cafe's around. The Oxford Bookstore adding to the British charm. It's the hip street of Kolkata as you say. Although a nearby street (can't remember the name of) is more filled with branded shops and is a shopper's delight, it's this one that spoke to me. I took casual walks around, looking at the people eating inside the little joints, people going about their business. 

This place is good for strolling around, having a cup of coffee, buying books or people watching. Although make sure you cross the road safely. It seems like everyone is in a hurry and accidents are common. More

title: Only Indian Down Town
review_text:
Though more glamorous and classy in the sixties, the basic structure of the colonial buildings, the balustrades and the layout of the street makes it as close to a Down Town can get. 
Very crowded now and some old good eateries also closed, but the street still gives good options to eat a variety of cuisine at a reasonable price. 
The Oxford Book Shop is classy! 
Lot of other upper end shops too.

title: A wonderful area that is now over crowded, run down and could be better maintained.
review_text: Park Street was once the place to-be. It had the best restaurants, the upmarket shops. Today this place is badly maintained. The pavements are disgusting. There are pot holes galore, hawkers take up most of the room and the level of cleanliness, truly disgusting.

title: Very Nice Street in Kolkatta
review_text: Used to work in an office at the Park Street -Camac Street crossing for about 4 years.During that period of 1979 to 1983 the metro rail construction was in full swing and lot of places dug up along side roads. Visiting after 33 years lot of changes.Many fly overs and fully functional Metro.Great city.

title: Best place to be!
review_text: It is one of the most happening streets in kolkata... Turn around any corner of this long stretch and you will spot legendary eating joints, saree shops and much more. You will need more than a day to explore the entire area and would be spoilt for choice

title: the best place to be if you want to party in kolkata
review_text: with amazing bars and pubs and so many places to eat this is a must go place if one is in kolkata -highly recommended

title: A story of Literature, Politics and Sports
review_text:
Kolkata has a different spirit all together - from the Park Street’s Kathi rolls, tram rides, the serene lakeside views, the vintage rickshaws, the series of old book stalls at College Street; the Re 5 bus tickets; the galir cricket; the Sunday morning luchi and aloo r dum or cholar daal, do make people staying out of Kolkata nostalgic. 

The people in Kolkata share a different religion al together- the religion of sports, politics and literature. The tea stalls discuss politics, heated argument over communism, the maidan plays football, the Victoria Memorial & Nandan either sing own composed songs or sheds love tears; the college campuses talk the student politics and ancient literature. 

If you are a non vegetarian,then this is the place for you. Some popular Bengali joints: 6 Ballygaunge Place, Kasturi, Bhojohori Manna. 

Kolkata has its own drawbacks too: While some would say that is quite dirty; which I would say it is, but at places, not everywhere. Some say people there are quite lazy - which again is party true. ‘Bhat ghum’ is something which the Bengalis would love after a hearty lunch. More

title: Not properly commercialized once-been hip area
review_text:
There's a lot of heritage associated with this street. But most of the poorly maintained establishments here had closed down one by one till a recent resurgence. 

However, a lot of the new restaurants, shops appear crass and cheaply commercial ... without the class and authority that the older establishments commanded. 

Also, the liberal mores prevalent in the party-culture here earlier appeared to have waned in correlation with the changing commercial fortunes and cultural mores in the city. 

At one point it was sort of on the Southernly edges of the city-proper being as it was the Burial Ground Road

title: COLONIAL KOLKATA - PARK STREET
review_text:
This is the restaurant street of Kolkata.Though lots of good restaurants have come up at other locations of Kolkata but having lunch or dinner at a restaurant in the Park Street area of Kolkata has its own charm.There are restaurants for various tastes.If one wants to have some snacks get a chicked or mutton roll at Hot Kati or Golden Spoon. 
One gets different types of food joints for all tastes and for all budgets.You can also enjoy your nights at the Park Hotel.

title: Lovely
review_text: It is an awesome place to hangout with friends and family. It is a very big market with branded showrooms and shops. Offers a wide range of products.

title: best road in kolkata
review_text:
Park Street gives you that nostalgic feeling, even if you haven't been there before. The buildings in the area look very British and you can feel their spirit in the air. 

Lots of options to eat (Peter Cat, BarBQ, Mocambo are my favourites) and there is Flurry's.

title: Crazy!
review_text: A very busy street. Full of sounds and extremely colourful. Amazing place to see. Make sure your bag is close to you as there are so many people.

title: Good for High end shopping
review_text: Like any other high end market in any metro of India. All the best showrooms, bars & restaurants are here for the night loners. Worth a visit once.

title: PARK STREET MEANS OLYPUB OF COLLEGE DAYS
review_text: Park Street in Kolkata is a place for wealthy people to eat. It has restaurants like Magnolia, Peter Cat , Moulin Rouge, Bar-B-Q and Mocambo. They serve sizzlers, steaks, and kebabs as well as authentic Chinese food in Bar-B-Q.

title: Posh area in the town
review_text: Cafes and brand shops are good way to spend time. Also some book shops are ideal place for every book lover. Also anyone can get calm corner at bar s in this street.

title: night life spot
review_text: This place is similar to the MG road in Banglore. You can find all kinds of restaurants and hang out places here. You can find a majority of the younger population of Kolkata here. The roads around this area are very well maintained and it is easily accessible as well.You will also find different varieties of street food near by.

title: THE PLACE of kolkata
review_text: Mother teresa Sarani which is now the official name of Park street is THE MOST happening place of kolkata. Do not miss flurys and peters cat

title: Nice clean road side
review_text: Most of the brand shops you can find here..lots of food option and lots of varity...the transport is good and night life is awesome...

title: THE PLACE FOR RESTAURANTS
review_text: Park Street in Kolkata is THE plase for restaurants and night life. We went in February so also had the pleasure of the Christmas decorations which were still up.

title: One of the happening places in Kolkata
review_text: Park Street hosts of various eateries and hang out places.Its a great place to experience Kolkata nightlife.

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text: A terrific place to spend some time. Flurey's is the best cake shop anywhere and a great place to relax, anytime of the day.

title: Typical city road
review_text: This is ok for a western coffee or overpriced dinner but is NOT Kolkata! Having said that I did visit several times during my 4 week stay in Kolkata. It acted as a good meeting place, but if you are ever in the area take a walk up the back street for a better vision of such a lovely city.

title: A fine place to hang out / dine out in the streets of Kolkata !!
review_text: Its a place most easily accessible by the kolkata metro, A great place to hang out and dine as well its the shopping street you should head for when in kolkata.

title: Only place in kolkata for party animals
review_text: Enjoy your weekend at Park St, with multiple food/ drinks and hangout options. Some Place Else is a must visit.

title: Celebrate your New Year season here
review_text: Easily, Park Street is the place to be in over the New Year and Christmas. The place is decked up in coloured lights .... almost as if it wishes to match up to the crowds that revel here in this season. I found this amazing.

title: Kolkata's Heart
review_text: Park Street is the heart street of kolkata. Best time is during Christmas when its so nicely decorated & spirited that you can get confused as if you are in Europe or USA. The street has nice restaurants, book stores, 5star hotels, music stores. No doubt its the 5Star Street.

title: The heart of Kolkata and its very busy
review_text:
Park Street is the shopping heart of the city and has some cool cafes and book stores. It can be crowded and hassled at the end of the street is the Raj Cemetery and there is also some well know hotels. 

Good for wander but dont go on saturdays...

title: Main area
review_text:
The area is know for the older architecture of the citi, this is like the heart of citi with lot of eatries, hotels and offices. 
You will definitely get to cross this if in the citi.

title: Fun street
review_text: This is the main and most happening street of Kolkata with all the good food and drink joints set only a few paces to each other. Trincas, Peter cat, olypub and other places to hang out, grab a few drinks or a full meal, listen to good music or just walk on the pavement.

title: The posh part of Kokata
review_text:
The happening place in Kolkata. Plan to go for lunch/dinner across several restaurants in this area. Its a post place and one can just go around to see how night life is. 

A must-to-do for Kolkata tourists. Dont miss the PARK STREET ! You can catch taxis anywhere in Kolkata to Park street and vis-a-vis to get back. No worries.

title: Love the liveliness
review_text:
Part Street is one of my favorite place in Kolkata. Love the environment, the feel,the food and night life of this place. Parkstreet has all types of food, suitable for all types of appetite. It has live music, discs, bars, family restaurants, cha bar for book lovers. 

Churches, shopping stores . Perfect for a Friday night :).

title: A bustling shopping centre
review_text: A walk down Park Street is an experience. A full range of branded shops and restaurants. A 24 hour centre. Has an interesting traffic flow management system which is one way and then reversed dependent upon the time of day to cope with vehicles.

title: An avenue still projecting Kolkata's British colonial past
review_text: A wide Western style avenue with colonial time buildings on both sides accommodating posh book shops, music show rooms, cafes, bars, clubs, etc. It indeed is a center of modern Kolkata projecting its share of Westernized lifestyle and consumerism. The best thing about it is its wide space, unlike any typical Kolkata bylanes, never congested or claustrophobic. You can walk freely, safely and enjoy the fine balance and synthesis of Indian and Western culture carrying on even in postcolonial, postmodern Kolkata. I guess that's why Kolkata is known as the City of Joy!

title: Soul of Kolkata
review_text:
Park Street represent soul of Kolkata, vibrant, mysterious and carrying on the legacies of the bygone era. No trip to kolkata is complete without spending an evening on this street. The Christmas time is the Best ,though, overcrowded. One can feel the vibrations of Kolkata here. Even a simple stroll in late evening on Park Street feel wonderful. 
The street and it's by-lanes are full of eateries , shops catering to all kinds of palates. 
Overall wonderful experience and add to the fun/action street on many designated weekend. 
A must while in Kolkata it's a street with it's own character not to be found anywhere else,

title: park street
review_text: I keep visiting park street but a visit during last week of December is a must for every citizen of Kolkata.

title: Street full of energy
review_text: Excellent place for walk and Street shopping. Street specially known for Kati rolls. Nice experience. Getting taxi from this place is a bit difficult. Overall wonderful experience!

title: Another face of kolkata
review_text: I have been there many times, and its always feel wonderful to be there like other Kolkata site its also different from other metro cities hot spot. It would be very nice if you will be there on new year week , you will find whole street will be lightned and decorated and give a very warm feeling

title: Main Street Of Kolkata
review_text: This is a very famous street of Kolkata. All major party places are situated on this street. It is very well lit up and the Christmas decorations are still put up!

title: Great Street packed with restaurants and places to eat!
review_text:
Love heading to Park Street - whether it be a quick catchup or a long dinner, Park Street is always equipped with a café or restaurant to accommodate your needs. My personal favourite being Peter Cat! 

Can get quite crowded but then again, that's all of India!

title: Food fun and shopping
review_text:
This was a lively Street open and active late night. It was still decorated even in the month for Feb with left over Christmas decorations and lights which gave a festive look especially at night. 
This places has loads of shopping and variety of eateries like the legendary flurys and different types of cuisines rt on both sides of the road. 
Must visit when kolkata

title: Park Street- Continue keep British India alive
review_text: My trip to Kolkata never get completed unless I visit park Street, and indulge in the day to day activties of people around eating out, doing some bargaining with the street vendor and observe the ever proud Kolakta Bengali.

title: Perfect for lunch and dinner
review_text: The unique street in Kolkata (with Sudder street) when a tourist can find restaurant, shop and more.

title: Heart of kolkata
review_text: Park Street is also called by bengali people SAHIB PARA.It is situated adjacent to chowringhee which is famous for political rallies and traffic jam. In old days all good restaurants were situated in Park Street. One should visit park Street during kolkata visit.

title: Short and Sweet
review_text: Busiest location in city. Actually one of the best locations which make this city worth visiting and livable. Lot of food and shopping can be done here.

title: Oh Calcutta...!!!
review_text:
Kolkata is a Metro that has kept its charm intact..both colonial as well as rustic. It is a Big city with heart of a small town...and park street is where you witness all at the same time.. 

British architecture, high end hotels, Raj era restaurants, hip discotheques, designer show rooms and amidst all that...a street vendor selling Jhal Murri and chana jor. 

It will be a crime if one visited kolkata and did not pay respects at park street...grab a meal, have a drink with a friend, go over to Flury's for a dessert...and generall hang around.

title: Good place to hang out and get a feel of the city
review_text:
The most popular place and road of Kolkata which has its own charm and has a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, shopping area, saree store etc. 

Laso it has some fast food joints and one can easily visit the nearby market areas like Shakespeare Sarani and Elgin Road etc. 

A must visit if you are travelling to Kolkatta and do visit some famous restaurants like Flurrys, Peter Cat, Mocambo etc

title: Good Place to hnag
review_text: It is a good place to hangout for few hours. It has everything from food to shopping. Varieties of restaurants from low range to high range and yummy food is served with a smile on face.

title: Night of Kolkata
review_text: Park is at central calcutta..St Xaviers college is here...Lots of night club is there...lots of restaurant is there....

title: Superb Place
review_text:
Keep going around Park Street its one of the best happening place in a day or evening or in night. 

Enjoy good food

title: Place for good food
review_text: I think this place is the best for food and buzzing life of kolkata. Oasis a lovely restaurant has been our frequent visit and good food. Nice place to chillout and eat good food

title: Real India
review_text: Great place to spend a few hours just wandering around with surprisingly good restaurants serving authentic Indian cuisine.

title: Trendy Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is a #1 destination in Kolkata for tourists and locals alike. Glorious colonial architecture, great restaurants, shops and history are all along this street. Oxford Bookshop, Flurry's, the Mother Teresa statue, fast food, sari shops, banks; you name it, you'll find it.

title: Happening destination
review_text: Best happening destination in Kolkata. Come here from 25th December to 1st January, Kolkata's most happening destination to celebrate New Year in style AMD roam around and also enjoy local cuisine.

title: Versatile with taste of kolkata
review_text: Nice to roam on street along with enjoying street food. Stayed at near by place so visited many times

title: park street
review_text: This place is quite neat and clean and has variety of eateries , restaurants and top branded shops. Nice place to walk around and see the old heritage buildings.

title: Loved the feel of this place
review_text: I had always heard of Park Street in Kolkata and was not disappointed at all after visiting this street on my first day in Kolkata.. The place is full of eateries and restaurants and shops.. There is ample walking space for the visitors and is quite beautifully lit up in the evenings.. Neat and clean and I simply loved being there

title: Old world charm....revisited
review_text: Park Street is that slice of quintessential kolkata that you cannot afford to skip if you have the experience this city....the top brands, antique furniture, food, style, heritage....its all there in one place...

title: Hustle Bustle of Calcutta
review_text: Walk around, dine in some of the restaurants, indulge the people around, Park Street is well known and famous for its older buildings, The Park hotel and the fanfare around. Take a walk in the evening

title: A Walk to Remember
review_text: If you are in Kolkata don't miss the chance of walking down Park Street. To some it may remind of Colaba Causeway without the hustle and bustle of the hawkers. It is elegant, colored with lights, rich with eateries, jotted with bookstores, toy-stores, tailors etc. Must visit this place in the evenings where can experience the real magic of the place.

title: Good for shopping and food
review_text: Good place to shop and lots of food joints but very pricy.nice place to window shop close to major attractions.

title: Heart of Calcutta
review_text:
Well, I dont need to tell you... you will go to this place for one reason or the other... be it to visit a great place to eat, or to shop, or something or other.. Its well connected to the major hotels in the city too 

Its literally the hub of Kolkata - starting with some good breakfast places (Flury's and Au Bon Pain), or a multitude of lunch options here. 

Evenings could be fun to do some shopping (actual or window) and then go to one of the many lounges (for lack of a better word) for a drink or dinner... Though Calcutta shuts earlier than what it used to, the crowds still build up to make the atmosphere appealing. 

Go for it... anyways you will ;) More

title: The soul of Kolkata
review_text: The only place that makes you feel that Life does exist in this city. Vibrant , hustle and bustle, excellent eating joints from cheap eats to fine dining - the place is a must for every visitor

title: Chris tmas
review_text:
One of the most posh areas of Kolkata, the Park Street has a rich history. The night life of Kolkata takes place at the Park Street. It is the Janpath/Kamla Nagar of Kolkata. 
Also known as "The Food Street" or "The Street that Never Sleeps" , the Park Street contains chains of Restaurants and Pubs.

title: Foodies paradise
review_text: This a the 'cyber hub' of Kolkata. A food lovers paradise. All the coffeeshops here are clean , spacious and pretty luxurious as compared to their branches in other cities. I wonder why ? Even the Mc Donald's at park street looks like affine dining restaurant of Mumbai with elaborate couch seats . You can choose from a variety of cuisines and this street has abundant choices for dining. You can't miss this place is you come to Kolkata

title: Essence of Kolkata
review_text: Must visit during Christmas, it is most hip and happening street, especially for nightlife and for dining out.

title: buzzing city center
review_text: buzzing city center of Calcutta, very lively also at night, with a few good tea rooms, restaurants, discos, live music bar

title: Park Street, Kolkata, Dec-Jan
review_text: Park Street has a whole array of restaurants that caters to all tastes. The street was very well decorated during Christmas and New Year. In fact, it had the finest decoration that I had seen among all Indian cities. Ironically, it has McDonald's and an Au Bon Pair as well! So if you want a cup of coffee, vist Au Bon Pair or Flury's which is right next to it.

title: Amazing place to be at
review_text:
It has every thing what one wants 
Good hotel, nice restaurants of different cuisines,lovely book store, 
banks,commercial as well as residential spaces,road site chaats nearby 
A happening place.

title: Wonderful Hangout Place
review_text: Park Street is a famous thoroughfare in the city of Kolkata. It is Kolkata's foremost shopping & dining destination with several shops, restaurants and pubs and also a place for Kolkata's night life. It is often known as "Food Street" and "The Street that Never Sleeps". Park Street has the presence of several notable buildings such as the Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, Park Hotel etc. It is a great hangout place having presence of several shopping malls / shops, restaurants & nightclubs. The illumination of Park Street during Christmas and New Year is worth experiencing. The place is always crowded, well connected with public transport, parking of own vehicles could be an issue. More

title: Different than other Indian cities
review_text:
If you are in Kolkotta you have to visit park street for shopping and see the grandeur of old building made at the time of British rule. 

Must visit

title: Nothing special
review_text: Just another street really. Heaps of expensive looking shops and western food. Could have been any street anywhere in the world.

title: dont go on Sunday
review_text: We were in Kolkata for a very short time over a weekend and ended up in Park Street on a Sunday when most places were closed

title: Good place for Food and Fun
review_text: If your in Kolkata and you don't go to Park Street your missing out. Has all the best restaurants and bars and an excellent book shop for those of you who want to find a souvenir to take home.

title: The symbol of Kolkata's heydays
review_text: Decades ago Park Street boasted of one of the best night spots in the Orient. It continues to occupy an important place in Kolkata's nightlife and some age old restaurants like Mocambo, Peter Cat and Flurys continue to retain their clientele by keeping up the old charm

title: Get a feel of the city
review_text: Park Street gives any visitor a good flavour of where the city is today. Traditional old restaurants mixed with modern shops & patisseries, an old british cemetery and some dilapidated beatiful old mansions.

title: ELITE CULTURE OF THE HERITAGE CITY
review_text:
Park Street of Kolkata, now dedicated to the memory of the noble missionary Mother Teressa and ever in the company of 154 years' old St.Xavier's College (where I studied and taught) and the house of the Holy Arch Bishop, is the charming heart of the ancient Kolkata and where I have walked over 5 decades. both for intellectual pursuits and with ever romantic passion. A street without parks, it has all for an urbane tasteful dweller as well as the happy, moody and exploring visitor to the City of Joy. 

Other reviews have already indicated what it contains and what charms and glitter a promenade can offer. Now away from Kolkata, I do surely miss it more than any other road or street. 

However, a recent visit offered a disappointment. It has been overcrowded with the cars of ostentatious rich, commercial hawkers and unmanaged traffic chaos. It's fashion image has been its villain! 

But Calcutta survives and so does this old street with the city's young in liberal vogue! More

title: Street for all kinds of Fun
review_text: Weekdays evening or weekend evening or anytime wanna good time for eating hanging out, just park street is therefore.

title: Must visit during Christmas and New Year
review_text:
One of the most decorated places in Kolkata during the Christmas -New Year season. Some of Kolkata oldest and best continental fare makes a visit here a foodies delight. 
Mocambo, Peter cat, Trincas are old world Kolkata at its best.Then you have Fluries ...A visit here is almost religious. You have to visit. 
The only cons: 
The poor beggars in their rags jostling with the part goers make for a less than pleasant view. 
Overall must visit , especially if you are a foodie!

title: Great street with a lot to do
review_text: Park street is worth a visit if you're in Kolkata. There are lots of restaurants, cafes, book stores, shops, and more along the street. Great for those who like to walk around and get a feel for the city. There's quite a bit of colonial architecture in the area.

title: One of the happening place of Heritage City.
review_text: Kolkata is known for its heritage but park street will give you a different perspective. Will enjoy lots of food items for foodies.

title: NO PARK IT IS STREET THAT MEANS PARK STREET
review_text: High profile Zone of Kolkata (Calcutta). If u want 2 njoy the Christmas Day then visit during the Month of December in between 23/12 to 31/12 date. Bus/Metro/Taxi Service is available from every corner of Kolkata. U can alight either at Mullick Bazar or Chowringhee Road to access this Street.

title: Good street with lot of nice restaurants
review_text: A nice street to walk by with lot of good restaurants to try local cuisines. Branded clothes shopping. Very bright and colorfull during Durga POOJA till christmas.

title: A street known to all over the world
review_text:
Famous street in Calcutta ,now Kolkata .The area was originally a deer park in 18th century. As the road was passing through the park, the name Park Street was derived. 
Park Street is famous for good hotels, restaurants, shopping area .Night Life in Park Street is colourful and vibrant . The area takes a different look during New Year. Asiatic Society and St Xavier's College are important landmark on the Park Street. Presently the road is renamed as Mother Teresa Sarani.

title: Beautiful during Christmas
review_text: We went last month during the Christmas break. The street was lit up beautifully! With loads of people visiting, it was full of life. There are also a lot of restaurants to choose from...

title: Everything is on here!
review_text: Come , explore, go into the bookstores, the many restaurants, the trendy coffee shops and just love it. Park street is a must in Kolkata.

title: Heart of Kolkata Park street
review_text:
U wana shop eat junk eat road side do business do party in disc 

Park Street is the area to be in while in Kolkata 

It is accessible easily and heart of the city with every and any kind of option u have in mind and make ur day well spent 

If u have company of friends no other place than Park Street to have a blast

title: The Calcutta charm
review_text: This is the place that once defined Calcutta. The eatries, book shops, close proximity to new market and pubs, this in my view is the heart of kolkata.

title: One of kolkota's main attraction
review_text: This place is the CP of kolkota or the Colaba of kolkota, fusion of old and modern kolkota this place is always lively and has lot of options to eat, drink and hang out, you will never run out to options here.

title: The most happening street
review_text:
We travelled during Christmas holidays and the entire Park Street was decorated with buntings, and colorful lights (of course in Blue and White, which is the signature colors of the ruling party), all, we were told, decked up by the local administration. 
Unfortunately the pavements were all covered by hawkers and street food vendors.

title: Great place for all purpose
review_text: A great place at perfect location for all purposes-- partying, celebration, food variety, evening strolling. It is very much advised to visit the place in Christmas and new year eve.

title: Historic Significane... Among Must Visit Place @ Kolkata
review_text: When you are in Kolkata.. you must have one visit to Park Street. This used to be the GO TO place at one point of time for local and tourists... With advent of malls etc, you have other options, however still Park Street has its own charm.

title: Restro junction of Kolkata
review_text:
It is one of the most famous area of Kolkata. This is also called the restaurants joint of Kolkata as a lot of restaurants are situated here. They are of every type. That means from economic type to the most luxury type. 
Some of the famous places to visit at park Street are 'south park Street cemetery' , 'allien park' , a small walking trip through the roods during the Christmas time...

title: Busy business locality
review_text: This is one of the busy business localities of old Calcatta. You can find a lot of old British buildings in this locality with high roof.

title: Place for tourists and food lovers.
review_text: It has many place to see,St.xavier's college(deemed university)Asiatic society,Musium nearby,graveyard etc.Top of all it's a place must for food lovers.

title: Carnival time during Christmas
review_text: Just walk down. Window shop.Have a bite or two at flurys. If you are travelling as single women be careful in front of the night clubs as you just might be requested by guys going stag to help escort them inside....risqué! The moulin rouge and the be fox is missed I guess by its patrons.and so is the music world I guess.

title: Park Street on Christmas Eve
review_text: We landed in Kolkata on 24 Dec to be at Park Street on Christmas Eve. And yes, we made a right decision. The street was very well decorated, thousands of people from all ages thronged into Park Street and we were there too. The experience was amazing!

title: Love It. Until 10PM
review_text: Love Park Street. It has my heart. But don't go out after dark when the streets are empty. Great restaurants, a few shops, Vodafone is the absolute worst, iStore is mediocre except for the products. Great to see a Premium Apple Reseller so close.

title: Food Variety
review_text: One can find a variety of food along restaurants of Park Street, a nice place to spend evenings with friends

title: Party street - loaded with options
review_text: Been here multiple times. Its always bustling with people. Many options to try variety of cuisines across price range. Also many options to party.

title: Times Square of eastern India
review_text: Kolkata’s original party street. Though several nightclubs and pubs have opened all over the city, this is where it all began and this place still packs a punch.

title: A thrilling Indian cyclone.
review_text: Probably my favorite part of Kolkata as of yet. Make no mistake...like the rest of the city, it's a complete typhoon of cars, crowds, smells, and sights. But the photo opportunities and the great street food and kind hearted (albeit very young) vendors can be quite charming. More to see and experience here than you can imagine. Just keep calm, smile, and be confident.

title: Kolkata must do
review_text: This is Kolkata must do. we were there around Christmas and this street was beautifully lit up. it has some amazing restaurants, pubs and excellent street food too. Dont miss when you are in Kolkata.

title: Lost its old charm
review_text: Took an evening stroll on a stop-over at Kolkata. Dismayed at the decline of the place. More like a village haat than a swish destination. I guess other places in Kolkata have more to offer. Not recommended.

title: The Headquarters of Calcutta
review_text: This street from British India times is the most happening area of Kolkata. Still has many shops and restaurants from the times of the Raj. One can see many Victorian style buildings, also many nice cafes and restaurants can be found. On Christmas Day the whole street becomes a pedestrian street with lighting and Christmas carols and gaiety around

title: Action
review_text: Great place to wander and find some delicious food. Very busy and lights up at night time. Great atmosphere

title: A trip down memory lane...
review_text: We were in Park Street after decades and let me tell you, the New Year's Eve madness hasn't changed at all! We took a pre-dinner walk and soaked in the excitement, with all colored lights, the decorations and the huge crowd. Kudos to Kolkata Police for the way they were managing the chaos on the last night of the year.

title: Enjoy the walk and also food
review_text: This place has a large number of restaurants serving all types of food to satisfy everyone. During Christmas and New year it gets a true festive look.

title: Celebration Hub!
review_text: The Christmas decorations on this street were amazing! Lots of branded shops, eatery joints ...the best part was the street food!

title: Nostalgia...
review_text:
We were in Park Street on Christmas Eve after many years. 

Brilliantly lit up, but a traffic nightmare! Couldn't get into Flurry's. Couldn't find a place to park. The pavement was a sea of human bodies. 

But it was nostalgic...

title: Iconic !
review_text: An iconic landmark of Kolkata. Something that all of us have grown up with. The Xmas lighting up of this stretch draws crowds in hordes and the top notch restaurants and pubs do so for the other parts of the year. From Trincas to Flurys, from Mocambo to Bar.b.q, from Park Hotel to Oxford....a stroll down Park Street is a must if u r visiting Kolkata. and dont forget the selfies...!

title: Must visit during Christmas time
review_text: If you are in kolkata during Christmas time and new year, then u should go to this place. Wonderful decoration with loads of fun.

title: Fun Days
review_text: Party street of India. Best time during Christmas- New Year week. Full of people who are out to enjoy. Best weather of the year. Lots of fun, eating and drinking and enjoying.

title: Street for Enjoyment
review_text: One can feel a sense of joy by simply walking along this road. One can enjoy anything from fantastic breakfast at Firpo to sumptuous dinner at number of top end restaurants.

title: Probably the best place to visit while in Kolkata
review_text:
Park street is a visitor's galore. The street has great restaurants like Blue Fox, Flurry's, Coffee House, Mocambo and so many others for lovely food and ambience. The Park hotel is also located on this road. 
The pavement shops sell a lot of fake stuff but it is great fun to haggle with the shopkeepers. One of the best places to be. And the major big headache is parking though. One cannot get space to park and would have to do so on one of the by-lanes only.

title: Proud of Park Street
review_text: Park Street is the cosmopolitan heart of the city. Take your time to walk up one side and return on the other. Interesting buildings and shops and institutions. Tea and books at the Oxford Book Shop. Coffee at Barista. And the delicious aroma of street food everywhere. For a quiet place to read or research, there's the venerable Asiatic Society, which seems to be hanging on by a thread for lack of funds.

title: heart of kolata
review_text: like connaught place is to delhi,hence Park street is to kolkata..good place to eat and shop with all brands..lovely place to hangout

title: Happening place to be
review_text:
Park Street, especially in the Christmas and New Year season, is easily the most happening place in Calcutta. 

The restaurants, the night clubs and the little eating joints in the lanes ask decorated and lit up in the Christmas spirit. 

Places to check out - Flury's for breakfast, Peter Cat for dinner and the Park Hotels night clubs (go to the Aqua) will fulfill your expectations of this socially vibrant city.

title: Happening
review_text: You find all sorts of restaurants, bars and shops in this street. The most happening place for the young crowds. All the famous restaurants are located here. It was over crwoded during my visit on 1st January as people rushed to book their seats in the famous restaurants. The place looks nice in the evening.

title: Great place to spend your evenings
review_text: The decorations and lights for Christmas and New Year were fantastic. We were their during the year end holidays, and it felt like whole of Kolkata came to Park Street. There good places to eat and shop around the area.

title: Most Happening Street - now changing to Booze Street
review_text: When we drove into Kolkata, Park street was decked into Season's lighting. It looked as good as place out of New York or any other in this seasons. It has lot of good food places like Flurries and Au Bon Pain. But as we found out on New Year night, this place has too many bars who are looking to bring a crowd that is driving out real shoppers and foodies. Dont know any street in world, that can make up loss of income from real tourists by bar goers. So will like to see Kolkotite to reclaim this street back to its most happening status with Flurries, Pizza Hut, Oxford Books, Nikon Camera and Bengali Sweets.. More

title: Never a dull moment....
review_text: One of my favorite street in Kolkatta. It is one of most lively streets of Kolkatta. I am never bored when I walk down Park street, there is always something to do or see here. Do not miss Flury's (breakfast, bakery, lunch etc) if you are around.

title: Lovely Christmas Decoration
review_text: Park Street is being well illuminated with beautiful lighting for the Christmas and New Year. As it is Park Street is the most sought after area all round the year for good food, pub and shopping. Park Street in Christmas time is however exceptionally beautifully decorated and large crowds visit the area. This year several stalls have been arranged by the individuals selling home cooked bakery products in a park in Park Street area. The restaurants in the area are very good and nice to visit for dinner during Christmas time as all the restaurants are also nicely illuminated.

title: Great atmosphere for Christmas
review_text: It had an amazing atmosphere with some stunning lighting. Good weather made it comfortable to walk. There are some good restaurants and street food.

title: Most Happening place
review_text: The Christmas decorations on this street are an amazing thing to experience. The eatery joints have the best and wide variety of delicious cuisines to enjoy.

title: Heart of Kolkota
review_text: It is the heart of Kolkota with numbers of hotels, restaurants and bars. A visit to kolkota is incomplete without visiting Park Street

title: Fantastic place
review_text: Must visit place especially in the month of december it's a carnival time . Loads of good restuarants Peter Cat, Mogambo & many more.

title: hub and heart of Kolkata city
review_text: Street food is ample and tasty. live music club, most popular 'Oxford' bookstore, famous restaurant Mocambo r located in park street. Should be there when will be again in Kolkata.

title: Mother Teresa
review_text: This is the first place I went to using public transportation. It was easy and cheap to get there and there was no fear factor. Not much to see really, displays of: her pen, her desk, her glasses etc. I would definitely go again though just to get the good vibes I got there. People are not allowed to approach you for money. One lady asked for money as I came out claiming her son was disabled. I work with the disabled and her sons disability was made up. Nice gift shop on Park street that was affordable. I walked in the gift shop and nobody was there? Careful, he came by and started locking the door from the outside. I was lucky enough to see him and get his attention! More

title: Lives upto it's Name and Fame
review_text: Visited for the first time and found it to be very lively,crowded but Street food is ample and tasty.Fruit chats to Oxford Cha Bar,Moulin Rouge,Arsalaan,Some very nice places to visit

title: The heart of the city and the hub of celebration!
review_text: Going for a drive to Park Street during the end of the year is like going to lit up paradise. Food, fun galore it is and the lights and festive spirit is special. Even otherwise the street is the heart of the city. With the most popular 'Oxford' bookstore, famous restaurants such as 'Peter Cat' and 'Mocambo' and so much more there's enough to see, eat and do in and around the street.

title: Ancient posh Kolkata
review_text: you must found the old push class in this area. lots of Food, Bar and musical shop around the street. you can find night life please here. The disco and live music club is very good. You must visit second time here.

title: One place in Kolkata which most people in India would know or have heard of!
review_text: Scores of good eateries, cafes and pubs, this street is visited by almost all outsiders who visit city once or more. The place is in carnival mode during Christmas/ New years time.. Although not much to offer, Park street has a charisma which keeps drawing crowd year after year.

title: Must visit during X-mas and new year nights
review_text: Well decorated with fancy lights during X-mas. Crowded. One should try to enter with car in the evening of X-mas. One should Try to stay in hotel around park street to have good experience of night life during X-mas and new year. The Kolkata has average car speed of 20 km/hour and lots of traffic jams. Thus calculate your travel time accordingly.

title: Feeling the Kolkata ways of life
review_text: The smell, the fume, colors, the noise, the people all that make up the scene that is uniquely Kolkataian....

title: Street without park and still Park Street
review_text: Nice place for foodies and to roam around not much to see. As visitor not much to see only good place for romantic dinner and lunch.

title: Old World Charm street
review_text: A landmark in its own right, this street is synonymous with Kolkata.This is the most posh location for business, restaurants and hotels.

title: Bgi avenue. Nothing much to see
review_text: Apart from doing some high-priced shopping and stopping at upscale bars and restaurants, there is nothing much to do there.

title: The soul of the city
review_text:
This street is the soul of the city, indeed. My Indian friends often said that this is the most happening street. And it is, busy and with all kinds of service. There are great restaurants (and expensive at the same time), McDonald and KFC (if you are quite bored with Indian foods. I was sometimes), and the Oxford Bookstore which was quite great to relax (but the staff wouldnt be really nice to you if you travel on budget I guess :/) 
Don't miss this street!

title: Overrated Place
review_text:
After visiting Park street, I am really surprised from all these positive comments. I notice that almost all of them are coming from Indian Nationals. It could be that Park Street is a good one in India. However, with North American standards this street is awful. To North Americans, do not waste your time. Absolutely nothing worth seeing, except seeing how far kaos can go. Regarding the chopping opportunities that many reviewers talk about, they might right if you are looking for the things you could find in one-dollar stores in North America or for Indian clothes that I cannot assess the value. 

We eat in a restaurant. The food was ok and the service as well. 

So this place is overrated. If you have absolutely nothing to do, you might consider walking this street. More

title: Recommend street to stay for travelers
review_text: if you are a traveler in a group or solo, looking for a locality to stay, I would vouch for Park Street, there are many hotels and cheap accommodations which are clean , safe and centrally located. There are so many authentic restaurants serving Bengali cuisine and the Victoria Memorial is close by so you wont miss the sunrise. The street is filled with foreign travelers.

title: Christmas Time to be Seen
review_text: Indian version of Regents St (London), Orchard St (Singapore). They really get into to here. Guess it comes from the colonial days. Lovely to walk and see. Seeing plum cake and pudding everywhere.

title: One of the few happening place of city.
review_text: Been here for quite a time during Kolkata visit. Though not seen enough of the city but still compared to all other areas seen this is the only best place to hangout and have fun. The street has all the s of restaurants some are like historic restaurants some are the best chains of country and so on. Would prefer to go here during the visit of Kolkata. As their are very few places in city to hangout at night and this place talks till mid night.

title: Vibrant Street
review_text: The street is full of shops on both the sides. I went to Kolkata in December and the street was beautifully decorated and lit for Christmas. Good place to shop and spend time.

title: A nice place to spend time
review_text: This is a definitely a good to roam around. To shop for good things at low prices only if u can bargain. :)

title: Hustling shopping area
review_text: This is where you'll find street shopping and the best deals on trinkets for home. Flury's has great desserts and coffee and it is within walking distance to the New Market. Watch for panhandlers, though.

title: City of Joy
review_text: Park Street was very vibrant and absolutely beautiful. It was our first time in Kolkata. Some of awesome places on Park Street we visited were Flurys & One step up. Very close to New Market, where we went berserk on shopping. Great bargains and some amazing stuff to shop. Bags, clothes, belts, tee's etc

title: Take a walk around
review_text: One of the main arterial streets and hub of Kolkata ...so many restaurants to eat and places to explore. Lovely decorations for Christmas ..but the rain meant one couldn't stay out for too long. Next stop Flurys....

title: Ho Ho Oh!
review_text:
That isn't a criticism. Park Street is the life and sole of Kolkata and a must to visit for eating and nightlife. At this time of year (near Xmas) it has a fantastic display of lights and they are good enough to challenge a lot of towns in the UK. 
It is just odd to see the mix of Xmas decorations and festive fare with the earthiness of a true Indian city. 
Stay anywhere around Park St. and it is easy to reach most places on foot (e.g. The Newmarket, museum, park).

title: Awesome
review_text: U can roam around the whole day. The best place in Kolkatta. Great crowd. Nice places. Great ambience on the street. One of my best stress busters in Kolkatta.

title: Shopping Street
review_text: This is a most happening street in the city of Joy. Lots of branded shops for shopping and restaurants are situated on this street.Parking can be an issue since this street is always buzzing.

title: Excellent Memories
review_text: Visited AN JOHN saloon , Peter cat , Bar B Queen Restaurant, Flury, McDonald's Restaurant, A lively value for money place

title: Party
review_text: The perfect place in the city of joy Kolkata for having fun,food and party.further you can get restaurants for every class to suit your budget.

title: Busy street
review_text: Well it is must walk through street when you are in Calcutta. It is just like fort area in Bombay, full of restaurants and office buildings. Land mark restaurants like Mocombo & Peter are here. Very difficult to find parking and lot of hustle & bustle

title: Crowded stereet with old world charm
review_text: Good collection of shops and restaurants. Worth a stroll and a meal if you are in the area. Has lots of trendy bars as well.

title: nice street market
review_text: nice street market good location till over night lots of good shopping are and restaurant , street food is very interesting..

title: Everything is here
review_text: Such an awesome place. Various for foods, shopping and all. Can find everything here. Can come here for enjoy anytime. If you come from another place you have to adjust for smoking people in this area. They all smoking all the time, should come with mask or something that can protect you if you are allergic. Must Visit. Mostly roads here are one-way and difficult to find parking. If possible don't come here by personal car. Come by taxi or others are better

title: Visited with family.
review_text: it is worth visiting here once in life time. Being Kolkatan, one should not loose this opportunity not to visit here.

title: Shopping
review_text: Very good place for shopping ,especially for Bangladeshis. Good Shari shop, Panjabi and Sherwani shop. Name is Manyaver. Shari shop are Rangoli, Shabera, Ritu Kumar ,Shuruchi and Simmaya etc. People are very polite and helpful. Lots of food shop.

title: Dazzling
review_text: If you happened to be in Kolkata, you should not miss Park Street especially in the evening. The Prk Sreet is the most happening place and a variety of restaurants are lined up on either side of the road. Visited so many times and every time I feel refreshed, be it in Flurrys or Peter Cat, or Warldrog restaurant or anywhere. Super place to enjoy and be cool.

title: Park Street the fun zone
review_text:
Park street is in the heart of Kolkata city. Park Street is also known as fun street of Kolkata. This is the oldest entertainment zone of Kolkata, with multiple choice of restaurants, bars, hotels, disco's. With Christmas/New Year approaching, this street come alive like never seen before. The street is lit up PARIS style and the street gets crowded and the ambience becomes electric during eve of Christmas and new year. 
Allen park on part street come alive during this season with live music performance by the best bands of Kolkata. This is a place to spend time during this holiday season.

title: PARK STREET : THE STREET THAT NEVER SLEEPS
review_text: Your visit to " The City Of Palaces" ( Kolkata) will remain incomplete, unless " The Macca of European Culture" i. e Park Street is experienced. History says, in the 18th century, there was a deer park and hence the complement " park" has been coined as a result. Park Street starts from Chowranghee Road/ J.N. Road and stretches up to the seven point of Park Circus.Entering from the south, one has to come by spots of interest in succession. The Asiatic Society welcomes you right from the entry, followed by Apeejay House. Then comes the Hotel Park, a heritage resort to reckon with. There is Trinca's Pub beneath, a place that has drawn many eminent personalities from different fields from different parts of the world. Both sides are decked with famous restaurants of which Moulin Rouge, Magnolia, Bar-B- Que, Flurys to name a very few. There are heritage buildings on both sides standing as mute witness of so many political, cultural and social events down the centuries. The western ethos are still vivid here. From X-Mas to 1st January the street has catchy looks specially with luminous dazzles and decorations. During this time, the place is of " midnight sun". Police are to manage the zealous multitude. The feelings of communalism get overcast and overpowered by festive fiesta.You move forward and find the esteemed St. Xaviers College and School. Park Street is now renamed Mother Teresa Sarani, the name...
