The feelings of communalism get overcast and overpowered by festive fiesta.You move forward and find the esteemed St. Xaviers College and School. Park Street is now renamed Mother Teresa Sarani, the name that used to dazzle in the dark. More

title: Great place, nice hotels and shopping
review_text: This is a great place to be for visiting hotels, restaurants, clubs and if you dont mind spending a little extra, park street is a great place to have fun.

title: Park Street - divider between North and South Kolkata, Old Burial Ground Road
review_text: This road though named street has a long history behind. The Bunglows, Schools and Colleges, Restaurants, Burial grounds catering to White man used to be here. The vast green in Kolkata known as Maidan is opposite Pak street crossing. The road has unique collection of restaurants, florists, Swiss confectioners, hobby shops, huge bunglows from 18th century and well of course the choicest culinary it offers - Continental, Chinese, Bengali, Punjabi and Marwari (Marwari diaspora is large group in Kolkata for last 300 years who came as money lenders and settled here).

title: Nice place
review_text: Park Street is the heart of the Kolkata. This place has many branded shops, many restaurants, pubs etc. Though it is the heart of Kolkata but it is lacking in cleanliness. It is decorated very beautifully during the time of festivals. This is the place where people do lots of shopping.

title: Park street
review_text: Excellent cemetery well worth the walk. Interesting epitaphs on most of the tombs. A real eye opener into colonial britains past

title: A main bazar where all good eating places are.
review_text: This is a lane where all types of goods are available. All sorts of eating joints --branded and local are available. One has a wide choice to go to any place-one likes. These eateries are ,of course, a bit costly

title: Good place to hang out
review_text: There are restaurants on both sides of the street. Park Street houses almost all the famous restaurants of Kolkata including the legendary Flury's. International brands like KFC, McDonald's and Barista also have outlets here. The Asiatic Society and the Oxford Book Store are located on this street.

title: Happening place in Kolkata
review_text:
This is downtown of Kolkata. Best happening place with full of eateries and restaurants. You will find best food in the town here. 
Come Kolkata in December and you will find all kind of activities going here in Park Street. 
Christmas and new year celebration is best here.

title: the park street
review_text: resembles the lohar chawl of mumbai.. a place where you can walk around to explore the more of kolkata..rather than roaming in vehicles..

title: perfect place for shopping
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text: if you wish to buy trendy stuff at reasonable prices in Kolkata, this is for you. go shop and don't hesitate in bargaining.

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text: The best place for entertainment,hotels,disks and restaurant.Enjoy Christmas and New Year party.Well maintained heritage place.

title: Most Alive Place in Kolkata
review_text: This is the most alive place in Kolkata, This place has everything - Drinks, pubs, lounges, shopping, restaurants, coffee house. can be visited with anyone as this place has everything.

title: pure kolkata
review_text: food shopping movie. you name it & will get it. all the best restaurant of kolkata is having their outlet here.

title: Beautiful place inside.
review_text: Beautiful place inside, it has a good location, with great foods and great people. Reception is good.

title: Not my thing but maybe someone else's
review_text:
For me personally this really wasn't a nice place. I preferred Gariahat Market much more. 
I think this mostly has to do with being pulled and pushed by salesmen without any respect for me as a person. The general shops are perfectly fine and you can get absolutely everything here if you are looking for it. Besides I may have just had a bad day. So I find it difficult to say go or not. I personally wouldn't, but if you love this chaotic area and you don't get bothered by this behavior/these particular people too much I would say to take a look around the area.

title: come alive
review_text: Park street offers all that kolkata is famous for- food(rolls, cutlets, mishti), pubs, live music,shopping, book stores, flurys, cops in white, busting streets, honking ambassador cars, its endless!!

title: PARK STREET, THE HEART OF THE CITY
review_text: Park street is located in the central Calcutta and literally the heart of the city.At one point of time all the famous Chinese Restaurants used to be in this street but still some of them are there like Worldroff,Peaping etc This street was named by the Britishers.The street begins with Apeejay House followed by reputed Park Hotel and end with Park Circus.The famous Flourys,the cake & pestry shop is located here and reputed lens shop viz,Bosh & Lomb and Jet Airways booking office are also situated here.In one part of the street Tram lines are available.Some good restaurants are also available here like Peter Cat,Mocambo,Bambino,Blue Fox etc. At night Park street looks elegant with dazzling lights and even in mid night you may feel that night is still young and ever lasting.Park street is the real enjoyment hub of Calcutta. More

title: Vibrant Busy Street
review_text: Offices, eateries, shopping, roadside stalls is what park street have to offer. Must visit if you are in Kolkata

title: Most happening place of Kolkata City
review_text: This is the road which is indeed the most happening place in the City of Joy, Kolkata. It is the place for all branded merchandisers, place for plethora of good restaurants & important hotels. During the Christmas & New Year times, the entire stretch of Park Street gets decked up with wonderful illumination. During the evening time you can find people thronging on the street dancing & singing. At the new year eve holiday revellers make merry & it is indeed a sight worth experiencing.

title: Food Street
review_text: You could call Park Street - Food Street. It has the best restaurants in Calcutta. All cuisines for all budgets. Must go here if you are in Kolkata. Easily accessible. There is also a metro station right there in Park Street for easy access.

title: Key to Any Visit to Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is simply key to any visit to Kolkata. It's the very center of the city and plays host to a number of iconic restaurants and shops. The Park Hotel itself is a great hangout not just in terms of its rooms but also the various pubs/restaurants.

title: The street of Kolkata
review_text:
It's a busy street for marketing or to taste different foods from large number of restaurants. One could easily know this place if he/she went through bengali novels! This place is famous for its crowd. 
Loved the food from oldtime restaurants. In evening the place becomes chaotic & people loves to roam here with f&f. 
Don't believe the agents who would request to go to their shops for shopping! Choose wisely & bargain...

title: Place to hangout in the evening
review_text: Sometimes I like visiting nearby places for some delicious street food like pani puri, chat, samosa etc.

title: Visit to Park Street
review_text: Excellent Place to visit in Park Street. Time spent in Park Street is fabulous & awesome. Drop here and hours pass in minutes. Best place you could relax and do some high end shopping. My request guys please visit Beautiful place. Specially in the month of December. Thanks & Regards.... Priyank Kr. Basu

title: High-End
review_text: One of the oldest area developed during British times,this area is full of buildings which may boast of their longevity. Area is bustling business center too but all goods sell at higher price.

title: Hard Work to avoid people
review_text:
This street has some interesting stores and lots of market stalls. Be aware of people who purport to know you - they say things like - 'I know you from the hotel, I work there' 
They don't know which hotel, so don't tell them. It's all a ploy. They all offer to show you their brother's shop, or their family shop. or a cheap shop. Say no very firmly and carry on walking.

title: Fun place to be around
review_text: If you want to visit the most charming old school English restaurants at Kolkata, you just have to visit Park Street. It provides a good selection of choices where you want to spend time time with your friends. The area is beautifully lit up during the Christmas time and you can enjoy the evening here.

title: So Beautiful around Christmas time
review_text: I just love the hustle and bustle of Park Street in the evening time as people are meeting friends and queuing to enter the various restaurants. During the day the place is completely different as it’s more relaxing and chilled out. I really adore walking down Park Street during the Christmas period. The best Kati roll is to be found at the end of Park Street (the metro end). It’s always one of the first places I ramble up to when I arrive in Kolkata. There are so many coffee shops to meet friends, hang out in, people watch or relax with a great book.

title: Go to place in Kolkata
review_text: The most urbane part aboout Kolkata. This is the main market place and houses the most trendy and happening joints of the city.

title: Park street fun!
review_text:
Very exciting place to visit. One of the fancy places of Kolkata. A bit expensive but overall fun! 
There are options to do shopping and eat at foreign restaurant chains and other dine in's

title: Very helpful place
review_text: It's a very helpful place park street is centrally located area When ever we want to go aby where we can find any cab bus easily from park street

title: Such a lively place
review_text:
As with all cities during my stay in India, this street seems to never close down. terrific restaurants and hotels. A great walk on the tourist circuit. 

Take a detour to Park Street after the museum and Victoria Monument attractions in the city centre...

title: The Old Pondy Bazaar of Calcutta
review_text: The original main shopping area of the city. Still going strong with plenty of history thrown in. The area looks cleaner than it was years ago when I was living in the city.

title: A food Street
review_text: This street is the original food street of Kolkata. This was the destination for the partying crowd since more than 60 years. With restaurants likeTrincas, Moulin Rouge, BarBQ, Peter Cat, Flurrys to name a few. Add to that the new generation ones like KFC,Mac Donald, Pizza Hut,Au Bon Pain, Marco Polo etc one has choice of any kind of food. My office is bang on this street so i am in a vantage position, yes it is CBD as well with small and big hotels,clubs around. There is a historical cemetery on this street.

title: best for nightlife
review_text: this place is good for night life. in the day time, you may not find it attractive or may seem over crowded and like waste of time. but if you visit after 6.00 p.m. the entire place will look different. even if you are not in a mood to get into any restaurant, the streets are good enough to take you into the party mood. it is like an open road party!!

title: A Connaught Place lookalike
review_text: This place looks very similar to the Connaught Place in Delhi. A lot of restaurants and pubs. At the same time, it has a lot of scenes of poverty visible too. A man sitting on a bench and getting his hair cut. 6 people sitting on a small bench and having their lunch right opposite to The Park Hotel.

title: Must visit!
review_text: Crave for any high endshopping or awesome food? Drop here and hours pass in minutes. Best place you could relax and do some high end shopping

title: Impossible to cross the street
review_text: The heart of Kolkata.Too uch of hustle and bustle.But should not miss on visiting it..You will love the madness all around.

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text: Couldn't imagine visiting Kolkata without strolling up Park St. Some really fun restaurants and sights. And make sure you don't miss a walk through the British cemetery. Just beware of the overly aggressive kiddos begging. We gave them food, but they were really intent on money.

title: Peter Cat restaurant @ Park Street
review_text: It is simply awesome to dine at Peter's Cat restaurant. It is always crowded so makes sense to reach well in time say about 7 PM else you could be needed to wait for an hour quite easily. It has got some signature dishes which make it a very special place to eat.

title: Commercial Hi Street of Kolkata
review_text: You gotta shop, then this is the right place, anything and everything from nominal to super expensive branded stuff will be available here :) Restaurants are another attraction, you can experience few of the best authentic dishes here

title: place for dining
review_text: you will find lot of restaurants here with all kind of budget . centre of city and easy accesible . lot of bars and pubs

title: Shop and eat!
review_text: This is the place to be in Kolkata if one is after buying new stuff and trying out some new cuisine. With many iconic and historic buildings in this area apart from the park hotel this place is a must visit for first timers!

title: Street with shops and restaurants
review_text: The street is well known so easy to reach by taxi. It has a pavement which makes it easy to walk around. There are various shops and restaurants to keep you entertained

title: The place to be in Kolkata
review_text:
Park street is one of the most happening places in Kolkata. If you are looking to party or eat out with family and friends or even want to enjoy nightlife in the city , this is the place to be. 
dotted with restaurants ranging from affordable to luxury this is a place for one and all 
P.S : Try to visit it during the Christmas when its beautifully lit up and nicely decorated.

title: Dirty place
review_text: This is the only place on earth where I saw a severed cow head openly lying on the table of a butchers shop. The place is very congested, traffic jams are the order of the day. This place is adjoining the notorious red light area Sonagachhi.

title: old city
review_text: Having many hotels & Restaurant. You can enjoy old Kolkata and can taste variety of food. Can see old buildings.

title: Favorite in Kolkata!
review_text: The best pubs and restaurants in Kolkata. A great weekend hangout. Also good for shopping. Easily reachable by metro or taxi.

title: iconinc
review_text: no trip to kolkata is complete without walking down this street. this is the place of all that is Light and celebratory. the best continental eateries and best bakeries thrive around this place.

title: The High Street and the Food Street of Kolkata
review_text: You can't but visit Park Street, if you were coming to Kolkata. The flavours of Park Street have defined Kolkata for a century, if I may say. It is a street full of restaurants of the better variety serving of signature and speciality dishes for a millennium. The place is easy to reach and is real high on high street shopping. A must visit during Christmas to just see the revelry of the crowds as the entire area is done up with lights.

title: posh area of the city. close to new market. fine dine restos and pubs in plenty
review_text: Was on a business trip to Calcutta for 15 nights. Happened to visit this place just for a stroll. Was great to see many fine dine restaurants. Very near to Victoria memorial and Indian museum. Nothing to do over here except for showroom shopping and dining. May just go for a drive if u wish to.

title: Nice
review_text:
The Park Street is a the main street in Kolkata. 
The shops are very nice. 
The restaurants are very good. 
Enjoy the this place and you will have a lot fun!

title: High Street
review_text: A street by no means excellent but good enough for the city of Kolkata. Better streets than Park street can be found in other Indian cities.. Park street has great many restaurants, shops and markets

title: Good Eateries
review_text: Park Street is good on eateries. I found Brigade Road in Bangalore far better than this place. However, if you are here, dont miss the small Hot Kathi Roll shop at the beginning of the road. It is a must try.

title: Street shopping and food
review_text:
Indulge in street shopping and dont forget to bargain.Try Calcutta street food - rolls, soda water, jhaal muri etc. 

I love coming here and discovering amazing stuff - antique artifacts, books, wooden carved articles etc.

title: the market
review_text: i went to this place with my friends few months back just to get some glimpse of the real city. the best place for a shopper,traveller,food lover and more. u can do anything in park street . best place for spending the evenings with friends and family in the city.

title: Place for Eating
review_text: All good eat outs are located on Park Street. Can have food at Kwality, Flury's, Tantra, Mocambo, Peter Cat, etc. etc. Park hotel is another lucrative place for night life though extremely expensive. As a whole a place to enjoy at night or at day time. Every important place is nearby so you can go to any shopping centre within a short time.

title: Highly Nostalgic
review_text: The Park Street is the one & only place in Kolkata which boasts of being in tune with the 'English Style of Living'.All of the great Restaurants like Flurrys,Trincas etc. etc. of Kolkata are located here.One can dance the whole night here in the open on New Years Eve.Though Car Parking is very difficult here in 'Park St' but 'Masti' is unlimited.

title: Expensive street
review_text: Its costly street. U can't have food in any of the restaurant. u can hangout here, nice place to walk and its busiest street.

title: Park the car
review_text: Walk around and explore the window shopping and gulp the sweet where ever you see one, Its worth trying. If you are using your car, across the city avoid keeping it on hand break or on gear, Parking is a serious concern and the attender can move your car as and when the need comes. Pick up few ear plugs, Long Honking is religion a in the town.

title: Park Street
review_text: The Heart of Kolkata and the home of some big and super famous restaurants. You name it and you get it. Bar BQ, Barbeque nation, Peter Cat etc etc. Great ambience always and great fun and gathering centre during Christmas celebrations and New Year time. Worth visiting once if you are a non-resident Kolkata.

title: Superb
review_text: Best place for tourist in entire west Bengal .But very crowded Kolkata's most outlets are here all great restaurants are here and all budget home accessories and work tools and cheap and expensive rates are found here .

title: Fashion street
review_text: Park street is the one of the posh area of kolkata. Many restaurants and clothing stores are situated here. The Park Hotel is also here. Most of the sarees and suits showrooms are here and you will not go from here without buying one. Kolkata's latest fashion can be found her.

title: iconic
review_text:
it is iconic. 
it has been for decades the entertainment, dinning, and now shopping hub of the city. 
it has been home to legendary places like Skyroom, Blue Fox, etc. And continues to house the iconic tea room - Flury's. Even though old timers like us do miss the old world feel there, after their last renovation. Places that served out of the world food and also offered top class entertainment. Many an artiste has performed here and gone on to build a career. 
While the outlook of the place has changed, a lot of the old world grandeur and charm remains. And with the renovation of the Park Mansions, and openiing of several upmarket stores there, the look and feel has gone up a few notches. 
and at festive times - particularly christmas and new year, wow, this place is the place to be ! More

title: Excellent
review_text: One of the most popular places in Kolkata. If you are into books, don't forget the roadside book sellers, who are unbelievably knowledgeable! Of course, the night hotspots are also here !

title: Do not miss having Bangoli sweets
review_text: You must be here to feel real Kolkata..The small shop and business amongst big and good shopping places are iconic here..

title: Street of joy
review_text: What can I say it just outstanding place of this city. Spending some wonderful time around it also some great restaurant such as Mcdonalds

title: Best place to shop saris!
review_text: Must try the street food..(mindblowing papri chaat!!!)Itz not only yummm but hygienic too.The big label sari shops are to die for

title: The hotspot of Calcutta
review_text: This is the place that everyone goes to in Calcutta, the katta of Calcutta. Teh street is named after the park hotel and is the happening place in Calcutta. Most restaurant, pubs are located here.

title: Good for window shopping
review_text: Its a very happening place in Kolkata. Eating at restaurants/ shopping here may pinch you a bit. Good for a walk with all the extravaganza in the surrounding

title: Very live street
review_text: It's one of the most lively streets in Kolkata , with shops , restaurants , many of the best brands , and since parking here too is a nightmare , better to walk it watching the surroundings and the incessant flow of people : there are still some old colonial buildings that survived the building spree of the modern part of the City .

title: Old Charm of Kolkata
review_text: Walking down the street brings back the old charm of the city and fills you with Joy! The street is full of tiny kiosks, large showrooms, road side eat-outs and the finest restaurants of the city. The traffic is one way and alters direction after 2 PM. Find a place to park (easy if its your lucky day) and walk down!!

title: Park strreet is not what it use to be
review_text: Park street 30 years ago when i visit was amazing place to be, bars, dancing, extremely well dressed people, no potholes, and every restaurant in the street would leave you with a beautiful memory that you would never forget , . there was life till early hours of the morning with live bands but i was so disappointing when i visited in September 2015, but i still recommend to visit and have dinner in Moulin Rouge, Mocambos , or any resturant like Trinkas you will never be disappointed if you go to Calcutta please put Parks street a place to visit at night have a nice dinner and take a slow walk and try to enjoy the atmosphere. i was disappointed because i saw it when is was filled tourist from all walks of life. More

title: Active and happening place in Kolkata
review_text:
Street which is full of life always 
The place has all the restaurants, clubs, few shopping outlets 
Must visit if you are in Kolkata in the evening

title: Lively Place to Hang Out !!!
review_text:
Shoppings ,Foodings and Roam Around for all these this is one of the best place in city of Joy ...!!! 
Loved the liveliness of the place and both kind of market the upscale and the street ones . Overall the place was super ..Go if you want to chill and roam around !!!

title: History comes calling!
review_text: Quite an amazing experience! There's something about the place- you can almost feel the intense history it captures in its old buildings and exquisite architecture

title: hangout for food, style and shopping
review_text: hangout for all ages, all lives. One gets a life there. its never dull- be it christmas or dussera, park street has its own style

title: A place of hope
review_text: A place of hope, light, dance with testy testy food. everything is available here. Looks great at the end of the year.

title: Nice street, different...
review_text: Loved this street, old and new buildings and so much green... it has something special loved it. If only we had something like this in Patna (it was also clean!).

title: High Street of Kolkata
review_text: This is the place which was, which is and which will remain the high street of Kolkata / Calcutta. The most liveliest place in the city. You can find the best markets/showrooms to the best hangout zones here and at the same time you get the budget yet cool hangouts.

title: Must Visit when in Kolkata
review_text: If you travel to kolkata dont forget this place. Near Dharamtalla & New Market, you'll get tonnes of good food & Bar Options too.

title: Good place to hang out in the evening
review_text: Park street is located in the center of the city. It is famous for nighlife and wide variety of resturants and cafes which would include all types of cuisines you are looking for,

title: Streetsider at Park Street...
review_text: amazing streets. i just feel like keep walking in these streets. this is not so big place or area. but this small area has a lot to explore and taste. starting from the good authentic restaurant to street side book stalls.

title: Well know landmark
review_text: I love loafing around here as you find rich swanky Calcutta mingled with old normal Calcutta. You can find a quiet cheap place to cut your hair and at the same time can follow that with a meal in an expensive restaurant. i also enjoy the street food in the area.

title: Most happening place in kolkata
review_text:
Right from mouth watering road side food to a fine dining , happening disc to to a national museum , this place caters to interest of every one . 

If you visit kolkata you have to take a stroll to park steert.

title: Good shops and restaurants. Nice end of town.
review_text:
Make sure you go to the western end of the street, that's the best part. 
Many restaurants, book stalls, bars and shops along here. It's a bit like oxford street in London, but Indian.

title: Lively Place
review_text: Its one of the most lively place I have been , filled with load of people .. even midnight, various outlets open late night ,, and the whole atmosphere is good!

title: Most Happening Street in Town
review_text: This the most happening Street in Kolkata, with lots of restaurants, pubs, coffee shops and clubs. It has lost a lot of its shine from its heydays of the past due to trendy restaurants and pubs coming up in different parts of the city, but it is still the heart of the city. During various occasions like Christmas, New Year, Durga Puja, the street dresses up and is closed to vehicles. Its is transformed to a party zone.

title: Brand show rooms and food courts
review_text: If you are person to buy branded items then it's a shopping paradise. You will find world famous chain fast food shops there also.

title: Clean Street Needed
review_text: It has changed a lot in 20 years but one major thing will always put off people who are visiting from abroad is the extreme traffic congestion and the dirty streets and foot paths.

title: Good Place to shop and eat
review_text: Park Street one of the most visited places in Kolkata. It hosts good numbers of Dining Restaurants starting from the famous FLURYS outlet and many more. It's a must visit pastry and dining outlet for everyone. Then there is the famous dining outlets namely The Trincas, Kwality, Peter Cat, Mocambo.The Indian Museum is very close to Park Street.

title: Must visit!
review_text: One of the busiest streets of kolkata. Must visit for amazing food and some night life too. do visit this small shop called kusum rolls for fab rolls at cheap prices!

title: Typical Indian Shopping Hotspot
review_text: A shopping hotspot in Kolkata but mainly for the typical cheap stuff like clothing and souvenirs. You'll find some brand shops in the area and a Mc Donalds for some wifi. Fun for an hour or two.

title: Kolkata - My beloved city.
review_text: Kolkata is a city where one can find may thing at a time - from places of historical interests to religious places to pleasure spots to many more.

title: NIce Happening street
review_text: This is main city centre with main eateries and shops. The Flurys pastry shop is really cool, a must for visitors and even trincas is nice.

title: A rather unique street- full of surprises
review_text: Park Street is the heart of Calcutta. There's innumerable eating, drinking and partying options available. Though it's bang in the middle of a bustling metropolis one doesn't get overwhelmed by the rush and glitz as may happen in Delhi or Bombay.

title: Pulse of Kolkata - Park Street
review_text: If you want to see the life of Bengal, visit Park Street. Kathi Kabab, Chinese, Bengali, Continental, Punjabi Restaurants, Ice Cream & Fruit Juice Junctions, Cross Word, iStore, Digital Express, Lens & Specs shops and above all Saree-Dress Material shops etc add life to nerves of city.

title: Good place to visit
review_text: Its been my pleasure to visit these place in India. Food are cheap and the fruits too. Transportation is crowded and population is very high. But many places to enjoy and fun

title: Part Street a Packed up Street for Foodies!
review_text: The Happening Park of kolkatta, though I had visited this place many occasions every visit makes wonder what makes this place so hot and happening!

title: City of Joy for all seasons
review_text: Well,every time i checked into Park Street ,life looks cool .With yummy Road side food to shopping ,park street is the epicenter of Kolkata.

title: Worth Visiting
review_text: has an all in one component with good restaurants to dine and shopping in all aspects. good book stalls and has a full market to do street shopping

title: charming
review_text: this is one of the oldest and happening street of Kolkata. this is the only street which hosted happy streets, u get all shops and restaurants on this single street

title: The Champ-Elysees of Kolkata
review_text:
Park Street is the most vibrant road of Calcutta and an aristocratic one with some colonial touch.A road for book shops, auction houses, restaurant, pub , saree shops, free wi-fi and Christmas Festival. . 
Some old yet beautiful restaurants are there like Mocambo, Peter Cat, Moulin Rouge , Bar-B-Q etc. Kolkata's most favourite book store ''Oxford Book Store'' is situated here.You feel free to walk along this street with mouth watering Rolls, music, fashion etc. It takes the pride of organizing Christmas Festival of Kolkata, a recent feather to it.Most tasteful food of Kolkata is available here. Old auction houses remind of it's colonial touch. It's Kolkata's own Champ-Elysees.

title: Do Walk down the street
review_text: So many eating places and lots of shopping too, especially in the surrounding lanes. Walk on the street, enjoy the feel of Kolkata

title: The Place to be in Kolkata
review_text: The most Lively Street in Kolkata. Be it Pubs/Discotheques/bars, Eateries (Authentic Kathi Rolls), Clothing (Famous for its Saree Boutiques), Home Decor, you get them all. You can take an evening stroll with your loved ones and a prefect place to hangout (we call it adda) with your friends. The place is most beautiful during Christmas and New Year, with all the lighting, pomp and show.

title: Nice place to visit
review_text: The heart throb place of Kolkata. Best time for visit is Winter. Coffee shop, Bar, Restro, Park are available here. Many food corner are also available here. Office & trading houses, high rise building, nice shops all are here & good to see.

title: The only happening locality in Calcutta.
review_text:
We wandered n hopped many places till almost 2am. 

If u r a creature of the night, n u r in the eastern or north eastern part of India. Then park street in Calcutta is the place to be during weekend's.

title: camera lights action
review_text: excellent place wonderful crowed weekend entertainment is also very attracting kids are enjoying & also teenagers

title: broadway of kolkata
review_text: walk down park street and you will find a lot or British era building still standing strong,that is histories, and within those building you will find restaurants, gifts shop, jewellery store, cafe,book store, beauty parlour,watch shop, branded shop, corner store, you name it and its at this place you shall find and that is mystery,during the evening this street is very crowded causing traffic jam, this being said everyone still wants to be a part of this crowd, and i call this the broadway of kolkata. when in kolkata for sure visit this street.

title: commercial centre
review_text: It has all the fancy places in kolkata. Being the backpacker, i didn't really bother to spend much time here. But the buildings take you back to the british era

title: Park Street - "Saheb Para" in Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is famous for many reasons,it's commercial,educational, health, entertainment establishments are well known. Hotel like The Park, eating places like Flury's, Kwality, Mocambo, Peter Cat, Moulin Rouge, Book store like Oxford, Schools like Saint Xaviers, and gold, furniture, dress, light, cutleries shops, hospital, IT offices, cemetery all can be found on both sides of the Park Street at its hardy 2-3 kms. stretch.The old huge buildings like Park mansion, Queen's mansion remind the British architecture. Only a mall or multiplex is missing here.

title: Park Street.
review_text: One of the oldest streets in Kolkata. This place is always bustling with activity because of all the offices, shops and restaurants.

title: A safe place for an evening out
review_text: Park Street is a favourite for families, couples and office workers. A wide variety of restaurants/ coffee shops/ bakeries are available to suit all tastes and pockets. Plus there is a 5 star hotel along with a great book store. One can also shop for electronics, jewellery and much more!

title: Good for shopping, dinner, time pass
review_text: This is a place where u can get different types of restudents and food. Good with friends, family, children. 25"th December this place become more beautiful.

title: Kindly visit if you are at Kolkata
review_text:
Park Street is filled with landmarks. Some prominent ones are below. Kindly visit if you are at Kolkata 

Asiatic Society 
The Park Hotel 
Apeejay House, HQ of Apeejay Surrendra group 
Queens Mansion 
Park Mansions 
Park Plaza[disambiguation needed] 
Park Centre 
St. Xavier's College, Calcutta 
Seventh-day Adventist Church 
Assembly of God Church school 
Mercy Hospital 
Stephen court 
Dunlop House (Free School Street) 
South Park Street Cemetery

title: Must for every Foodie and Architect lover
review_text:
If you are a foodie..then Park Street is heaven for you. From the old architecture to the tummy this place is for everyone. 
start with english breakfast at Flurry's and then after a rest come back in the evening to Mocambos, Peter Cat for steak and chello kebabs resp. 

TIP: If you are visiting during festive season: do reach early or book a place as it seems the whole of Kolkata lands here...

title: Must visit
review_text: Filled with restaurants on either side of the street, it is a must visit for people visiting Calcutta.

title: A British feel !
review_text:
A stroll down Park street gives you a strong feel of the history and future of where this city is going ! The street is enhanced by the greenery providing good shade from the sun . 
There are some top end clothing stores , a very good bookstore an interesting curio and antique store , a couple of excellent coffee shops , a post office plus many other interesting shops and on the cross roads . For the nighttime you'll find some good bars and restaurants .

title: Worth a visit!!
review_text: Walking down Park Street is another experience in Kolkata you shouldn't miss! Its flair is unmistakable! People are so very nice and help you with evertything, greet you, talk to you. All cafes and little creeks are reasonably priced (didn't expect that!).

title: City centre
review_text: This perhaps is the best place in the city to go in the evening and catch up on some mouth watering food at any of the restaurants. This is one of the places that still has that English flavour. Walking on the pavements along the large glass-walled shops and archaic buildings will remind you of the city's English history. Go here for some of the undoubtedly best restaurants and pubs in Kolkata.

title: The sun-down destination...
review_text: You name it and got it here! Lively and lovely- restaurants, pubs, bars, book shops, gift shops, parks, discos, shops- its all-in-one here. And if gets dreamier after sundown...so join as quickly as you can...

title: A Street With Pricey Hotels and Drug Dealers
review_text: A nice sophisticated street with pricey hotels. Watch out many hotels say they have wifi but it doesn't work. Worth a walk thru! Beware of the drug dealers and don't be surprised to hear "sister sister you want some".

title: Good road
review_text: The happening street of Kolkata with rows of very good restsurents. During christmas this road is decorated with strings of light. Many people come to see christmas decoration.

title: The posh street of Kolkata..
review_text: Its one of the most posh areas of Kolkata..maximum famous hotels and office are there in this place..with lot of shops and shopping places..nothing to see for tourists..just a road...

title: Park Street -- life line for shoppers & foddies
review_text: Park Street is famous for 2 things shopping and food . You get the best Katti Rolls here to satisfy your taste buds. Also sweet shoops for Rossagulla and Sandesh tasting. Also high end and cottage shops offering vide variety artifacts and junkets.

title: Amazing Place
review_text: Park Street amazing place it has everything u need to shop do visit this place really good place to shop eat and stay

title: Buzz of the town
review_text: This is the place to go in the evening to catch up on some mouth watering food at any of the restaurants. In December, the place turns magical with lights and people in their festivities.

title: middle of kolkata
review_text: park street is famous for fine dining restaurants,, mainly and during xmas revellers party allnight on street.and new year eve, .

title: Park street - for food and music lovers
review_text:
Park street, still posses that English flavor. Archaic buildings and some great restaurants of Kolkata are located here. 
If you have penchant for live music then "Someplace else" at Park Hotel is the place for you.

title: Life style
review_text: when people like me who are basically from kolkata think about parkstreet like a glimpse of lifestyle, best food, British colonial shadow classic booze, cake and bake in affordable prices sometime not so affordable prices . Just go there.. Roam around.. Do some food in a term of breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner. Simply, just enjoy!!

title: Shopping Paradise of Kolkata
review_text: Park street is main location for shoppers, its a paradise for shoppng, Great attraction are mall and shops located on both rhe side of street actually its not a street but a huge main Road side, There you can all types of Clothes and latest Gadgets shops around the area, If tiered try local street foods available all around he street specially Puchka.

title: The heart of the city!
review_text: The place you would come to, once every 48 hours at least, if you have to survive in this city otherwise in shambles. Nightlife, fun, festivities on Christmas. You got EVERYTHING that you need on Park Street. In every sense of the word.

title: Downtown
review_text: Best place to walk around for some coffee after dinner. The rich cultural heritage and modern dine ins blend well here.

title: A walk to remember
review_text: The best time to enjoy walking the street is during Christmas and New Year, it's all lit up in myriad shades and full of people... Enjoy the festivities

title: idling at kolkata
review_text: super place for strolling and shopping at kolkata , the small heritage shops are still there and the british style buildings still standing strong

title: It has something for everyone
review_text: Park Street in Kolkata caters to the needs of everyone - so whether you're looking out for a place to have a meal, enjoy coffee, shop or simply walk - this is the place for you. It is well connected by the metro making it all the more convenient and accessible for everyone

title: Wonderful Street
review_text: Park Street , though not the place it used to be is absolutely wonderful place to just stroll . Restaurants galore from "Mags" and "Trincas" to the Parlk Hotel.,Flurys, Blue Fox, Mocambo, Kwality , Chinese, Indian .....just take your pick. Well lit ..... miss Waldorf ( they have moved to another street close by but the restaurant is not the same) . Book Shops, Street Vendors , relatively Clean ..... what more ca one ask for

title: Everything you need
review_text:
lots of shopping areas...lots of good restaurants. 
Parking is an issue though. 
One of the most famous n polished areas.

title: Must visit
review_text:
I felt kolkota is dead by 8 pm. But this place become lively at 8.. 

Must visit in evening.. all famous clubs and eatery are the locality..

title: Authentic Hangout Place
review_text: One of the best places to hangout. Whether you want to enjoy coffee, or pizza, or may be step into one of the hotels in a queue for musical evening, this place serves one and all. My personal favourites are 'Some Place Else for authentic live rock shows', 'Qube for light music and swimming pool hangout', 'Bar-B-Q' for a grand feast and 'Crossword' (strictly for book readers). There are plethora of local shops which offer tempting and sumptuous 'Calcutta Rolls', the branded cuisine of Kolkata, a must try for travelers visiting here.

title: Lots of variety
review_text: Nice place for an evening walk and then a night dinner. Lots of option for every kind of foodie. One can get a low range as well as high range options.

title: Happening Place of Kolkata
review_text: One of the most happening places of Kolkata. Ideal place for shopping and restaurants. A must visit.

title: Looking very nice
review_text: Very close from New Market. Park Street is looking very nice. One can travel New Market from Park Street by taxi by 5-6 minutes.

title: kolkatta local attractions

good things you can get to shop and eat on street in good restau here. 
In hustle bustle of city, this provides a true flavour of kolkatta

title: Park Street---A good place for shopping!!!!
review_text: Park Street is a good place to eat,shop and hang out in Kolkata...It is very near to Esplanade, the city's main hub. Park Street is easily accessible by metro,bus,local taxis, etc. The great Indian Museum is located in Park Street only.. Visiting in Park Street will make you feel visiting like in foreign ...

title: Nothing too interesting here. Some nice pubs and eateries.
review_text: Mostly pubs/restaurants here. Didnt find it too interesting, compared to central areas of Bangalore/Mumbai etc.

title: Lifeline of the City
review_text: Located in the heart of the city, this place best for visit in Christmas & New Year's eve. It has some awesome restaurants and best place for nightlife. Undoubtedly one of the poshest area of Kolkata.

title: Happy Street- Park street,Kolkota

Sipping an evening coffe down the lanes of Park street would be one of the most memorable experience in Kolkota .Park Street is definitely a must-visit!

only wi fi free zone in Kolkata, though the speed is hardly to talk about. Houses a few of the oldest and finest restaurants of Kolkata. Also houses some fine schools - the oldest and most famous being St. Xavier's College and school. Mostly commercial area.

title: A must for all travellers of the city
review_text: Time flies when you are on Park Street. Choose from a wide range of restaurants like Peter Cat, Bar B Q, Mocambo and Flury's or take a walk down the long stretch to the other side to taste one of the best biryanis from Shiraz. Lots of electronics and other shops line the stretch.

review_text:
The only wi fi free zone in Kolkata, though the speed is hardly to talk about. Houses a few of the oldest and finest restaurants of Kolkata. Also houses some fine schools - the oldest and most famous being St. Xavier's College and school. Mostly commercial area. 
You can spend an entire day with one of the oldest hotels - Park hotel and places to shop and even a place to spend hours reading books - the Oxford Book Store.

title: The most happening street
review_text: The street is lined with restaurants of every cuisine one can think from both sides. There are lounges, bars , book shops, street snacks on russel street near by. If one really wants to get a feel of the place , take a walk.

title: the times square of Kolkata
review_text: It is the most happening street in Kolkata, which has loads of good restaurants, cafes, etc. It is very centrally located. It is the favourite street for all visitors to Kolkata. It is a sight to behold during Christmas & New year.

title: Street Food Heaven
review_text: A lot of food carts are available there and they can provide you mouth watering snacks and wraps at a very cheap rate. It got some chain restaurants like sub way, KFC & McDonalds too.

title: Evening Walk..
review_text: This Street is a perfect place for a lazy stroll, combine it with all sorts of eateries and restuarants like Mc Donalds, KFC, Peter Cat, Barbeque Nation, Pizza Hut, Marco Polo,etc. Also Allen Park in Park Street offers a place to sit and chat with friends. It houses the famous St. Xavier's College, The PARK Hotel and South Park Street Cemetery. Best visited during Christmas Carnival (18th-31st Dec), when the street itself is in festive mood.

title: the most happening place in kolkata
review_text: when there were no malls in kolkata, people used to go to no place else. its the place to swear by - for whiling away time, for fine dining, for drinks, for its music stores, for the finest education institutes, for lovely sarees, for kati rolls, for its christmas decorations, for its swinging discos.. and what not..

title: Best place for an overnight vist
review_text: This would be the best street to vist when there is paucity for time. The street has a choice of good restaurants, cafes and shops in and around it. One wouldn't need to go far for an entertaining evening as well.

title: The nightlife nerve centre of Kolkata
review_text: If you are a foodie, Park street offers a whole lot of options from the lowly yet the intellectual's den Olypub or Peter cat or the Mogambo on the expensive side, one can have numerous options from fine dine to discotheque to Pub. Best time to visit is 25th December to 1st January, when this place is lit up, but beware of the crowd.

review_text: all type of resturant are there..veg or non veg..both can choose there meal..bars are there..for a cold beer or a peg of good whisky.

title: Lifeline of Kolkata

title: Entertainment Hub of Kolkata.
review_text: Park street would have got its name from the street coming off the central Maidan though it does not have a park on the street. The most happening place in the evening or late night. It has an array of hotels and restaurants and many other shops. While rest of the Kolkata sleeps early, Park Street keeps alive until close to mid-night. For the unsuspecting traveler, one could be surprised elsewhere not to find the eateries or other shops open in the evening, this place is the saviour. You can find shops to suits all tastes but elite and upper class would enjoy here the most.

title: Best Place to Get TIPSY!!
review_text: If you want to get Tipsy this is one of the best places in kolkata to get HIGH! Park Street has numerous pubs and bars from simple to lavish depending how much one would like to spend.. Some Cheaper Bars are Oly bar, Mags which have decent food and fine ambiance moving towards the higher side there is The Park - Someplace Else Club, Roxy Club, Bistro Bar which are just amazing with wonderful ambiance, hep crowd and awesome mouth watering food. So people if you are in kolkata do visit Park Street and hit the floor. Cheers!!

title: Busy city, Good memory
review_text: It was a great experienced to be here, lots of people, gotta see different things. See how people live their life in a busy town. Hope to be back here again.

title: Busy Busy Busy
review_text: Place is always busy and has some good stores to offer. It is a pleasant stretch to have some reasonably good time. Was here for just a couple of hours and made the most of it.

title: The Most Happening Place of Kolkata in Winter
review_text: Park Street is the most happening place of kolkata especially during winter. You will find all the best restaurants / eating places at affordable prices in & around Park Street. During Christmas to New Year, the whole stretch of Park Street is illuminated beautifully. Various Musical / cultural programmes are held on this street. during this week. On New Year's eve, you will find thousands of people on Park Street enjoying themselves & welcoming the New Year.

title: From tiny food stalls to huge hotels
review_text: Quite Crowded mostly. It's in the centre of the city. You would find tiny stalls carrying nimbu paani, bhelpuri & paanipuri's everywhere. Huge collection of clothes hanging everywhere. It's typical kolkata i would say.

title: Heart of Kolkata!
review_text: Walking through the streets at any time during day & night is in itself very interesting as there is high probability of meeting friends at any crossing or shop. Visiting Oxford Book Store & Barishta Coffee Shop are musts for me. If its evening time then Waldrof is one place where you'll get best of Chinese dishes along with drinks.

title: Truly Amazing ??
review_text:
It was a sudden plan , as my cousins were really hungry and they said me , the only place to go while hungry is ParkStreet 
I was like "Oh My God" what a place , it feels as if you're in a Carnival whenever you're in ParkStreet. Keep seeing left and right else you'll miss the joy of walking on the best street of Kolkata 
I was overwhelmed with the view , shops , and the vendors. Wherever I see it was anime thing beautiful. I was said by my cousins that the Park Street is most beautiful when it was Christmas . 
Truly amazing place it is and heaven for the ones who are sooooo foody ( Like me ) 
Will come back to this place again for sure 
Please visit at least once in your Kolkata tour People More

title: Most well known street of Kolkata
review_text:
Nowadays this is called Mother Teresa Sarani, but any amount of name changing can't change history or for that matter the future. 
Park street is inarguably the most well known street of Kolkata. For years together all the restaurants,the bars and the most happening place in Kolkata with the discos and nightclubs as well were situated here on this street. 

Going to Park street for dinner at those famous eateries like the Blue Fox or Trincas were a part of folklore.But things have changed with time.Although park street remains the happening street,many many eateries have sprung up at different parts of the city and night clubs too. But charm of park street is still very much omnipresent.See for yourselves the number of cars at well past midnight,the sheer number of cabs available in front of Park Hotel or the neon signed restaurants and night clubs on both sides of the street. 

Also do not miss during Christmas week , as Park street is decorated with multiple lights almost throughout its length and there are so many things to see. 

Parking is an issue here and try to park either in Little Russel street or the road in front of Loreto.Restaurants are lined up on both sides ranging from street food like Kusum Rolls center to pricier ones like Roxy,etc inside Park hotel. 

Visit at least once in an evening,if you are in Kolkata.A must see place More

title: Shocking
review_text: What a shocking state of affairs. The sidewalks are occupied by small vendors. Consequently pedestrians are forced to walk on the road. Roads are nearly packed with yellow taxis crawling around to pick passengers. Wonder where the private cars are supposed to run !

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text:
Crowded and typical Kolkata style. This place is an amalgamation of posh hotels (The Park) and cheap stalls both at the same place. Amazing!!! Some of the best eateries in Kolkata are on this street. 
If you are in Kolkata and you have not visited this place (or passed through this area), then that means you were not in Kolkata.

title: western side in a eastern street
review_text: the street stretches from park circus to chowringhee now renamed J.L.Nehru road,this street is my chilhood play area as my maternal grand father's house was in it's vicinity and in most evening whenever we came to grandpa we used to visit garer math with grandpa by car and while coming back after sunset from garer mathor maidan we mostly visited park street for enjoying icecream from parlours which were closed with the changing time.The renowned St.xaviers college stands on this road and still a education institution of repute in bengal.After her death mother's body remained at the church of Loreto convent in a lane beside this road & all roads of the world met here during those time. one of calcutta's old hotel park hotel still standing with all it's regality Most of the buildings on this street are of british period and still some of the old restaurents and bars are there but park street still now dazzels during christmas with light and color all over with feast and fiesta all over the place.My memory of this street during christmas will be very colorful as i worked here in a bank & enjoyed the preparation of all the people and government. More

title: the immortal parkstreet
review_text: park street, the traditional entertainment centre of Calcutta, developed over 2 centuries and still retains its character. 3 decades back i used to visit thrice a week. some of the best places like skyroom & blue fox are gone. one of the best to survive is mocambo, followed by peter cat for chelo kebab, barbq for chinese, kwality, trincas for loud entertainment, moulin rouge for sizzlers etc. the character you can still find

title: Office Street
review_text:
Park Street, is a famous street in the city of Kolkata, India is now call as Mother Teresa Sarani. It is often known as "Food Street" and "The Street that Never Sleeps". Park Street road originates from Chowringhee Road (J L Nehru Road) and connects to Park Circus 7 point crossing in a south eastern direction. 
Park Street has many notable showrooms, and several notable buildings such as the Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, Calcutta, a Seventh-day Adventist Church, and the South Park Street Cemetery has cenotaphs and tombs of prominent figures from the British Raj era and Kolkata's European population.

review_text: Park street has everything , from local food joints to the biggest brands . A walk down park street is a must do

title: Nice clean place for evening leisure-walk and crawling into a fine restaurant of your choice
review_text: Park Street is a very busy and noisy place during the day, but its altogether a different place in the evenings or weekends. One can take a nice leisure-walk on the stretches and decide to jump into one of the many restaurants or bars of his/her choice, including some high-end ones. But, for out-of-towners, one word of caution - don't talk to strangers / touts and ladies be little cautions of your surroundings especially during late hours. Call police if any out-of-the norm situation develops. This is not a warning though - its just a word of caution for personal safety.

title: kolkata best place
review_text: best street of Kolkata .. having different types of restaurant , ice cream parlour , live band shows, cake shop and rolls shop.. this street is always lively.. during Christmas and new year time this street has full carnival look.. people love walking here and can enjoy delicious food.

title: Park Street-Where Kolkata's pulse beats most fast
review_text:
It is a locality where Kolkata's pulse beats most fast.Famous Restaurants,Cafes, hotels, and bars, all of western standard. lies on the either side of park street. At the lower circular road crossing there is a 18th/19th century cemetery, bearing many records of Kolkata during British raj. Restaurants like Blue Fox, Moulin Rouge, Magnolia are considered as best places where you may dine, drink and listen to finest western music. This locality is famous for exotic foods from all over the world.. 
This road was formerly known as Burial ground road( as it leads to a cemetery) during East India Company rule and later as Park street, because there was a deer park owned by Sir Eliza Impey, the then chief justice of supreme court of India. Of late it has been renamed as Mother Theresa Sarani meaning- a road in the memory of Mother Theresa. 
During Christmas or New Year, Park street dazzles with color. Countless men and women, clad in colorful dresses, are seen walking along Park street. 
It looks charming every night . More

title: The best place to stay and eat when in Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is the place to stay and eat when in Kolkata. You will find everything here from McD to Pizza hut to Subway. Good dine in restaurants and also classic ones like Kasturi. Don't miss the rolls at Kasturi - egg and chicken. Hotel Kempton nearby is good for a sumptuous breakfast and a cosy stay. Evenings, you may enjoy the Puchka on the streets as well and enjoy some shopping in the market area of Sreeleathers.

title: Lookalike of CP !
review_text: Yeah ! I found a twin of our own Connaught Place. This is the posh area of Kolkata offering amazing options for shopping, dinning and so on.

title: The street with many memories of adolescence
review_text:
Our college St. Xavier's was the front runner along this street in the late 70s and is still now. All the old restaurants (many have already shut down due to the aggressive marketing of the 21st century) were the main attractions after sunset. Much of the night life took place in Park Street with many noted musicians played the popular numbers at Trinac's, Blue Fox, Mocambo, Moulin Rouge to name a few. It was once the food street (for wine & dine) with many pubs and restaurants lining up almost a considerable stretch. It has many notable showrooms, and several notable buildings such as the Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, Calcutta, a Seventh-day Adventist Church, and the South Park Street Cemetery, whgich has cenotaphs and tombs of prominent figures from the British Raj era and Kolkata's European population. 
It has been the recreation zone for Kolkata people since the British era. However, in the last 30 years, many new restaurants, malls, 5-star hotels and nightclubs have opened in other areas of the city and Park Street has lost much of its earlier sheen as being the numero uno entertainment hub of Kolkata. However, it is still one of the prime commercial and entertainment zone of the city. Park Street is traditionally decorated with lights on Diwali, Christmas Day and New Year's Eve. More

title: The Glamour Street of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street in Kolkata is the glamour street of the mega city with its numerous popular restaurants, quality hotel, prestigious high rise apartment buildings, reputed schools, shops of branded goods. The number of very old heritage buildings also showcases its old history. During Christmas time, the street becomes all the more interesting when it is decorated very nicely and is full of illumination. A visit to Kolkata cannot be complete without a visit to this street.

title: Street Of Joy
review_text: Lots of Local Flavours. local food, local Market & clubs with lots of choices. You want to buy anything for your basic need to anything to decorate your home. There are lot of local food points you can try jhalmuri it a nice snack and look around the market. Underground market and nice restaurants. Nice place to spend your night...

title: Most happening place in Kolkata
review_text: It always a busy road. Its a hub for food joints and party places. During the Christmas time its decorated with lights and music. The church nearby is also peaceful and pretty

title: Eat, eat, eat!
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text: This is the place to go if you want a wide variety of food to choose from! The place is full of restaurants.

title: Food lover's paradise
review_text: Are you a food lover? Are you crazy about shopping? Are you passionate about reading? Do you have it within yourself the guts to get best things at best prices after bargaining with the seller? If the answer to all these questions is YES then you are heading to the right place. Park Street is a place for food lovers, shoppers, book lovers and people who want to enjoy nightlife in the City of Joy (Kolkata). One can find the array of restaurants this place offers for food lovers. It is a shoppers paradise as well since many come to shop for expensive items. Be careful if you are driving to this place because two different traffic routines are followed to keep the traffic minimal. During the day traffic is routed from Park Street towards Salt Lake and during evening it is vice versa. If you love to bargain this is a place for you but do not over indulge yourself to the point of a fight. More

title: Down the memory lane
review_text: Probably my favorite place in kolkata, it's really a great place, it's a reminence of the by gone era of the British era, from its heritage mansions to the best restaurant, disc and pub it's a heaven for the party animals. Oxford book store is one place where all book lovers rush to when it comes to buying books.

title: happening place
review_text: Park street is face of modern and old Kolkata as well. It also the party street, where people of all communities, castes, religion frequent. It is having all the famous restaurants and party places. this area is famous for festivity during Christmas and new year. It is also a business hub. A must place to stroll around leisurely.

title: Good place for Night Outing
review_text: You will find the decent restaurants ,pubs and shops across the whole street.The location is quit good well connected by Metro.You have the many options to choose the Hotels near around form no ranking to 5 star ranking.Good for night outing.

title: happening place
review_text: this is one of the most happening place in India with combination of old city charm ,modern look and positive energy with lot of brilliant restaurants .Must visit place.

title: Happening street of Kolkata
review_text: Perhaps d most happening street in Kolkata, hotels and eateries are placed all along. Der are also some gud showrooms and places to shop. Unbelievable on New years eve with thousands of people on d street and lights decoration to dazzle anyone.

title: The happening street of the country.
review_text:
Park Street was the happening place as I grew up. The eating places have been talked about enough but for me it was the foot-path(pavement) bookshops. They gave the street its distinctive quality. You could browse from one store to the other going through books, magazines without any hindrance from the shopkeepers. 
The variety and range of product that was (and is) available is a great blessing for book lovers like me. 
Park Street is what makes Calcutta!

title: the food heaven
review_text: The legacy of Kolkata. Heaven for all foodies. You will get all the cuisines here and for all budget types.

title: The attraction of Kolkata
review_text:
I have loved Park Street in Kolkata since my childhood. Truly a nice place where you could shop, dine, drink, dance! Yes, everything is available on this road. But mind you, parking is a big pain and you need to have a driver, if you want to see around. He drops you off, you walk around, you call him, he picks you up! 

Park Street is almost owned by London based business tycoon Lord Swaraj Paul. Most of the land on this road belong to him and he has leased it out to most business establishments. Park Street is very close to Esplanade and has the Park hotel (owned by Saraj Paul) and very old and famous legacy restaurants like Kathleens, Flury's, Blue Fox and Mocambo. 

A great place to shop around. Now they even have a couple of malls around the place but I prefer the old grandness of Park Street than anything else in Kolkata. You need to visit this place. 

Beware of scrupulous street traders who are out to fleece visitors. More

title: Good shopping
review_text: Great variety of restaurants and very nice selection of shopping opportunities.In one area, an excellent Bengali, Chinese and traditional Indian restaurant with wonderful classic curries were only a few feet apart. Along the road were several stands selling old classic 33 RPM albums.

title: Heavily crowded ..Shoppers paradise
review_text: A great place to hang-on and spend your evening - you have lots of shopping options. Reminded me of T. Nagar Ranganathan street in Chennai with shops all over on the streets. Definitely found shopping cheaper compared to Chennai. Though i read about interesting street foods options, the sight of those didnt allow me to try them. However lot of nice restaurants are around for you to try every kind of cuisine.

title: What a buzz
review_text: Drink at the Ollie Pub,eat at Peter Cat or Magumbo (just joking - you wait up to 3 hours for them so go to Kwality ie 95% as good and quick!

title: good place to pass free time
review_text: probably only street where you can walk easily and see many name brand show rooms. Good bars and pubs, hotels and restaurants. can have feel of happening down town here!

title: A nostalgic walk down Park Street
review_text: The same old buildings that have been around for the last 50 odd years. Thriving with people and activity. Cleanliness needs to be improved.

title: The Hub of Kolkata....
review_text: Have lived almost half my life there when in kolkata... As I work at the Signature Hotel of Park street The Park. Best restaurants of the city and Best Night life.... Also some shopping can be done around..

title: The Happening Street of Kolkata
review_text:
Park Street is definetly one of the most happening places in Kolkata. From amazing restaurants, Bakeries to grand hotels, park street has them all. If you want to get yourself some really nice books, than you can get that as well in that area. If you feel like dancing to some happening grooves, visit the lounges situated nearby. Park Street is well connected by most of the transport facilities available, whether it be a Metro Service or a Taxi.. 

If you visit Kolkata, don't forget to visit Park Street..

title: a walk down the memory lane
review_text: one of the best know streets of Kolkatta known for a lot of landmark like the Hotel Park, the flurrys etc.. It is a pleasure walking on the street. Having a coffee at flurrys is a good pastime. .

title: Costly street for shopping
review_text:
Park street is in center of Kolkata city, has got very good brands but the main street is costly n expensive for shopping. This street has good no. of eatery places, restaurants, hotels but is loaded with city traffic revolving around Park street. 

Street food can be tried with cautions and one time walk is good for window shopping

title: good place to hangout
review_text: lots of places to eat. startng from street food to fine dining. shopping or window browsing is another attraction.

title: Fantastic!!!
review_text: At the heart of the city and easily reachable from all parts of the city.Have a no. of good hotels and restaurants in the area.Have Metro rail connection also.In christmas eve and new years day ,this street is lighted upon and very well decorated to watch.

title: With lots of big shops
review_text: It is one broad street that we came across. It has all big brands. We went to Oxford book shop which was nice. Also Bar b q restaurant is in part street.

title: not the best place to shop or explore
review_text: Mainly a commercial street, with some classic brands (Apple, Vodaphone, Samsonite). But not the best place to shop. Some average nightclubs and libraries as well. The neighborhood has some good restaurants but you'll have to walk away from Park St itself.

title: Nice Happening place
review_text: Very good place to shop but the main park street is very costly. The are is very crowded. Specially the traffic is horrible.

title: market city of kolkata
review_text:
park strret is the market street of kolkata. from here you will get all the things u want to buy for your family. dress, sweetetc. 
this city is costlier to stay. only good for prchasing your goods.

title: Life....
review_text: its the heart of the city-warm, happy, happening and vibrant.it is one of the most known areas and has a strong individual character.

title: Evening walk
review_text: A walk down Park Street in the evening is an experience. With dusk descending on the city, all the famous restaurants here wake up to a busy evening/night. Am not sure there is something like Park Street, a road lined with famous restaurants in any other city in India.

title: Great place
review_text: The evening hours get quite busy with plenty of dining options. You can walk through the narrow foot paths some times filled with hawkers selling all sorts of products. Parking is an issue and one has to be patient. Better if you have a driver with you.

title: Hub of Joy
review_text: Best Place to visit there is last week of the year.Roam around,Restaurant for all community is quite noticable.In evening it become more joyous.

title: Good place to walk around in the evening
review_text:
Park Street is like the typical M G Roads of each city, lined up with a mix of new and old shops. It is good to walk there, browse around the various shops, admire the pace and leisure at which the local people move around, look at the traffic and the noise, savor the various eateries, the bookstalls, etc. 

A visit to Kolkata is not complete without going to Park Street.

title: Love this street
review_text: If in Kolkata and not visited Park Street, its like the visit is not complete for me. Like the restaurants and the shops here still retaining the world world charm.

title: Heart of the city!
review_text: Very nice area if you're big on food. Most of the well known restaurants are in the area. Not the cleanest of places, but public transport is easily available and the area remains active for a lot longer than the rest of the city does.

title: popular with tourists, but go visit other places for real kolkata
review_text: Neat and clean street. Quite popular with the tourists. But for real kolkata, you should be somewhere else.

title: Great Feeling!
review_text: The best Rolls both veg & non-veg, for me, I can get them at a small joint next to Olympus Bar. We have been frequenting this outlet for many years and I find it very good..

title: Engineering marvel
review_text: You should travel once on the bridge (either in car or better walking) to understand what "crowded" means and why this is lifeline of Kolkata. And to take photographs of the bridge, take Strand road and turn left opposite Gupta mansion (see Google maps). This congested road will cross Circular railway line and take you to flower market and Armenian Ghat (Look for this on Google maps). There is a Ghat where from you get a good view of Howrah from there including of Hoogly. If you are religious attend Ganga arati at Sunset.

title: Posh old street
review_text:
Lots of old shops, clean & a refreshing break from the hustle & bustle. Restaurants (inc MacDonalds) & shops. Well worth the visit. 
Beautiful old buildings.

title: Good place
review_text: A good place for shopping freaks, The area is filled with Shops, Hotels & Restaurants. evenings are really good...

title: Not Up to Standard
review_text: Noisy, dirty and pungent in places. Park Street may be the best that Calcutta has to offer but it is a long way behind the standard a self respecting tourist would respect. But we could say that about so much of Calcutta.

title: That never sleeps
review_text: Park Street has a life of its own. I love to walk or just sit in one of the restaurant and watch people pass by. Full of noise and nostalgia hours can go by, people gazing or window shopping,

title: The entertainment center of Kolkata
review_text: This is the oldest and still the best area for bars and restaurants in the city. Many many good options to choose from for eating and drinking, some of which have been there for 100 years.

title: The Commercial Experience
review_text:
Park Street.. the commercial hub of colonial Calcutta. Must visit place for travellers. 

Walking along the street starting from Victoria Memorial passing the tram lines, wide British laid roads, fast moving traffic, wide green garden lanes on both sides, Eden Gardens... Everything come together in assuring us the Real Calcutta feeling. 

The cross streets of park street are filled with some unwanted, anti-social things, but restricting us to the main road and window shopping gives the necessary memorable time pass for an evening.

title: One of the most happening places in Kolkata
review_text: Well well well....I love it whenever i m in Park street as there is alot one can do from food to fun, buildings to pubs, also you will find it well connected to the rest of city. Just go to Park street and enjoy the best restaurants.

title: Traditional market, easily available everything. walkable street.
review_text: Some areas are over crowded, Very naroow streets, You need to find Vegetarian food. Gungour Restaurant is the best place to have food. Historical buildings.

title: typical city shopping place
review_text: The shops there will satisfy most of the shopping needs of the family but at a premium rates than other parts of the city

title: Business Centre of Kolkata
review_text: It is one of the prime locations of Kolkata. Park Street remains Kolkata's foremost dining district, with many restaurants and pubs. It is often known as "Food Street" and "The Street that Never Sleeps". Park Street has many notable showrooms, and several notable buildings such as the Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, Calcutta, a Seventh-day Adventist Church, and the South Park Street Cemetery has cenotaphs and tombs of prominent figures from the British Raj era and Kolkata's European population.

title: Vibrant
review_text:
if you havent seen Park Street you havent seen Kolkata. 
This is one of the most vibrant place in the city with lights, restaurants, shops, pubs, disks and many more. Its nice to stroll around just to absorb the amazing vibe the place has in it. 
I was there during 25th Dec 2014 and New year's eve 2015 about I would suggest not to go especially on New year's eve as it is over crowded and high chances you ll encounter a non-human being.

title: Nice place to eat and walk at night
review_text: This place is basically a shopping place. You will see different types of shop here and there. In the day time this street gets so busy with local people and at night obviously one of the best walking street in overall Kolkata. Most of the classy bars and restaurants situated in this street and people used to hanging out with friends until midnight. Stay safe and enjoy the night walk.

title: Good street to shop
review_text: I love Flurrie's cakes and coffee shop. Very yummy. Also like The Park Hotel which Inhave stayed at.

title: The best in Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is the most happening place in Kolkata with the best restaurants in town and lots of shops to do some shopping from

title: crowded
review_text: Lot of shops around. You will find flury, au bou pain, and several other shops. This street is crowded most of the time .One should try paan around the street corner

title: Average at best
review_text: we walked the length of this street on our recent visit to Kokata. It is nothing special. An open busy street (part pedestrian) with a variety of fashion shops and fast food outlets. We both enjoy shopping but could not find anything to tempt us here. Don't go out of your way to see this although it is the only place we saw in the city that had fast food (International).

title: Good Shopping area
review_text: Recently vistited here in march , like the area very well , truly give the feel of south x market of delhi

title: Downtown!
review_text:
Park Street! It's the authentic (if not the only) downtown of Kolkata! Always buzzing with tourists and the locals alike, it's studded with some of the best Raj-era restaurants in India! 
You can spend hours strolling through the shops or simply stand and stare at the passing sea of cars and people!

title: Crowded and Dirty
review_text: Sorry, but that was my impression of Kolkata in general. Would not recommend anyone to visit here. Dirty, crowded, tumbledown.

title: boring and commercialized to the hilt..
review_text: pls avoid,,nothing to see.or worth moving around except for old ..delipidated buidings..with seemingly notorious business happening in bylanes...worth for bagpackers..but not for couples...no charm

title: Big and Busy
review_text:
It's a long, long street with many varied shops and sites along it: I suppose that an equivalent might be Oxford Street in London. 
From the Asiatic Society Library to the South Park Street Cemetery ( a must visit place) via Oxford Book Store with its excellent cafe ( wide choice of teas), jewellers, furriers, a big Post Office and many, many well-known cafes/restaurants. It's a joy to walk down.

title: Overhyped ! Not so happening like other metros.
review_text: Probably the only area with maintained traffic. too chaotic still, expects pimps in dark areas. be cautious while late night walks after 9pm. I took a walk for 3 hrs and covered almost entire park street. Good place for ppl who just wanna enjoy drinks and food. No big club or hangout zones like delhi or gurgaon.

title: Life Line of Kolkata !!!!
review_text: Park Street can be called lifeline of Kolkata or entertainment hub of Kolkata. It's a dining street also for Kolkata people and the tourists. There are lots of dining options available on both side of the roads along with hotels, car showrooms, mobile showrooms and many options for shopping also. A complete place to spend your day.

title: Posh Kolkata
review_text: To me it is the most posh area of the city. The hotel Park is located on this street. There are lot of restaurants, outlets of big publication houses are located on this street. Metro is available for transportation. Lot of good hotels on the street and eateries are not a problem on this street.

title: Oh Calcutta! !!!
review_text:
Park street speaks a lot about Past Calcutta Heritage, the British era buildings, places of interest and important landmarks. 

The place has lot many eateries, fastfood and diners, malls , shopping complexes, hotels intoto is the main commercial hub of the city and is a shopping paradise. From rags to riches ..you will find everything, roadside hawkers selling handmade antiques , garments, leather stuffs and lot many other essentials. 
Then you have famous brand stores ...u name it..its there. Also is a pivotal connecting point of the city ....u cannot ignore while u r in d city. 

The glamour and glitter goes on the higher side during Christian and new year...night life is amazing that time with a lot of lighting and festive decorations... More

title: Lovely and lively!
review_text: Very lovely and lively place in the heart of Kolkata. If you are not sure what to do in Kolkata, just walk in the Park Street! I bet you'll enjoy it.

title: Heart of kolkata
review_text:
