This place is always buzzing .The favourite place of the young and the happening to hangout.the street is lined with amazing eateries and pubs,serving an eclectic mix of cuisines . 

Park street can be accessed by metro or one can hire taxi.

title: Full of Life...
review_text: An evening on the park street is a must if you are visiting kolkata. And if you are lucky to be in Kolkata around Xmas, New year or Durga Pooja, you will see Park Streets best displays in terms of de-core and liveliness. The street is a long stretch of road that hubs some of the best shopping and eating joints of Kolkata. Best for a night out with friends or to spend an evening with family.

title: Full wid life!
review_text:
A street which is active most of the times... may that be day or night! 
Nice place to go with friends and thus.. Full wid life!

title: Kolkata's Night out
review_text:
PARK ST..Once a play ground and night life area of 20th century 'British Kolkata'--capital of British India till 1911!!Though lost the old attractions,present Govt. is trying bring back the attractions of fun and frolic for locals as well as Tourist alike.Quite a few Heritage Buildings are located on this street.Famous restaurants,hotel,educational institutions, 
street foodies and whole night celebrations of Xmas and NEW YR'S EVE on the lighted Street .. are the major attractions on PARK ST for KOLKATANS........!!!

title: Fabulous place
review_text: Absolute must if you happen to be in Kolkata. Just go in the evenings and you'l find all sorts of people. Amazing places to eat and hangout. Has to be on your must visit places.

title: Life of the city!
review_text: Park street is the heart of the city. Old building but well maintained. Good restaurants and cafe's are available here. One can also walk in to a bookstore and spend time browsing around.

title: Park street
review_text: An area where you will get restaurants with every kind of cuisine.Disco, book shops,bakery, I think almost everything right on the street. This street is the heart throb of all Calcuttans. Visiting Park Street on Christmas eve and New Year's Eve is a must.

title: Best location of kolkata
review_text: You can enjoy your morning with good breakfast options & your day with shopping in nearby areas & shops and your nights with good bar & clubs with good restaurants. Centrally situated area in Kolkata. If you are visitor in Kolkata then choose your hotels, restaurants in this area only, this is easily accessible from all the other major areas of the city.

title: Lively place Park street
review_text: Good Restaurants, Good shops of exclusive brands.. Evening time good walk on to the street... every showroom...

title: Park street - Kolkota
review_text:
A great street - busy with innumerable shops ,eateries and malls. Something for everyone. 
The crowd is friendly and helpful - typical of Kolkota. 
Choose evenings to go around if you are there in summer as the heat can be punishing,at other times of the year any time is fine, 
Shopping in the side streets can be challenging unless you are adept at bargaining,if you are accompanied by a local then you have a good chance of buying at reasonable price. 
If you are adventurous ,you can venture to eat from the tiny eateries on the road side ,some of the best fish dishes are here. 
Go with an open mind and have a blast. More

title: sunday morning
review_text: sunday morning scince last 4weeks no cars only fun drums sketing children were making stetches on the road it was full of life for 4 hours

title: Great place to hangout
review_text: Great place to hangout with friends. Though most places shut early, you have places across every budget.

title: Center of the city
review_text: This place you can say mid point of kolkata. Lots of food restaurant. .bar. pub in this area. If you looking for night life you will find all disco. At the time of cristmas and new year this area cover with lights.

title: Still the Best
review_text: People say Kolkata's new food joints in Lansdowne are better than Park Street but the iconic food and bar lane still host the "Best" restaurants in the city. Also, try to be there on any evening between December 24 and January 1 to feel the carnivalesque mood of Kolkatans!

title: Foodie's delight!
review_text: What's not to like about Park street!! Great food, wonderful ambience, best music... Getting a taxi late at night might require you to walk a bit to the main crossing but in all, it is very well-connected and has several attractions in its fold.

title: Food Food Food
review_text: If you are hungry then Park street is the place to be, I didn't get to spend much time there but every drive through all I would see is amazing restaurants. If you are foodie make it an aim to try most of these restaurants.

title: Park Street - The vibrant side of Kolkata
review_text:
Park Street isn't exactly to Kolkata what Oxford street is to London..but then Park Street has it's own charm. Dotted with myriad eateries, hotels, restaurants and other establishments, Park Street is a chaotic confluence of the old and the new…. A buzzing street in central kolkata famous for shopping and night life, Park Street has some lovely places that you may want to frequent. 

The Oxford Bookstore at Park Street has a lovely old world charm. Don't miss the Truck Drivers Chai, a lovely strong masala tea concoction. Surprisingly, there is also a Junior Oxford Book store adjacent to the main store.. 

Park street Annexe has a mind boggling PUCHKA WAALA ( Chat vendor). This old man sells amazing Puchkaa, aloo chat from outside the State Bank branch at Park Street annex and makes lip smacking puchka and aloo chat… do not miss it.. 

Park street is also very close to some of Kolkata's iconic attractions like Victoria Memorial, Birla Planetarium, St. Pauls Cathedral etc.. 

All in all, do stroll park street in the evenings for a fun time :) More

title: Still respectful of the past
review_text: Calcutta shares with Bangalore (only more so) an acceptance of the past. Unlike Bombay and Delhi,which believe that erasing names (such as changing Connaught Place to Rajiv Chowk) will abolish history,so that folks will never suspect that the Rashtrapati Bhavan (the residence of the President of India) was actually built for the Viceroy. Park Street is completely unapologetic about its past as the Grande Dame of the time when the city was the capital of British India (whose slide into irrelevance began after the capital was moved to Delhi early in the 20th century). There are even some brick and mortar relics of the past. Dont tarry,see them,savour them,before the wrecking ball hits them too,the way they have so many historic buildings across India More

title: Area for good restaurants and hotels
review_text: Park Street is one of the posh localities of Kolkata with good restaurants and hotels nearby to stay. It is also situated on a focal point from where many tourist places can be visited easily. This place comes to life during evenings and mostly on weekends.

title: Kolkata is park street!
review_text: Every city has a landmark. Kolkata has park street. It has the best of restaurants and pubs in kolkata.. its always bustling. the old world charm of kolkata is evident no more at any other place than park street. go pub hoping..sit at a cafe or sit at the good ol oxford book store and have tea! you can do lots here..

title: Winter walk
review_text:
Worth a walk during the chill winter evenings. The hustle bustle of Kolkata is at its best. Many restaurants around. 

Might get brushed and shoved many times during a 30 minutes walk.

title: Heart of kolkata
review_text: Love the old school charm of this place.. Heart of the city with generation old restaurants and shops..good place to hang out with friends..

title: Roam around at leisure and step into some of the best eateries here
review_text: From the Noler Gur Souffle at Balaram Mullick and Radharaman Mullick which is available only in Winter or Flurrys or any of the restaurants alng this stretch- this stretch has been forever famous for its restaurants and road side book sellers. Dont forget to try Paan at one the vendors next to Barbecue restaurant.

title: Food and Drink Spots
review_text: Park street contains many of Kolkata's negative attributes such as noise, traffic, filth, beggars..etc. Nonetheless it is an interesting place to be and has some good restaurants and nightlife. Like the country as a whole their is unrealized potential here.

title: Lively place with a lot of food options
review_text: It is one of the most happening places in Kolkata. It has a wide variety of restaurants and one can spend a very nice evening here. But, there are so many options that you are ought to get confuse where to eat. We tried continental cuisine at a restaurant called One-step up which offered a decent food. Good place to spend time with friends, family or couples.

title: Good food and drinks
review_text: This street in Kolkata has an old world charm with some of the best food and drinks joints. Good book stores as well as small old stores, you will have them all. Towards evenings, a good drink in never too far away and one can choose from the old as well as the new places. A must venture here while in Kolkata

title: Crowded
review_text:
Well, this is Kolkata and what else can one expect. 
But the beauty of it is, everything is just within your grasp. The tram, the bus, autos, cabs ... restaurants, shopping ... you name it. 
And it's accessible to anywhere in the city too.

title: Combo of old & new gen
review_text: Nice place to hang out . U can see the lot young genx partying hard. Night life is not that great. Pubs in ParK hotel are awesomee.

title: Love It!
review_text: i loveee Park Street! I grew-up in Kolkata and spend a part of my adult life there and one of my favourite place was the Park Street. I love the ambiance, the joy and excitement in the street. I love window-shopping there and eating pain-puri in the streets. If you want to feel the refined Kolkata then do visit the Park Street.

title: Park Street or Foody Street
review_text: For those who live for eating or rather had born for eating, Park Street is a must to visit in Kolkata. It turns very lively in the evening when you will find people like you who admires food and can wait for several minutes outside the restaurants for their turn to come. My favorite joints are Peter Cat and Bar Be Que. If you are a party animal then also you are @ right street as the most happening disc "Tantra" is in Park Hotel @ Park Street besides Tantra, The Park hotel offers 'Some Place Else' with live rock band Aqua - The Pool side Bar. Park Street is the Happening Street in Kolkata - Agar Park Street nahin dekha to Kolkata nahin Dekha. More

title: New year celebration destination
review_text: very good place for new year celebration and you can have good quality food and variety of restaurants are there for lunch and dinner. so many street food counters are there. I loved it.

title: Christmas in India
review_text: During Christmas ,this is the place you would love to be in ,if you are in India. There is a sense of peace and celebrations

title: "The street that never sleeps".
review_text:
Park street is famous for night life, worth visit to Trinca's,just under the Park Hotel Building, nice singers and musicians, Mocambo, Blue Fox and Moulin Rouge are also the best from the golden era. From the time when Kolkata was the capital of India." Never miss to visit the "Flury's Cake shop" you can have any continental and intercontinental dishes from over 50 nice restaurants. Recently all food joints like Mc donald's, KFC 
Barista, Subway are here. 
Visit St. Xavier's college in the mid section of the street. Asiatic Society and more to explore.

title: famous Park street
review_text: There is a lot that goes on in park street . It has many restaurants , around the corner is Sudder street , there is St Thomas church nearby , the museum , the cemetery , some really good pastry shops . I recommend a stroll there is a lot to see . There is a really great old fashioned cafe as well , I am sure they are using the same silver cutlery they used a hundred years ago.

title: Only locality in Kolkata without hawker more or less.
review_text: Stretch is not very long. It was burial ground road in British days. One way traffic changes at 1pm Can take a stroll through hotel and restaurant infested walkway. Two auction house are notable. A good post office and many business houses. But heritage is more prominent in this old street which is paralleled by none.

title: Park Street Kolkata
review_text: The original high street of this huge metropolis, has some of the best eateries, and has a certain charm about it. Surrounded by buildings with colonial architecture, Park Street still retains an old world charm, and coupled with newer options for high street shopping and dining, is an ideal place to get a pulse of this throbbing metropolis.

title: A Bright Spot In Calcutta
review_text: Once upon a time, considered the most happening street in the country, Park Street has, by far, been able to retain its colourful character. Even now, it's a pleasure to walk on its pavements (albeit far more crowded than what it used to be) and watch countless facets of the city life. The shops with their merchandise, the restaurants, the auction houses - all of them contribute to the wonders of the stretch known as Park Street. The recent efforts of the Govt to make it Wi-fi enabled are expected to prove interesting for the techno-savvy GenX.

title: Funky
review_text: Youth is the second name of the street. Bubbling with activity. Fantastic night life. It's fun and fun only

title: THE SPINAL CORD OF KOLKATA
review_text: Through out the day this road is meant for Kolkata's important connection for east, west, north & south.The place is for good restaurants,Bars and branded shops.

title: All on one street
review_text:
I love walking down the street once in a while when the weather is pleasant...have a coffee at Flurys or share a beer or smoothie at The Street. You can't go wrong if u have a meal at one of the legendary restaurants - BarBQ, Flavours of China, Peter Cat, Mocambo or One Step Up. Fancy a five star meal? Saffron and Zen at The Park are awesome too. Live Music at Trincas or SOmeplace Else and dancing at Roxy...this street has it all 
Be careful of the waifs hanging around trying to get into your pockets - buy them a roll if you're treating yourself to one at Kusum's :) More

title: The best walking street
review_text: This is the heart line of Kolkata. It is almost a pilgrimage to visit this place for a good time. Heritage bars and eateries line up the street, since over a century in many case. There are many new cafes and hole n the wall joints. The entire length of this street covers many a church and parks as well. It is lovely without the rush, and good for a solo trip or a family and friends outing.

title: bright lights
review_text: Lots of fine eateries here like Peter Cat and an old Calcutta favourite, Flury's are on hand to whet one's appetite.

title: upscale tourist street
review_text: plenty of shopping options and restaurant choices, this is the nicer part of kolkata I believe. but prices are higher in this area compared to sudder street. there are plenty of old colonial architecture on this street

title: Happy happy days!
review_text:
I studied at Loreto House, off Park Street and our weekend mornings were usually spent at jam sessions at Mocambo or Magnolia! It had live music with great bands and crooners and dance floors. 
During a recent visit to Kolkata I thought I would re visit my roots! and went for dinner to Mocambos and a walk along Park Street. 

Sadly there are no longer any live bands and many of the restaurants have closed down and become showrooms. Magnolias, Waldorf and Sky Room are no longer in existence. But some of the iconic shops are still there like Good Companions where we went if we wanted to buy hand made and embroidered linen and clothes for our children; and Hobby Centre which my sons adored and spent happy hours buying model planes and kits. More

title: Christmas time!
review_text: Park street is the place to be in Calcutta during Christmas - New Year period. We did a lot of place hopping. Have always loved the way they decorate the entire street. I visited after Christmas so there were many things which were over :-( . Nevertheless, it is of no less fun. If you want to get a little taste of the Raj in its heydays, do visit during this period.

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text: Energetic ....active .....brilliantly alive ....heart of city of joy.....lined with places like flurys ...kolkata rolls....right next to the shopping area.....must visit

title: Plenty to do on Park Street
review_text: Loved the hustle & bustle & great restaurants & nightclubs. Trincas good for late drinks & music. Kwality's a must as well. Good Chinese food at BarBQ.

title: A place to be
review_text:
A famous street for its rich heritage, old buildings, superb food joints, ancient pubs and a couple of graveyards with famous people right there. 
If you visit kolkata, do walk down this street and be charmed. The restaurants are simply wow. Lots of photo opportunities for the photogs. Shopping options available too, be ready to bargain hard. Have fun.

title: Shopping & Restaurants
review_text: This street is probably the most famous street of Kolkata. Lots of shops and restaurants are located on and around this street. Also the famous Park Hotel is located on the same street. It also has a metro station and is well connected by other means of tranport.

title: This will always be the most charming place on Earth
review_text: Its not just about growing up in Calcutta which makes us bongs so fond of Park Street - but just the vibrancy and infectious energy of it, even after decades of seeing it the same way, is what makes it so special. Neither delhi nor mumbai nor bangalore has any place that is so resplendant with the british raj era ramifications, mixed with modernisation that gets slapped on its face almost every year, changing the streets hues and patters constantly, while retaining its original old world charm - and its not just the christmas week when this long stretch of glitz and glam turns into a veritable NYC 5th avenue - but all thru the year, on any given day - park street is buzzing and throbbing with the best cake shops, continental eateries, bars and pubs, shops and street vendors - unlike anything else in the city of joy! More

title: Not sure why the fuss
review_text: Park Street is great for food and getting to and from other places but I wouldn't rate it as a tourist attraction. It does have some good eating places and is OK if you want to shop.

title: No malls can take away the sheen of Park Street.
review_text: Starting from Hot Kati Roll corner, each few yard has to offer the same great food, ambience and brings back nostalgia of the days gone by. Peter Cat, Bar-b-Q, Flurys, Mocambo, Olypub, Trincas - they simply are irreplacable. Wish Blue Fox still existed on the map ! Guess there is no other street in Kolkata which has these many iconic landmarks.

title: Where Kolkata finds respite
review_text: In a traditional city of intellectuals, revolutionaries and lovers, this is a modern take of the whole concept! First time I was here, it was 11.30 at night and I had just arrived. It was just beginning to close after 12 AM. CCD and Barista were still open. Next time I went there, I fell in love with the relaxed atmosphere and it became a regular haunt for us friends to converge on weekends and weekdays even. I still love it and the old institutions that flavor the complex and relished dish that is Park St.

title: The Party Hub
review_text: Street is abuzz with activity late night. Great place to go for good food and drinks - there are many on Park Street. I miss the Music World though!

title: Main & Shopping market of kolkata
review_text: Its the main & posh area of Kolkata.One should must be once there.Its good for shopping.One will get each and every thing there.Either its road market or branded shop,it cheaper then New Delhi...visited in day time.Good option for Fun & Food & Shop...

title: The travellers hub
review_text: Park Street along with Camac street is the best area to shop and hogg. Whether from the all time superb Bar-B-Q and Flury's in park street to the street food like Puchka, Jhaal Muri, Childa and Ghoongni Chat outside Vardhan Market in Camac Street, it has everything. Both vardhan market and 22 Camac street are filled with varied shops that offer wide range of products whether cheap or branded. A must visit no matter what!

title: Pleasant enough
review_text:
Walked down here in the evening whilst looking for somewhere to eat in Kolkata. 
There was plenty of places to choose from including traditional style restaurants, fast food joints and dessert/cake producing establishments. 

Lots of other types of shops are found here too including bars/clubs and plenty of bookshops. Several street venders ply their trade here too if you can deal with the haggling. 
Well lit-up at night too to make you feel more secure. Taxis and Autos can be flagged down, but with anywhere in the world, be careful.

title: Nice decoration
review_text:
We were in kolkata during x-mas celebration. Decoration was superb and the atmosphere was jovial and really enjoyed the food. 
Nice experience.

title: Best address in town!
review_text:
The first few times in Kolkata I went to Park Street to visit Flurys, the legendary Café with a Swiss name and a similar standard of quality. Then there was also a vegetarian restaurant there (the Christian Brothers),another reason to go there - now it does not exist any more. The Oxford Bookstore is also at 17 Park Street, and one of the most important cultural institutions of a bygone ara, The Asiatic Society, is at number 1 Park St, opposite the access to the metro station. 

Park Street is the place to see posh Kolkata, without going far, if you stay in downtown Kolkata, New Market area or Sudder Street. More

title: Must see in Kolkata
review_text: Good restaurants and showrooms along street make it good destination for visitors. side roads also have lot of showrooms .Do not expect Cannought Place like free areas to stroll

title: HEART OF KOLKATA
review_text: Being the heart of Kolkata it has got all those features like having the restaurants,the corporates and even the celebration of Christmas Day...to make it what it is.But at times it gets overcrowded.

title: Excellent shopping place
review_text: This place has plenty of shops. Very good, particularly for Ladies. Very good sarees, dresses, kurtis. The rates are reasonable. Mostly Marwari traders. It's worth visiting and shopping from here while in Kolkata.

title: The pulse of Calcutta
review_text:
The trams, the buildings from a bygone era and the classy eateries make Park Street a magnet for people of all ages. Stroll down the street in the evening with friends - grab a puchka (pani puri) or a paan on the go and if you have more time walk into one of the pleasant pubs or restaurants that had a wide range of cuisine choices. 

You haven't seen Calcutta (or Kolkata) till you have spent time on Park Street.

title: street
review_text: a famous street at Calcutta; got lit-up with lights in Christmas day, mainly populated by Anglo Indian origins

title: Busy street life, watch your pockets
review_text: Quite crowded and with so may sellers of everything one can imagine. It really is worth visiting, just watch your pockets and keep looking around.

title: Still the most happening place in Kolkata
review_text: I love this street. Very nostalgic for me whenever I visit India (or Kolkata, in this case). Flury's, Barbecue Nation, PeterCat, Tung Fu, Golden Dragon and Mocambo are some of the best places to eat here.

title: Whats the fuss abt
review_text: Heard a lot abt this place from various people abt it being the most happening place in kolkata.. but I fail to see why.. there are many restaurants and pubs but none of them have the wow factor or anything... and to top it is the heavy heavy traffice during peak hours.. makes u wonder where the hell are so many people going to :(

title: Something for Every Taste
review_text:
Though i am only aware of this street from last few years, so won't be able to relate to it's past and new renovated version, unlike many reviewers who are much more aware of it probably. 

But having been there many a times, i'll say that the street and all surrounding areas are a mixed of falvour of traditional Kolkata & modern Kolkata and markets with all value propositions. Branded to street-side things, Food for all tastes and wallet size and a place to explore and, for those who love street photography they will find lot of subjects to click. For youngs and old, everyone will have something of interest here, books, food, fashion, shopping and what all not. 

A must to spend few hours or an evening out if someone is visitng Kolkata.. More

title: Sanitized now
review_text: The old park street seems to be gone--now a sanitized version for the visitors is left. While I don't mourn the loss of the dangerous cracked footpaths and the crowds, I was sad to see how the once venerable erudite Oxford bookstore has morphed into a Banes and Noble lite. Still, a good place for foreigners to take a breath in somewhat more familiar-ish surrounds.

title: Visit to Park Street
review_text: I alongwith my parents visited park street on December 26, 2014. The area was so crowdy, that we parked our car in Maidan. We visited Allien Park also. The whole area was decorated with beautiful lighing. We went to Laziz to take one egg chicken roll.

title: amazing
review_text: I was there during christmas of 2014. The street stood by all that was told or written abt it. Great decoration, nice music, lots of food , good quality and wonderful people.. must visit.

title: Kolkata's heart
review_text: This three-kilometre hub that belonged to Sir Elijah Impey is now the heart and hub of Kolkata. It's the epicentre of the CIty of joy. Eateries like Moulin Rouge,Trincas, Peter Cat and not to miss Flruys have been a permanent address for this street. Along with not to Mocambo, Veda, Oly Pub and more. It's like the true character of the city. It's also come in true its true colors as it's known for the India’s largest Christmas Carnival

title: A Fun Street
review_text: To me Park Street is more than just a fun destination. I had my schooling here in an excellent Christian institution in the 1950s and have an emotional attachment with the stretch of the road from the St. Xavier's College to the Chowringhee. Arguably the concept of fine dining in Kolkata emerged from here with the setting up of fine restaurants like Mocambo, Trincas, Magnolia, Flury to name only a few. Today these eateries are still thriving and evn though many true fine dining restaurants have come up in the city these Park Street hangouts still draw a large crowd and one can find a long crowd of hungry diners waiting endlessly to get a seat inside even during weekday evenings. With many more restaurants added to the list Park Street is atill the city's No. 1 eating out zone. The place has changed a lot in the last 70 years as the tram lines have given way to the underground Metro on Chowringhee and a monstrous flyover blocks the view of the Maidan greens, the Street still retains its charm as a must visit zone for tourists visiting the city. The year end illumination during Christmas and New Year attracts a large crowd of young and old revellers like perhaps no other place in India. A must visit for the residents and visitors alike. More

title: Christmas Eve
review_text:
Had heard that it would be the most happening place on a Christmas 
Took a metro and landed in Park street metro station - Gosh - Wave of homo sapiens !!!!!!!!!!!!! 
Thought that it must be a event full of joys - It was just humans and light decorations - people all around with out any reason

title: The most "Happening Street" in Eastern India.
review_text: Excellent eateries, a good bookstore and level atmosphere. Do visit Flury's and Oxford Book Store. It houses many places which are institutions in itself.

title: It is now changed, different
review_text: This street had a colonial mark left by the British people who lived nearby this place and Calcutta (Kolkata) now, was the capital city of India then. After the Brits left, the street still had somewhat characteristics that it had earlier. After the late 60s when the Anglo-indians started to drift to distant shores the street started to change entirely. Today, to a foreigner's eye it will not even appear to be anything special but a normal street. The street houses many restaurants, bars, shops, a post office, bookstore and novelty items which are considered to be of an upmarket category in an Indian market.

title: Kolkata's Park Lane
review_text:
This is a great street to stroll along with lots of restaurants, cafes and high-end shops. At the south end you can visit the old British cemetery and the north end meets the Maidan. 

In October it was too hot for us to be out for too long but we still enjoyed walking around. Watch out for the traffic suddenly changing direction around 1 pm. It took us a while to spot that at different times of the day it was one way in different directions and on our last day we actually saw the police changing the direction.

title: Underwhelming
review_text: Park Street had been talked up by a few people before we arrived in Kolkata, so we were excited to browse and wander up and down the street. It's close enough to a few attractions, but it wasn't anything worth going to see by itself. If you're looking for food, Park Street is one of the only metro station areas with a variety of restaurants, but as a "sight" and place to enjoy, it was a bust. (College Street's bustling book stalls were much more interesting to experience!)

title: one of the most happening place in Kolkata
review_text: plz visit olypub.Olypub's beef steak is really delicious.If u have no problem of having beef & u wanna taste something new then don't miss it.

title: Lovely combination of the old and the new
review_text: The place might be teeming with modern restaurants, stores etc., but for a bibliophile like me who has read many a novels set in the pre-independence Calcutta, walking down Park Street is an amazing experience, imagining the lives and times of the people whose lives have revolved around this landmark in the decades that have gone by.

title: Best food options available here
review_text: Park street located in Central Kolkata is the most prime, vibrant space which gives ample opportunities to hang out and eat. With food options ranging from Flury's to Peter cat, one can easily spend a day here exploring. Oxford store is a good option for afternoon visit. The only upmarket place to be in kolkata giving you plenty of options to shop and dine.

title: Every thing you want.
review_text: Park st is right in the heart of the city with many options to eat and shop, from good indian Restaurants to Mc Donalds.

title: Love the Area!!
review_text: Best partying area in India after MG Road of Bangalore. It has all kinds of restaurants and bars and most importantly they are pocket friendly

title: Vibrant and colourful place
review_text: Those who love vibrance and colours in their lives , it is an ideal place to hang out with your friends , spouses, partners or perhaps alone. This place can make a loner's mind happy and gay. There are son many interesting eateries around and a famous place to get lost in the books at oxford.The milieu is festive during Christmas and New Year.

title: Joy Street
review_text: This got to be the city's prime most tourist destination even though it lacks any outstanding landmark. What attracts everyone, travelers or natives, the last remaining charm of the bygone classic era of restaurants, pubs and hangouts. With new international brands are setting anchor besides those good, old Trincas and Oly pubs, things are getting better like never before. The portico in front of Park Hotel is a joy-walk for anyone. Every year, the two weeks spanning the christmas and new year get some kinda new life in the half a mile of this stretch between JL Nehru Rd. and Mallickbazar. Recomend the best ones? well, start your day with a British breakfast at Flurys, by the time Oxford Book Store will be open to offer you some of the best in literature, when you feel some munching needed, move over to Peter Cat or Mocambo to cherish the chello kebabs. When the sun sets down, you can have your share of best liquor at Oly Pubs ravishing their pub special dishes. For the gig lovers, trincas and someplace else beckons with their live performances. Ringing all those sweet sounds in your ear, head on to Tung Naam or Magnolia...your day will be richer by few more miles of joy. More

title: Heart and Soul of Calcutta
review_text:
Situated in Central Calcutta, this is the heart and soul of the city. With good hotels and choice of restaurants serving different cuisines this is the go to place for most of the Calcuttans in the weekend. Currently being Christmas time it has a very different look and feel. Decked with lights like a queen the street transforms into an open air carnival with stalls of foods and stores selling Christmas paraphernalia. There is live music o the streets and the festival atmosphere is live to feel. 

Visiting Park Street during Chirstmas is a must.

title: a must visit place in kolkata
review_text: the original urbanite and upmarket place of Kolkata, lined up with the finest restaurants, hotels and shopping area.

title: Must visit
review_text: Being new to town and living close by, visited couple of days back. Such a warm, happening place ! A shopper's delight, great variety to suit all budgets. And even if you are not shopping, still a very lively place to while away your time. Do try at least once.

title: Heart of the city
review_text: Park street is called the heart of the city.this is the poshest area where all good schools,offices,shops and restaurants are located

title: Party Capital of Kolkata
review_text: The street contains a number of restaurants and pubs. It starts with the Asiatic Society building. Olypub, Trincas, Flurys, McDonalds, Subway, Cafe Coffee Day are all located here. If you walk further down, you will come up to the St Xaviers college and then the Part Street cemetery.

title: Full of Lighting in Xmas
review_text:
Best decoration ever seen, Entire street was lighted as the festival of Xmas in bear by. 

Entire street was decorated with different coloured lights.

title: Best place for dinner
review_text: Though Park Street is crowded, very noisy still it is a good option to spend evening esp in case you happen to be a female and are alone in the city. other places do not seem to be very safe after 8.30-9 pm, in case you are not in a group. This place has many restaurants, and taxis are easily available till 10 pm.

title: great place
review_text: Great place for foodies. Verity of food and drinks and lot of restaurant, one of the best peter cat (spl chelo kebab and with some good wine)

title: Filled with Restraunts!!!!!!
review_text:
If ya out there U would not know where to eat..... Haven for foooodies...... 
All the famous restraunts out there . 
One of the cleanest and busiest places tooooooo.

title: crowded
review_text: the streets in this area are crowded and full of noisy honking taxis. although there is an old world charm to it. u can see trams passing by again they too are crowded. i finished my work and was standing by in front of victoria park at 5 pm. there was a rush of people returning from offices and going back home, some standing by and smoking (although smoking in public places is illegal here in India), Kolkatta has its ways. Watching slow traffic and abundance of people, is what you get at park street. Some good eateries too.

title: There is still an aura about this place
review_text: Park Street has definetly seen better days.But a ride or a stroll on this road can still excite you.Eateries abound in the area with iconic ones like Fluffys,Peter Cat,Mocambo,Kwality(Indian food) still around and doing well.Park Hotel is a little luxury hotel for those who can afford the tariff.Their pub 'Someplace Else' has decent gigs once in a while.Do not miss the Oxford book store.You can have a leisurely cuppa(tea) on its first floor.There are also a few stalls like Kusum where you have to fight for your turn for the famous oily rolls of Kolkata.The walk on the busy sidewalk can be quite an adventure specially with young pimps offering you services of call girls at night.A part of the street is under repair and you walk at your own peril.It is a longish street but most of the action is towards the Chowringhee side.There is a small park on the Camac Street crossing which however looks desolate and shady.From the street you can walk across to other well known places like College street,New market,etc.The place is nicely lit up during Xmas and New Years.All in all would recommend a visit just to take in the ambience.The Govt. tried to rename this road as mother Teresa road but its only sign is in the statue put up in the park I had mentioned. More

title: Heart of Kolkotta
review_text: Centrally located. Large number of markets within walking distance. Good nite life and hangout spots. Street food in the vicinity was extremely tasty and reasonable

title: Swinging Kolkata
review_text: Still the Champs Elysees of Kolkata the restaurnats and bars go back to the fun of the fifties and before - Moulin rouge, Flury's Mocambo, Trinca's, Magnolia Peter Cat Peiping... Sky Room has gone Macdonald's KFC have come in and everyone has their favorites... Walk down from Chowringee to AJC Bose Road and cross over for Shiraz and furthet to Park Ciircus..Prices remain affordable and a great place for a reasonable night out.

title: Nice and Sexy place
review_text: Park Street is like the las vegas strip of nightclubs, restaurants etc. that offers a wide choice for all cuisines and drinks. There is the Park hotel with the famous ROXY nightclub inside. You can even visit Tantra (the second night club of the hotel). Right beside the Park, you can experience the famous Kolkata PAN. You also have your standard KFC, McDonalds and other fast food chains. My personal favorite is the BAR B Q Bar and Restaurant

title: A GOOD PLACE TO HANGOUT DURING CHRISTMAS
review_text: Call it a place to walk, stroll, eat, enjoy !!! You can spend a whole evening parting around this place. Christmas eve is the best time to be here Traffic being closed during the period you can hang out with fiends and family. Almost all of my Christmas eve had been here and its never become old or boring.

title: Fun, frolic and happening
review_text: This is the heart of Kolkata..so many people bustling around, lovely food (some famous restaurants - Barb'Q, Flury's, OlyPub, Peter Cat....and it goes on), books, magazines, varieties lie in small packs even in "pan" shops. Its a must visit during the Christmas - New Year week. But basically its an office area but its EQ (entertainment quotient !) is the highest in Kolkata.

title: Good timepass
review_text: Nice place for hangout with friends and enjoy good food and music and shopping also......................

title: Fun street of kolkata
review_text:
A must visit during Christmas and New Year when it decks up like a beautiful bride. 
Has a plethora of good restaurants - Flurys, McDonalds, & many more.

title: London of the east
review_text: Nice road to take a stroll.Excellent eatouts and shops by the road.excellent on christmas day and new years eve.

title: Oasis in kolkatta
review_text:
It gives vibrant feeling in otherwise sloppy town with good food restaurants and people around. 

Vibes you can get here aren't available anywhere else in town so go and enjoy.

title: biggest posh commercial street
review_text: vardaan market and many other commercial shops and kolkata's famous chatsliked very much. little cleaniliness in the street is required, it gives ugly picture of our city.

title: Heart of the City
review_text:
The best part of Kolkata! Visit the street in the evening n you will love the walk, eateries n places to hang out. 
Lot of known restaurants, park hotel, book stores. Come the festivals n this place lights up in joy. 
U will find lot of foreigners here too.

title: Cool place to walk,eat and shop
review_text:
Street is very nice for a long evening walk, Since we were there in winters, breeze was very cool and climate was perfect. 
There are lots of small food stalls serving delicious tasty food which also don't burn your pockets

title: Foodie and Shopper
review_text: Lot of Fancy Restaurants. But you may not get the best taste of local flavours. Decent place to shop. Easy to walk around and traffic doesn't get too nasty, by metro standards.

title: very good
review_text: very good experience. especially by walking thru the pathway. but it is not recommended after 10..........................................................................

title: Popular for shopping
review_text: A long shopping street famous for Kolkata street food, sweets, leather goods and garments. A top draw for locals an tourists alike. Also abounds in budget accomadation,

title: a great time at New Years
review_text:
Park street with all lighting done up for Christmas and New Year and the people walking through it as the Burra Sahib is a place to watch. 

It is thronging with crowd. And the crowd is enjoying itself and its great to watch Park Street fully lighted up during the new year and Christmas

title: The Heart line of Kolkata
review_text: As you walk down from the South Park street Cemetery towards the Metro station, you wonder at the heartline of Kolkata......over years like your mother she might have lost the beauty and the glamour that she was famous for in the 70's.........cabaret's to singers, pubs to family restaurant......this place has withstood the change of time and embraced the new and has converted itself into a beautiful butterfly.....Kolkata would not be Kolkata without Park STreet

title: A good drive
review_text: We just went for a drive in the evening after our visit to Eco Park. I have been to Kolkata on numerous occasions in the past, but somehow never got an opportunity to visit Park street. I must say, the place lives upto its name and poplarity.

title: Strange place to review.
review_text:
In all my reviews I have never been asked to review an entire road... but here goes... Park Street is a street, on this street are shops and places to eat, the ones I frequented on my first night were Pizza Hut and McDonalds (I was feeling a bit dodgy). These places were entirely acceptable places to eat. The road is busy and if you are there at night and you want to catch a cab, one tip; You won't. There are plenty of taxi's but you have meet a lot of criteria apparently before a taxi driver will consider driving to your location. Also with this tip I'll add a free one, if you happen to be white and you want a taxi at night be prepared for a lot of meter related lies. 

That being said there is an incredible book shop on Park Street that has very good pricing compared to what I am used to. An interesting street to walk along and worth checking out if you feel the need for some comfort food or a good book to read. More

title: Modern but busy.
review_text: It was nice to find this place amongst the chaos of Kolkata, but the prices push a lot of travellers out. I loved the book shop and if you're in need of western food or an escape you can find it here.

title: Nice place to stroll during Christmas time!!!
review_text: This place is usually famed for it's night life but on Christmas,New Year eve it is traditionally decorated with lights and is one of the happening places and probably Dec 25 - Jan 1st is the best time visit this area. Music Fest, Iconic Restaurants,Crowds and nearby New market shopping complex will attract you to this place. It is one the premier recreational zone and will have everything for people belonging from all walks of life.If you love to walk, then visit these notable buildings like Asiatic Society, St. Xavier's College, Calcutta, a Seventh-day Adventist Church, and the South Park Street Cemetery in Park Street which still holds a lot of history and nostalgia of colonial British Raj era. Spend 3-4 hours or a weekend here just to hang-out and have a stroll for an relaxing experience. More

title: Park street -a lively and gorgeous street
review_text:
Very enjoyable experience -walking through western to eastern end of Park Street-restaurants serving variety of food-Indian,Chinese,continental,most well know bakeries,fast food joints,coffee shops,famous bars,most well known night clubs,big book shops,hawkers selling books and magazines,garments shops,well known tailoring shop,Banks,Postoffice-and host of other services. 

I am not aware any other city in India providing so much within a kilometre of walking in a street at the city centre and full of life.A gorgeous and lively street to visit specially in the evening!

title: Happening place
review_text: This is in the centre of Kolkata where you can find a mixture of British and Modern day architexture. The New Market nearby is a very famous and old place for shopping and you can find anything you want there.Nice place to hang out with family and friends.

title: An interesting must visit street
review_text:
Park street got its name from a Deer Park in Loreto House school, but is now Mother Teresa Sarani though everybody just still says 'Park Street' Park Street is synonymous with restaurants in Kolkata. You have a great choice here as every building has some eaterie. If we start from the Chowringhee Road end, we have Trincas multicuisine. The Park Hotel at 5 star hotel with nightclubs, coffee shop, oriental and Indian cuisines. Next is Kwalitys well known for its chana bhatura and kebabs. Further down is a shop in Karnani Mansion gate which sells great kathi rolls. Then there is Oasis with good Sizzlers.Then the famous BarB Q- excellent good quality Chinese and Indian food. Next is Cafe Coffee Day and Baristas - well known names in coffee shops. Just at the corner of Free School Street and Park Street is the well known Mocambo -great continental food. Then there is Pizza Hut - Italian food. Further down is Veda steep prices Indian cuisine. On the opposite side of the street we have One Step Up multicusine good food. Next is Silver Grill - Chinese food good quality. Next is the famous tea shop Flurys - excellent for tea time treats and breakfast. Next is Au Bon Petit another coffee shop. Turn the corner to Middleton Row and there is Peter Cat basically Indian cuisine - good kebabs and sizzlers. Opposite Peter Cat is KFCs -chicken burgers etc. So... Park street got its name from a Deer Park in Loreto House school, but is now Mother Teresa Sarani though everybody just still says 'Park Street' 

Park Street is synonymous with restaurants in Kolkata. You have a great choice here as every building has some eaterie. If we start from the Chowringhee Road end, we have Trincas multicuisine. The Park Hotel at 5 star hotel with nightclubs, coffee shop, oriental and Indian cuisines. Next is Kwalitys well known for its chana bhatura and kebabs. Further down is a shop in Karnani Mansion gate which sells great kathi rolls. Then there is Oasis with good Sizzlers.Then the famous BarB Q- excellent good quality Chinese and Indian food. Next is Cafe Coffee Day and Baristas - well known names in coffee shops. Just at the corner of Free School Street and Park Street is the well known Mocambo -great continental food. Then there is Pizza Hut - Italian food. Further down is Veda steep prices Indian cuisine. 

On the opposite side of the street we have One Step Up multicusine good food. Next is Silver Grill - Chinese food good quality. Next is the famous tea shop Flurys - excellent for tea time treats and breakfast. Next is Au Bon Petit another coffee shop. Turn the corner to Middleton Row and there is Peter Cat basically Indian cuisine - good kebabs and sizzlers. Opposite Peter Cat is KFCs -chicken burgers etc. 

So as a traveller to Kolkata one has to visit Park Street and sup at the famous old time restaurants there as well as the new ones which have sprung up in recent years. Earlier many a restaurant had live music but sadly now it is only in Trincas and Park Hotel where one gets music. 

In the last 2/3 years at Christmas there is a Park Street festival with live music at Allen Park on Park street and homemade food being sold on the foot paths which draws large crowds. Many Many years ago all shops had beautiful Christmas decorations but many of these establishments like Bombay Photo Stores which I remember with a large sleigh in front of it, Blue Fox restaurant which had the likes of the famous Pam Crain and Skyroom the most delectable continental food. 

Park Street also had the famous bookstore Oxford Bookstore which is worth a visit . You can browse the books and have tea at the Chai Bar. 

A visit an absolute must ! More

title: Park Street Stroll
review_text: It's a must to visit Park Street and take a stroll down the same. Flury's, Peter Cat, Waldorf, etc. are all iconic restaurants situated in and around this road and central district of Kolkata. Love this place!

title: Old World Charm in a new world
review_text: Walking down Park Street you will feel you are not in Kolkata but in a time warp. Its quaint buildings with its amazing selection of hotels and night spots make it a place to hang out and catch the crowd or just read a book sitting in Flury's or just amble about. This place still retains the old world charm of Kolkata.

title: Park Street - Nightlife capital of the South+East!!
review_text: Park Street, is a delight to all who pass through it. High end shops, restaurants, retail stores are plenty here! You can literally find EVERYTHING branded here. By Indian standards, one of the best nightlife destinations and a happening place of Kolkata! The decorations on Christmas and New Year are worth watching, kind of like the miniature Indian Times Square of New York!

title: Street full of fun
review_text: Park Street is the city center and full of restaurants, bars & lounge. It also has some discos such as ROXY in Park Hotel and Myx a stand alone building offering wide range of restaurants, bars, banquets and disco..

title: Elegant!
review_text: I just love to move around this street where one can get all necessary things to buy and hang out to pass the time. An elegant place to shop, eat, read and so on. My favorite from this street was Apple store, Oxford Bookstore, Baazar Kolkata and Mcdonalds , hehehe.....

title: A happening Street
review_text: The Park Street is a happening spot in Kolkata lots of events in various hotels restaurants and for shopping. It is a lively place to visit one who comes to Kolkata must visit it. If possible must stay at Hotel Park, The tantra is also a lovely place there.

title: OK
review_text: Great for India with McDonald's and what not so nice for a stroll with a couple of parks and all, but missing the real India here and there are other places like Sutter Street that have more grit to them to enjoy more local flavors!

title: Bookshops, Hotels, Cafes
review_text: its a hip and modern part of downtown Kolkata interesting arty type shops, great coffee, extensive book shops you could spend hours browsing in. Plus the locals are really friendly

title: Must Visit
review_text: As mentioned in previous reviews, Park Street is a good place to visit for restaurants and bars catering for a wide variety of tastes.

title: Modern face of Kolkata
review_text:
Want to get the modern look of kolkata , bored on the primitive looks, styles - have a stroll around park street- thats it. The best mode of transport should be walk to explore the entire location, shops, street shops, food joints and many more attractions. 
A charming place during Christmas, New year eve . 
Worth a visit.

title: Live Kolkata at Park Street
review_text: It is one of the busiest streets at Kolkata wherein we can get best of the branded stores around. It is also having some of the finest restaurants and headquarters of Apeejay Group, one of the most powerful business houses in eastern India. There are some of the best hotels in Kolkata near Park Street which is also known as business capital of Kolkata.

title: Kolkata
review_text: The first thing that comes to mind when one thinks of Calcutta, is Park Street. Well, the buzz is not over- hyped. The central attraction of the city, it truly never sleeps, with vendors, restraunts, cafes etc forever keeping the street bustling.

title: Still luv this place
review_text: Park Street of yesteryears was the only happening place in Kolkata. Nowadays with the advent of malls, footfall has gone down. Specially young crowd seems to prefer malls for hanging out. But still some of the best eateries in Kolkata is located here. Mocambo, Peter Cat, Barbeque etc. This place is must visit place during the Christmas and New Year. One of our old time favourite Olypub is still running.

title: nightlife is a must
review_text: about nightclub or anything you can see the review in website Zomato.com (i'm not sure it's call this) and you can't wears short to enjoy them!!

title: Evening comes Alive
review_text: Park Street is Heart and Breath of Kolkata in the real sense. It comes alive at the dusk and remains glorified until midnight. With lots of Restaurants and Bars serving varied cuisines and taste. For shopaholics to there is a lot to discover and pamper

title: Shopping Malls
review_text: The Park Street is one of the most modern shopping malls in Kolkata, with many nice shops to browse and restaurants and some fast food chains. It should be the most prosperous section of Calcutta.

title: Take a walk down history
review_text: its a mix of old and new and in India its all in your pores; you dont visit India ;rather you live it. Found a 150 year old Jewish Girls Day School that has 800 students with not a single Jewish student (63 Park Street) go and explore

title: Prime Area
review_text:
When in Kolkata, PArk street is certainly a place to visit. Best Place for Shopping, Eating Out. 
Even if one wants to have WIndow Shopping, its a good place. Has Shops selling International Brands as also selling Local Indigenous Brands. 

Various restaurants line up the street. If you just want to loosen the strings of your Purse, Park Street is the Place

title: Lot of Options to shopping
review_text:
It's a good place for street shopping. Lot of shopping options. You have to bargain to get good price. It's heavy rush every day especially Saturdays & Sundays. Lot of eateries are also there to try. 

Worth visiting this place for shopping as well as wandering through Kolkata streets.

title: full of beggars
review_text: Park Street also has got a metro there. One of the main streets in Kolkata. Has got a variety of shops and restaurants (Oxford Book shop, KFC, Mc'Donalds etc.) This street is visited mostly to try very delicious cakes in Flurry's. It is British time bakery. Very lovely place with lovely cakes and atmosphere. From Calcutta u get directly into Britain :) The worst thing about this street and all big cities in India are beggars... Beggars are extremely rude there. Can catch ur leg or hand. BE CAREFUL!

title: Funky area
review_text: Loved this area. Funky with great restaurants. Oxford book store is excellent. theres even MacDonald's, subway and Pizza Hut if that's your thing.

title: Shopping, eating and nightlife
review_text:
Park Street can be considered as the Times Square of Kolkata. It is one of the luxurious and posh areas in Kolkata with several fine dine restaurants, street food stalls, bars/ pubs and ample of shopping options. Several iconic restaurants like Peter Cat, Mocambo and Flurys are located here. 

Park Street is 3 lane one way road that starts from southern fingers of Park Circus 7 Point Crossing and ends at Chowringhee Road. The traffic direction reverses after 1PM. The best of the Park Street illumination can be seen during Durga Puja period and Christmas and New Year time.

title: Life Line of Kolkata !!!!
review_text: It's the life line of Kolkata in entertainment. There are many restaurants at opposite to each other and shops also for shoppers. It's a mix of everything. You can find everything you are looking for very nearby. Good restaurants are there and a five star hotel is also located on park street. In night lighting is also good enough but during festive time it looks more dazzle in lights.

title: Shopping
review_text:
Park street is the oldest street for restaurants and bars 
I visit the place whenever y travel to kolkata

title: walking and walking
review_text: it is a good street to walk. you can shop and walk around. good for tasting street food. you can also kill time by window shopping.

title: Modern Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is completely different from typical Kolkata one would imagine. Modern look, wide roads, great lighting in the night.

title: Walk down the idyllic path :)
review_text:
The iconic Park Street is special in many ways. Its legacy, its quaint charm, its fusion of old and new and its ever inviting arms, Park Street is not a favourite since ages for no reason. 

For me, Park Street is about Flury's and Oxford Book Store! A must visit even if you are not a foodie and bibliophile! Some things are too alluring to be missed :) 

Of course, Park Street is also probably one of the most happening places to hang out with numerous joints dotting the street on both sides. KFC, McDonalds, Barista, CCD, Subway are all to be found here. 

But well, do enter those little food joints on Park Street if you really want to go back to the charming Kolkata of yesteryears. Some of the best foods, served by some of the most generous hosts. 

Some high street fashion and local artwork can be caught in this place. But a better option for shopping should be Newmarket. 

Most of the shops here are closed on Sunday tough. More

title: The Life of Kolkata
review_text: Park Street is an epitome of the blitz spirited Kolkatan. It is famous for the posh restaurants, night clubs and bars.

title: A happening place in Kolkata!!
review_text: Park street has lots of options from bookshops, cafes, rolls, bakeries to fine dine restaurants. There is something for everyone. A must visit place when in Kolkata!!

title: Night life and more
review_text: Place you should definitely visit if you in Kolkata, good night light and quite safe. choice of restaurants from indian to chinese, mughlai to south indian, you name it .. the street has it

title: location
review_text: crowded a pic of real kolkata city of joy ........... Sunday is quiet other days noisy , still we love kolkata

title: Park Street_The most happening place in Kolkata
review_text: It seems that the best resturants in town in built on this street. best for continental food and that british touch. The famous Trincas, Oli Pub, Peter Cat are just to name the few

title: For every tourist!
review_text: This is the place for every tourist! It's Kolkata in a "nut shell". Eat, shop and travel. The nightlife is pretty good too.

title: Beautiful... Everything Calcutta
review_text: Still the heart of the city with its restaurants ..bookshops..roll wallahs.. bars..wineshops...live music..you want it and its there...must visit place in Kolkata...

title: This Is Where To Go In Kolkata For Nearly Everything.
review_text:
Nearly everything you would need on this street, cafes, retail shops, one of the easiest places to get a taxi, check if the taxi is going into the one way system or out of it affects price. There are a lot of western chains Subway, Mcdonalds etc as well as Indian stores. There is also a reliable ATM for visa nearby Subway and on the same side as that ATM a decent electronics store where I got a replacement iPhone usb cable. Vodafone store is here if you need to get a simcard for data/calls/texts, be warned registration process took me 3 hours and they needed passport photocopy and separate passport photo + current address. I do recommend having a simcard with data as its very difficult to find decent wifi in Kolkata, its surprising the nicest coffee shops here don't have wifi. Cafe Coffee Day, Lavista etc. After travelling the world for a year I found Kolkata to be actually one of the cities with the least amount of wifi. For a video/photographer/website designer this was more important to me than may be for others. I found having my iPhone on vodafone 3G with a personal hotspot was a good backup when cafe wifi was slow or not functioning. Au bu pain cafe has good food and coffee, does have wifi but has a strange system where you have to have a text confirmation code sent to your phone... Nearly everything you would need on this street, cafes, retail shops, one of the easiest places to get a taxi, check if the taxi is going into the one way system or out of it affects price. 

There are a lot of western chains Subway, Mcdonalds etc as well as Indian stores. There is also a reliable ATM for visa nearby Subway and on the same side as that ATM a decent electronics store where I got a replacement iPhone usb cable. 

Vodafone store is here if you need to get a simcard for data/calls/texts, be warned registration process took me 3 hours and they needed passport photocopy and separate passport photo + current address. 

I do recommend having a simcard with data as its very difficult to find decent wifi in Kolkata, its surprising the nicest coffee shops here don't have wifi. Cafe Coffee Day, Lavista etc. After travelling the world for a year I found Kolkata to be actually one of the cities with the least amount of wifi. 
For a video/photographer/website designer this was more important to me than may be for others. 

I found having my iPhone on vodafone 3G with a personal hotspot was a good backup when cafe wifi was slow or not functioning. 

Au bu pain cafe has good food and coffee, does have wifi but has a strange system where you have to have a text confirmation code sent to your phone to verify internet usage and it will cut you off after a certain time ( i was told 20 minutes but had over an hour usage at one point, not sure if sms can be sent to international cellphones on travel plans) 

If your pilgrimage for wifi is unsuccessful walk about 10 minutes to Sudder Street and check out JoJos sometimes the internet is fast there with a 1mb/2mb download speed (at times.) More

title: The Happening Street - Eat-Shop-Party
review_text:
This is the place u gotta be whn in Kolkatta. 
It has everythin, from roadside eatery to big brands to Cafe's to lounge's to big restaurants. 
The cream of Kokatta hangs out here. its a long lane with all these things on either side of the road.

title: Park Street is the Romantic Hub of Kolkata !
review_text: Starting from Asiatic Society the road street leads to the nostalgic St. Xavier's College. In between lies the Trinka's, Fluries, Blue Fox, The Park, and the Oxford stores.

title: Food, food, food
review_text: Though Park Street has lot to offer, I like the place because of the variety of restaurants and food it offers. Also, it's always bustling, so you never feel alone.

title: Christmark Road.
review_text: At the teenage in 70s, I had a belief that the street was for foreigners, anglo-indian and for moneyed people. I dare to make a visit in the street although I used to visit Maidan (the enormous play arena where more than 500 club tents with hundreds of playground and 4 galleried playgrounds including famous Eden Gardens are situated) throughout the year either to play or to see matches. After joining service, I revealed that Park Street is not only for those people I thought before but is also for common man. Cosmopolitan pedestrians, hotels. restaurants, bar. famous schools, stalls and the beautiful broad roads really attracts me for frequent visits even without any reason. Innocent morning and gorgeous night are itself a beauty. During the Christmas time, the fun and celebration throughout the night attracts people to gather there and they become a part of the show automatically. Now, I am a fan of Park Street. More

title: A great hangout n awsomeness feel here
review_text: Lights n glamour is the name. Come here in christmas or new year or any other occassion u wil always find this place buzzing with people and lights and shopping. Thr r great restaurants with great food, places to chill out with frnds. Jus spend some great time n take back a whole lot of memories from this place. Its wil definitely charm you.

title: Heart of Kolkata
review_text: Park street and the new market area is the heart of Kolkata, there is a lot of old british buildings and a recently opened museum. It's also the night life spot.

title: The lights and galmour
review_text: Be it a Christmas eve or your just regular Sunday evening this place is always buzzing. Clubs, restaurants, pubs all in walking distance, the downtown of Calcutta!!

title: Perfect place for street shoping
review_text: In the year 2014 you can't believe cloths and accessories are so cheap in price. Even the quality is very good. Purchased lots of stuffs. Really amazing.

title: Bargain street
review_text: Brilliant , is awesome and definitely one should try out this place. Bargaining is an art one can truly learn here. Restaurants are abound to sate your hunger and shops to take up all your attention.

title: An excellent another noisy street for walk, street food, shopping & fun in Kolkata
review_text: It’s an excellent another noisy street for walk, street food, shopping & fun in Kolkata with an extra congested traffic both of people & wheels. Major business and commercial hub of Kolkata City and has more offices and business institutions than any other part of the city. The street has numerous famous restaurants of Kolkata, hotels, night clubs, cafe & bistros.

title: Entertainment
review_text: Its all about offices, Entertainment and wonderful food at this place. All kinds of rolls, food, cakes , restaurants are seen.

title: One of best street in the city to walk
review_text:
Just a street but perhaps one of the most disciplined streets in the city that makes it different from other. 
Park Street is situated in the heart of the city, lots of restaurents and shops to watch for. 

The street is worth walking during christmas time.

title: Very much hyped
review_text: Was nothing like i had imagined. I guess it is hyped a little. Brigade Street in Bangalore is much more posh and so is South Ex in Delhi.

title: hustle bustle and some fun
review_text: the highlight of south kolkatta with plenty of options for dining, drinking,shopping or just hanging out. the street reminds you of mumbai's colaba street

title: Awesome street for shopping
review_text: One of best place for shopping in kolkata. This is similar to t.nagar of Chennai great shopping hub. You get branded, non branded from lowest to high rates. Branded showrooms. If is nearby to Howrah railway station also. There is a also a jetty service(I.e. boat service). You also Indian museum at the park street. If you are a shopoholic you will love the place

title: Nice environment for walk !!
review_text: Its a one of nice place to walk in park street. You will find lots of street food with good taste and among them there is roll which called " Kolkata Roll " i just loved this. Great taste !

title: Nice place
review_text: Good place to unwind especially in the evening. Having a stroll on this road could be a good stress buster.

title: Excellent place to be
review_text:
Very Good Place, there is lot of things to do, 
Place to Visit: Indian Museum, Indian Institute of Arts, 
Restaurants: Gangaur, Bar-B-Que, Kwality, Mouline Rouge, Au Bon Pain, Mac D, Kfc, Pizza Hut, Dominoes, Do Nut, Park Hotel Restaurant, CCD, Barista and many more. 
Things to do: Hang out in Oxford Book Store and there is IN HOUSE RESTAURANT. 
Over all excellent place to be.

title: A Walk along this Famous Street!!!!!!!!!
review_text: We had stayed in the vicinity of this popular street known for its good eateries and some class shopping. We set out for just a window shopping walk but ended up eating some good food on the roadside joints plus some unplanned shopping. An interesting place filled with some or the other activity and of course, a lot of people from all over.

title: the Broadway of Kolkata
review_text: If you want to soak yourself in the true cosmopolitan nature of Kokata, come here. a place for young and old with fabulous eateries and rich history.

title: Park Street is another name for Modern Kolkata with its classical values
review_text: Park street is the excellent place for those love walk in the evening. But I found morning equally interesting. How can I forget, at Babughat (near park street) old sweet classical Rabindra Sangeet, at 5:30 am in Jan month, with tea in a clay mug at very old teashop.

title: Park Street-Good entertainment place
review_text:
Park Street is a lovely place for entertainment and we enjoyed one fine evening at this place, during our stay and had food in one of the Restaurants. 

The portion of Park Street between Chowringhee Road and Mullick Bazar has been one of the city's attractions for years. Several important roads originate from/intersect at Park Street in the Northward and Southward directions, One can spend several hours in the evening by standing at the intersect section of Park Street. 

Park Street is a recreation zone for Kolkata people as well as for the visitors since a long time. Though Malls, Star Hotels, Night Clubs and Restaurants have come up in other areas of the city, it is still one of the prime commercial and entertainment zone of the city. Park Street is traditionally decorated with lights on Diwali, Christmas Day and New Year's Eve. 

There are several Restaurants ( about 25) at this place serving a variety of foods for the passers by. It is a very busy area and a must visit place. More

title: Winter perfect
review_text: A perfect place to be in a winter night. Everyone in their warm jackets and cloaks gives u a different feel. This place is filed with 5 stars, eateries road side stalls and is a shoppers paradise too

title: Awesome food joints
review_text: Liked the continental food in this awesome restaurant located here. The Ambience was great. Try the sea food its great.

title: Park Street : Never sleeps at night
review_text:
One of the best and awesome street of kolkata is the Park Street. You name it and get all options of restaurant. We went in Night and believe me at first instance I was like thinking am I travelling in indian city or foreign city. Once of the cleanest, well maintained, gothic style structures street of kolkata. 

This street can give any street on indian city run for their money. You will find lots of options for bakery, pasteries and each and every MNC fast food restaturant is ther plus some local as well. 

I highly recommend to all the tourist to visit this place one in his lifetime.

title: Times Square of Kolkata
review_text: Be here during the night, and you will get a feel of Times square. Lots of heritage buildings, awesome places to eat and just roaming around will give a good feel of the pulse of the city. During festivals this place is decorated even more. One downside is finding parking here is difficult.

title: Best place to go out in Kolkata
review_text: If you are looking for a place to spend your nights in the city Park Street is that place ! Restaurants, bars, night clubs, etc.

title: Romance and Masti
review_text: A Street full of foody attractions and excellent bars, starting from egg rolls, to best bakery items, chinese, mutli cuisine, wines, dines, night clubs for masti. Enjoy!

title: the happening street
review_text: We stayed at the park hotel which was preety noisy lots of shoppng for saris and jewellary can be found in the area not to mentioned great food joints

title: The heart line of Calcutta
review_text: Park Street symbolises the fun part of calcutta. It has series of good restaurants, a five star hotel , lot of food joints , a famous club , music stores , Book stores , a famous college and the British legacy. This is a destination by itself. Though it has lost all the old grandeour and the aristocracy it used to command during British era or even after the Independance , it is still the heartline of Calcutta. Calcuttans flock there for good food or go to Oxford book store to buy books. The Park Hotel or Peter Cat restaurant attracked a lot of visitors daily. This road connects two important roads-J L Nehru road in the West and A J C Bose Road in the East. Park Street wears a real festive look during Christmas when the entire stretch is lit up with small lights and people throng in thousands on 31st December night to celebrate the New year. The tall and old buildings with Victorian architecture are sure to take you back to the British era. Park Street today symbolises the glamour what Calcutta had once upon a time. More

title: HEART OF KOLKATA CITY
review_text: This is a good marketing place and almost all the well known commercial establishments have their presence here. Apart from this, the location has many historical monuments and church, etc.

title: The Entertainment Street of Kolkata
review_text: Bright , Lively, Full of Restaurants & Hotels. This is the only area where one can go bar hopping. Best during Christmas

title: The Heart of the City
review_text: This is called the heart of the city. If you want to see it's best form, the 31st December is the best Time. Full of Folks n Friends. The most happening place in the town.

title: A Landmark
review_text: It would be sacilege if you do not visit Park Street when in kolkata. Lined with eateries liking peter cat, Bar-B-Q, Flurys and of course the Park hotel with its commanding position. There are pedestrian shops selling chocolates,cigarettes etc and a few noted beauty parlours. Its exudes a festive air on weekends with live bands playing music , hawkers selling balloons. You can stay on Park Street or in budget hotels off park street like Royd Street, Sudder Street etc

title: Do visit if you are in Kolkata
review_text: If you visit Kolkata, you can spare an evening to take a walk in this road. A lots of shops of various kinds- clothes, sweets, cafes, restaurants, short eats, and much more. You can take a walk on this road from one end to the AJC Bose Road junction. If you wish to have the famous Kathi rolls, you will find many outlets on this road. There is one more attraction- the heritage trams of Kolkata. While there is no tram on the main market section of Park street, you will find them at the Park Street and AJC Bose Road junction. Because of all these attractions, I strongly recommend that a visitor to Kolkata should visit Park Street. More

title: Park Street
review_text: A place filled with nostalgia and also boasting of modern amenities. A large number of hotels, notable Park hotel, lot of fabulous restaurants, the Oxford book store and pavement shopping - this is a must visit once in kolkata.

title: Iconic place of kolkata
review_text: This is one of the most iconic places in kolkata starting from mocambo/peter cat restaurants, oxford book shop, and the lively nights. A must visit on weekends.

title: Very westerrnized part of Kolkata
review_text: My stay in Kolkata required multiple trips to Park street. The businesses on this street are verry much geared to tourists. As a result the items sold in stores here are quite expensive. As with all parts of Kolkata it is usually very crowded. I had occasion to walk there early in the morning and found it relatively more relaxing in spite of the raising of dust by the street cleaners at that time (around 6.00 am). I do not recommend this as a 'must see'; its just another very commercial part of the city.

title: Good place to shop
review_text: It is a good place to shop as you would find westside,pantaloons and all major brands there available for sale and one stop place to shop for everything.

title: late night downtown attraction
review_text: You can dance, eat at different kind of places, like flurys, Kwalitys, and there is a self service salad and sandwich place next to flurys which is open till late and i loved the sandwiches there. There is tantra for dance and someplace else for live bands.. enjoy your evening here

title: Great Place to Hang Around...Heart of the City !!
review_text: Its a Great Place to hang around with friends and Family.. Lot of options to Shop and eat...Get the flavour of Real Kolkata evening ...Got to be Park St...Stree is Adorned with Lights during Christmas n New Year....Gives you a Different Feeling!!

title: Merrimaking in Kolkata
review_text:
This is where Kolkatans head for when they are in the mood for merrimaking! 
The original favs of Kolkatans in the matter of food joints are all along this road. You can take your choice starting from Trinka's to Worldorff, from Park hotel to Flurys. It is most hustling and bustling from Christmas to new year. It becomes Maddison sqaure garden of Kolkata then. 
And at its end lies the Park cemetary.

title: PARK STREET
review_text: A place to enjoy, commonly known as Party Street. Almost all good restaurants are situated here. One can enjoy all types of cousines and street food. X'mas period makes this street hilarious.

title: Best street for an Indian or foreigner
review_text: After a walk or tour across the city this is the place to come back to as there are restaurants, pubs for every pocket - upmarket Park hotel or the others Trinca's, Kwality , Flury,s and Mocambo on Mirza Ghalib Street which has a number of leather product shops. There's also a Cafe Coffee Day to beat the heat at noon with a cold coffee or cold drink and lot of snacks or Domino's and others to catch a bite. All banks, forex exchange bureaus are in or around this road.

title: Wonderful!
review_text: Park Street holds a very special place for anyone from Calcutta, or any regular visitor of the place. This Street has to be best known for the restaurants and pubs that it offers and the food is worth dying for. Being a foodie, I like the place best for food. But you can get a nice hair cut at An John's, the famous Thunderbolt beer at OlyPub, and get some nice Comic souvenirs from F Bloc, a walk down the street.

title: Oxford street of Calcutta
review_text:
Park street or I like to compare it with the Oxford street of London. 
but this one is Calcutta Version. 
Mixed blend of Cultures and Standards

title: Good to walk around
review_text:
good to walk around 
has number of places to choose for food and buying. 
You can see locals in many colours . 
fast eating places have hordes of collage kids.

title: Part of kolkata that does not sleep..!!
review_text: filled with amazing restuarants & shopping destinations.. A must see for youngsters..enjoy soem good food with even better shopping.. The busiest part of the urban city..

title: Unclean but good street food
review_text: The Katti rolls 40 bucks and non veg here is killer. the chai (if u r not from north) can b enjoyed in earthen pots which tastes different than ur usual chai. the place is unclean and noisy but thats a trade off u have to make for cheap and good food

title: Different Restaurant
