review_text: There is nothing special in Park Street. You can find only some good restaurants, Oxford. That's all. Only in the new year time, it is decorated with lights & different stuffs.

title: Haven for foodies
review_text: If you are a foody, and you are in kolkata then you should not by any means miss this place. You have variety of restaurants and pubs and discotheques here tht you will be spoilt for choice. Some of the major names are trincas, tantra, some place else, flury's

title: Crown of the city
review_text: quite a busy street with lots of restaurants and pubs to hangout. have a few good shopping options also.

title: OASIS!
review_text: Apart from the bustling and chaos of Kolkata, Park Street offers you places to relax and regain energy to endure Kolkata again. There are many shops, restaurants, and cafés.

title: Something unique about Calcutta
review_text: This place is like none other, a mix of traditional and modern, cheap and classy, McDonalds and Magnolias at opposite side of the road, this place has something for everyone. No visit to Calcutta is complete without a visit to Park Street.

title: Leisure at Park Street
review_text: Nice eating out options.. huge buzz at Park Street..lively.. China town street offers very good eating options.

title: Best place in kolkata
review_text: This is one of the very few places in kolkata where you can wear any attire without worrying about men ogling at you. Posh crowd. Best restaurants in the city are mostly in this area. I go there almost every week and still feel like going again. This is a place you can visit with family, friends, clients and even go alone and have a gala time all by yourself as well.

title: Mini Kolkata in Kolkata
review_text:
Park Street has everything that you want to experience in Kolkata... 

Great walks, amazing food options, iconic places to visit & have a drink with friends, or get some amazing food at restaurants that have a history greater than many cities themselves... And if you still want more, there are tons of attractions to see within 15 min of Park Street!! What more can you ask for 

My favourites: Flurrys, Peter Cat, Balaram Mullick, Park Hotel, Trincas, Kwality, Hushh... Can fill up the entire page if I write all. You have to go there and experience... rather than continue reading this :)

title: Shelter in a Storm
review_text: India including Kolkata is very intensive, particularly on your first trip or two, with crowds, noise, dirt and constant activity working together to wear you down and risking turning what should be one of the great growth experiences of your life into a disillusioning chore. The back streets and alleys are where it's all at and the local bazaars (rather than New Market) but they can be hard work and after an afternoon exploring you may find the need to come back to something more familiar and reassuring just to get your mind back to its comfort zone for a while. This is the beauty of Park Street. It's exotic enough to be India but familiar enough to be home. Fine decaying colonial architecture and comfortable shops and cafes make this an oasis - good for a rest but like a caravanserai only until you have regained strength to move on. More

title: Lively area with many great options
review_text: This is the heart of retail Kolkata. Lot's of restaurants, bars, shops and street stalls. Prices are generally a bit higher than other parts of town, but the quality is generally higher, too.

title: Very Tourist Oriented Part of Kolkata
review_text: Like most parts of Kolkata, very crowded. However, from here you have good access to shops and restaurants.

title: Kolkata's Heart
review_text:
The about a kilometre stretch of Park St from Chowringhee to Camac St is the heart of Kolkata and a place everyone yearns for. Located here are the famous old restaurants and watering holes of the smart and famous names of the city. Iconic names like Trincas, Flurys, Barbeque, Kwality, Magnolia, Mocambo and many more are all here as also are some famous and glitzy shops like Ocford, the bookstore and tea bar with a difference. Cheek by jowl are modern showrooms viz Samsung and Vodafone. Extremely popular and mouthwateringly good are the Kathi kababs or rolls of Kusum which have to be eaten standing outside the 'hole in the wall' 
Christmas - New Year week sees the festivities peaking with the entire stretch turning into one big party. At this time Park St is gaily decorated with lights streamers and bunting. 
Definitely worth experiencing More

title: Most favorite .. eat , walk , see ...
review_text: Park street is strongly colonial in its look & feel ! the cake shop Flury's , the eat outs such as Mocambo, Kwality, The Park ..The chinese eat out joints everything seems perfectly in place.End of the year is the best time to visit the Park Street .. The colors , the people ..something that every one treasures for a life time. All round the year there is a strong subliminal sense of festivity .. a spirit that is so Kolkata .. Kolkata visit is never over with no Park Street!

title: Tantra...
review_text: Great club and music you just need to be a millionaire to afford a drink. Get drunk before and buy one drink when you are they, the prices are crazeeeee

title: Kolkata swish!
review_text: try Park Street for up market shopping , variety of good restaurants and the famous Fleurys cskeshop. Visit the Oxford book shop for good local literature and DVDs .m if you don't mind the hustle and bustle you might find some little antique shops down the side streets of Park Street, I have bought treasures left from the days of the Raj in the past!

title: perfect place for evening entertainment
review_text: multiple choices in terms of food joints and shopping....an array of other entertainments with hospitality approach of people. good place to spend evening. can also do window shopping and do some good bargaining with street hawkers

title: party street of kolkata
review_text: If its new year and you happen to be in kolkata, make sure you visit Park Street. This place is all decked up during Christmas and New year time. For the rest of the year, its just a normal street with plenty of options for restaurants.

title: Fascinating Area
review_text:
Park Street has everything one would expect from a tourist hot spot - restaurants, cafes, bookshops, clothes shopping, etc. 
However for a more authentic experience and interactions with the local people, head down some of the streets leading off Park Street. You will not be disappointed with the diversity and vitality of life in Kolkata. 
You can taste local food from street vendors, ride a rickshaw or tram or bus, and walk around getting a feel for life on the streets of Kolkatta. Finish your day exploring with a refreshing iced coffee at one of the many western style coffee shops along Park Street.

title: Disappointined with the decay
review_text:
I have been a visitor and part time resident of this once truly cosmopolitan city since the mid 50's. 
Many fond memories of Pam Craig, Usha Uthap(?) / Usha Iyer, and the Sikh gentleman who would regale the clients with Bollywood hits! 
Where many restaurants and clubs would deny you entry if you were not attired with jacket and tie! Where Firpo's and Flury's held sway! Where the gentry congregated at Skyroom for lunch, and Trinca's, Mocambo, Moulin Rouge and "Mags" were happening places. And then came the commies, and with them the Deluge! 
All the fancy stores pulled Down their shutters, and "mudee" walls, and pain purchase, and smugglers took over this once elite street. 
Over the past few years, things have improved- but the Park Street of yore - is truly dead and buried! R IP More

title: The Crowning Glory of Kolkata
review_text: Best time to visit is October through January - enjoy the festive spirit of Durga Puja, Diwali, Christmas & New Year.

title: Park St. Kolkata
review_text:
I high expectations for some bars, restaurants, and shopping, but instead it was a very crowded, noisy place with not that many options for restaurants or shopping at all. Bars seemed to be nonexistent. 

On the plus side, there is a lot of food, chai, and some shops that you will find on the street, and The Park Hotel is a nice choice, too. Seems like this area is developing a lot, so it's bound to change very quickly.

title: Tourist hotspot
review_text: This is THE tourist street, with many tourist oriented restaurants and travel agencies. Also street-side stalls sell things for a much higher price compared to other places (i recommend Ghariahat for its street stalls). If you're here, I recommend jumping one parallel street further in the direction away from the metro. There you'll find New Market and shops much more locally oriented, with much more variety and a more authentic Indian experience.

title: 25th Dec'2013
review_text: It was an amazing experience to go to park street on Christmas last year. It was from this year that Derek O Brien had taken charge to decorate this stretch, which was previously done by the shop owners association at park street. from excellent management to excellent music. Everything just seemed perfect and in control.

title: An Okay Street
review_text: The street is lined with shops, restaurants, hotels, offices, etc. Mostly sari shops--some really good ones. Boutiques. Some eateries on the pavements. Book shops. The walking pavements are uneven with potholes and badly maintained. At one end of the street there is this point which the locals have named 'seven point' because seven streets radiate from this spot.

title: Not what it was but still worthwhile
review_text: Good choice of places to eat. Oxford bookstore remains. Centrally located. Great place to meet friends. We dined at Per Cat, an old stronghold.

title: Kolkata Special
review_text:
No visit to the 'City of Joy' is complete without a stroll down Park Street -originally a Deer Park and now the foremost Dining district of the City. The area is dotted with eateries nightclubs and pubs each with its distinguished history - Trinca's, Blue Fox, Mocambo , Moulin Rouge, Magnolia, Peter Cat, Waldorf, Flury's, Kwality and Barbeque to name a few. It also houses some of the city's famous showrooms, business houses, hotels and Churches. 
The best time to visit Kolkata is during the winters when there is a enjoyable nip in the air, and the best time to visit Park Street is on Christmas, when the place is lit up with festival lights and everyone seems to be headed towards the same destination . It is well connected with all means of transport including the Metro. I noticed huge queues outside all eateries and the roadside vendors were making brisk business. Despite the surging crowds, the enthusiasm was infectious and we had a great time. More

title: So much has changed
review_text: So much has changed in Kolkata that it is a sheer relief to be able to amble down Park Street and see so many of the familiar places still there. Such as Flury's. No birthday came and went in our youth without the joy of cakes and patties from Flury's. Last December thanks to a leading politician the street was decorated and lit for Christmas and looked a lot like its cheerful past.

title: The most happening place of Kolkata
review_text: Excellent architecture, the best restaurants, Coffee shops, book shops (Oxford) & also roadside books. Chinese food- BBQ, Continental- Mocambos, Indian-Kwality, Tea/Coffee- Flurys, Kids- Indias Hobby Centre (russell street)

title: Enjoying Christmas at Park Street,2013
review_text: It was a great enjoyment with schoolmate friends at park street on 25th December. We visited a very famous church at park street. Night was illuminated & decorated very nicely in each & every street & shop at park street. Road was very crowded but we enjoyed every moment on that very auspicious day.

title: shoppers paradise
review_text: Its a Mecca for sarees lovers and jewellery lover. You will love to shop Indian traditional cloths and Designer jewellers. Some special showroom must go are H M Diwan Jewellers at avani signature tower, Diwansons jewellers at Siddha point. For sarees and suits, Diwan heritage, Regards sarees, Diwan fashion scape. Amazing bars and restarants, lots of mouth watering street foods. Many more fast food to eat. One can spend whole day here with friends and family.

title: One of the great streets
review_text: There are several streets much better than Parkstreet in Kolkata. But still Park street also good to see. the section from Park circus to the half way is terrible. After that its a different world.

title: Busy and full of life
review_text: Its a busy yet lively street....the whole street is surrounded by numerous restaurants and bars serving different cuisines.

title: Park Street...Eat, shop and make merry...
review_text: Park Street can be roughly compared to Colaba Causeway in Mumbai....Stretching from Park Circus Cirlce to the east all the way upto the Maidan to the West, Park Street is located in the heart of Kolkata. Park Street gets its name from the hotel - 'The Park' which is located at the Maidan end of Park Street. The Street hosts the famous century old restaurants and confectionery stores like 'Flurrys', 'Trinca's' and 'Kwality'; as well as the more modern food joints, such as Mac'donalds, Pizza Hut, Subway, Barista, Cafe Coffee Day as well as good bars and restaurants like 'Peter Cat', 'Moulin Rouge' and 'Marco Polo' amongst others. It also has an Oxford Bookstore and a few branded shops.. Interestingly, Park Street also has a cemetery - which is somehow calm and serene, and is nicely tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the traffic and jaywalkers on Park Street. So, whether you wanna shop for books or grab a hasty bite, or pick up a quick cup of coffee, or wine and dine in leisure, Park Street is the place to be! More

title: Christmas & New Year
review_text: It was my 1st Visit to Calcutta, India... Park Street is the In thing in Calcutta... Best place ! Lot of restaurants, Shopping places... A must see.

title: Must have seen better days !!
review_text: The Park Street of today reminds of London of the 18th century.. only the ugly wires hanging all over the street is quite disappointing.. The local government must consider revamping the street and make it more tidy...

title: A Great Place
review_text: Park Street is an amazing place. Most of the best restaurants, and shops are here. If in Kolkata it is a must visit.

title: Vibrant and historic area in central Kolkata
review_text: There were several excellent restaurants in the area serving Indian, Chinese and continental cuisine. At the far end of the street are the English and Scottish cemeteries. These give fascinating glimpses into Anglo-Indian history. They are well maintained by Indians who value their heritage.

title: a very historical place
review_text: the joy which park strret provides us in christmas cannot be provided by any other street in kolkata.containg many famous shops,bars and restaurants,park st is a true historical delight.

title: A must visit in Christmas & New Year
review_text: Excellent view with party environment added with lots of good restaurants, branded shops. A must visit during Christmas & New Year when it is in it's full grandeour.

title: Christmas at Park Street
review_text: Park street is anyways very popular in Kolkata however on Christmas eve and on the day itself it was as if a sea of humans is there to celebrate. All roads lead to park street is most apt for the day. Everybody with a santa cap and beautiful lighting along with long queue's before eatries and restaurants, Park street was perfect urban mela. It has all the famous brands you can think of either on the main road or the arterials. Its a must visit if you are in Kolkata and if its festival time, you should not miss this place.

title: Some nice restaurants
review_text: There are some nice restaurants in Park Street but there are also a lot of beggars. It is fine during the day but at night it can feel a bit intimidating if you are a lone woman or even in a group of women. There are some shops but nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Dressed up for Christmas
review_text: It was wonderful to see the street decked up with lights for Xmas, and we were lucky to be here a few days before 25th Dec, which day was apparently chaotic due to no vehicles on the street. The street food stalls setup specially for this week were great opportunity as well to taste various cuisines.

title: Happening Place in Kolkata.
review_text:
Most definitely the most happening place in kolkata city. 
Commercial place in kolkata with most restaurant's and pubs and hotels in kolkata. Although it is commercial place, nearby is the victoria memorial worth visiting....

title: All you need on a Yuppie trip.
review_text: Every thing you would ever need - from restaurants, bars, shopping places, book stores, etc. you can find on this street. It's pretty neat.

title: Park Street is an amazing place for food lovers
review_text: Park Street offers you an array of eateries to choose from, Be it the PeterCat from the 60's or Flury's which is much older, it offers you any cuisine you can think of... Visit to Kolkata is incomplete without visiting Park Street and eating here..

title: Nice for an evening
review_text: With top places in a row, this is a nice promenade to walk and savour the city in the evenings. You get to experience all cultures and classes of the place in one go.

title: Good place for food
review_text: If you want good food along with street foods,good shops to shopping and want to stay in a luxury hotel(as hotel park is there)so you should come to park street.

title: magical
review_text: Park Street has been one of my favourite haunts, since my mid-teens. it's a testament to the mash-up of cultures that is Kolkata. right from its restaurants and shops and institutions to the cemetery, every place on and around Park Street has a colourful story to tell. Christmas is especially lovely here as the entire road is lit up.

title: A must see!
review_text: Park Street is historic, modern and a perfect hangout for tourists vising Kolkata. It has all the old world charm, nice buildings from the British era, and modern eateries. Don't miss the paan stalls along the roadside!

title: Amazing Park street
review_text:
I got accommodation in Thalli Tal nearest to or in Park Street. 
That why i got chance to visit the market and introduced with there's people.

title: My last visit to Park Street till today
review_text: Love the wide options to hang out and chill in and around park street. It has the most popular pubs, discs, book store, cafes, restaurants, etc. If you walk straight on the road and don't enter any of the mentioned, you head for the South Park street cemetry. My last visit was to the pub Someplace else in park street, itz quite kool to chill with a drink and soak into some slow English music in any evening specially on weekends.

title: Restaurant Row at Park Street
review_text: Get away from the usual clutter and grime of Calcutta by going to Park Street. We ate at lunch at Peter Cat and it was very good. After that we stopped for coffee and a sweet at Flury's. I think both are special for Calcutta.

title: Park street- a second home
review_text: For a Xavierian, Park street rocks. Huge lot of memories in these streets which I will never forget..

title: The most happening Place!!
review_text: And also one of the most busiest streets of kolkata. And off-course 'Boozer's Paradise'. You will find offices, star hotels and a number of quality Bar cum family restaurants and famous 'Trincus' also.

title: Best place in Kolkata
review_text: Its the one and only place I go to whenever I come to kolkata. It has the best restaurants and nightlife in kolkata. There's so much to choose from. There are also big stores to shop from. But the best thing is I find the place less touched by crowd and dirty surroundings like in other parts of kolkata. It is the most happening place, great nightlife especially at The Park. From McD to barbeque nation, you find everything to please everyone's taste buds. Nice place even if you want to just stroll around.

title: Park is kinda Smart
review_text: It's always rather nice turning into Park St....it feels more leisurely and there are comforting restaurants....an escape from all the tooting drivers of cars and cabs and scooters all over town...blowing the horn is a congenital fixation that seems to establish a driver's omnipitance.....but Park is appealing in it's coffee culture way, amongst grand buildings that must once have had a greater purpose but are now over sized and decaying for want of rescue....and it's said this area in earlier optimistic times was the Deer Park of a colonial man of substance...only this passing reference to a Gentleman's park lingers in the social promise of the magnificent history of Calcutta, as founded by the British East India Company. More

title: Cool markets
review_text: The markets that stretch along Park St. and in behind it are full of interesting shops and bargains if you want to go looking for them. I found it intriguing to walk around the markets and to see people going about their business whether it be as stall holder or consumer. The bustling nature of the markets made for an exciting environment and the haggling that was occurring was fascinating. One point to note, however - some of the shop keepers were very persistent in their attempts to get you to buy or to come into their shops. "No" is definitely a word they do not understand and at times I had to be extremely firm and almost aggressive to get them to leave me alone, which I did not enjoy. On the whole, though, the experience was a good one. More

title: Nice place to spend evening
review_text: I heard a lot about this place so went there with my friends on Sunday night to have some fun. But found the streets empty, we spotted very few people There are some pubs/bars (Tantra, Oly, Roxy), restaurants (Peter Cat, Bar-Bq) which are good and can be tried.

title: sari shoppers know about this!
review_text: typically not so comfortable shopping area - great for shopping and with the most beautiful sarees! Shopkeepers are very courteous and happy to oblige. Great customer service- they actually deliver the saree to your hotel if need be!! If yu want to but sareed, just go to Park street!

title: Nice Place
review_text: A decent place for all kinds of food. A bit of cleaning of the roads and garbage would be wonderful for this place.

title: Posh locality
review_text: Its one of the posh locality of the city...place of high rise buildings, the iconic spots of the city such as Flury's, Park Hotel, and many a landmarks of the city

title: Happening Place at Night
review_text: Exciting place to roam around at nigh. Shopping stores, restaurants, clubs, pubs - a proper place for a tourist to spend an eventful evening.

title: Feels like walking down the Ancient times with modern shops around
review_text: Park Street was a really good experience. The best in brand stores and restaurants to cater the needs of every traveler. The architecture is really good and the way it is maintained is also really good. Same as Mumbai's Coloba but a bit posher than that.

title: nice to walk in the street at evening
review_text: nice to walk in the street at evening. it has street food, bar, shops, hotels, etc... feels a bit similiarity of bangkok

title: Excellant Area to take in the sights and feel of Calcutta
review_text: I was informed that Park street was the place to goto in Calcutta. And it dint fail to live upto its reputation. Vibrant people with loads of people and plenty of shopping options. Good eating joints all over the area and nice to sample the local cuisine

title: Park Street
review_text: Many of the established businesses in Kolkata are located on Park Street. The area is clean and tidy. I found out real quickly that crossing the street for tourists should be done at designated, well marked areas. Like an idiot, I decided to follow some of the locals through a hole in the iron fence. What I didn't realize is that when I got to the other side of the street, I had to find an entrance to the sidewalk very quickly. Traffic was bearing down on me. Finally, a nice man yelled at me to run to my right for the closes access to the sidewalk.

title: Name a thing and its there :)
review_text:
Food for foodies, books for bookworms and multiple shopping options for shoppers. u just have to name a thing and you will find it during a walk on the Park Street. 
Oxford Book store, Mogambo, Peter cat, Flurry's, the age-old cake shop from the Park Hotel , Kusum Roll centre,many sarees and suit shops makes this street worth it. 
You can also find old buildings build during the British era and yellow Taxis rush.

title: Good Location
review_text: Park Street is an important street in Calcutta and has for example the Oxford book store which is considered the best in the city. It also has a Costa Coffee, several hotels and important historic sites like the Asiatic Club and at the far end the Park Street Cemetery.

title: for whatever your need
review_text: a busy street, however, u ll find anything u need, from food, mobile phone companies, a huge bookshop. there s flurys for that special treat too. very nice shops selling beautiful cloths

title: Middle Class Indians
review_text: Good people watching, the shops were more modern than expected. There are a couple of pricey, western style coffee shops (no wifi) here too. Be mindful of the traffic though!

title: Park Street is Very Important place in Kolkata.
review_text:
Park is situated in near Maidan Area. Previously Kolkata Book fair organized here, now it is closed for environment causes. Jaharwarlal Neheru, Indra Gandhi Sarani, Red Road, Souren Banerjee Road etc crossing. Howrah to park strret it take approximately 35 minutes by Bus/ Taxi etc vehicles. Here nearest Important place is Esplanade, Lindsey Street, Rabindra Sadan, Victoria Memorial, Birla Tara Mondal etc. 
Museum, Mother Theresa House, Chatterjje International, Tata House, Reliance Hose, Lot of Important Bank & office avilable Here. 
Here Metro also avilable. Big Bazar, Megha Shop, Pantallom, Shreeleather House, Sree Ram House alsom avilable. In 31 the December lot of Pople came Park street Road for great lighting & festivable mode. In 12.00 pm at night people celeberate here this important place. 
Lot of Resturant, Hotel avilable, in prevent lot of food avilable so people can not suffer here. More

title: Cannot leave Kolkata without a stroll and a meal on Park Street
review_text: Park Street is to Kolkata what the Champ Elysees is to Paris! Or.. what Fifth Avenue is to New York city.. And I am not comparing it with the the scale of the other two, mind you. The point is that you have to take a leisurely stroll down this little street, taste the rolls, may be have a beverage and a snack at Flurry's to soak-in the culture of the City of Joy! The Bengalis light-up this street during X'mas season ala colonial style.. While I have fond memories of anything and everything in Kolkata, friends of mine did find it depressing.. So! bear in mind that you have to let this city grow on you. More

title: Road with a history
review_text:
This is the street associated with the famous revelry of Calcutta from the days it was the second London of the British Empire. The road is full of bars & eateries serving a variety of cuisines and many of them have a long and famous history. 

During festival time like Pujas and more particularly during Christmas / New Year time the street be bejewelled with lights and has a merry look.

title: my Park Street
review_text:
Since childhood Park street is my fave area of calcutta. There is New-market near by. 
i used to go for shopping to new-market with mom and aunts and used to have lunch or dinner at any restaurant in Park st. Park st is full of hotels, restaurants, offices and very old mansions. park street was very cosmopolitan those days, different from rest of calcutta. During christmass and new-year the road was being illuminated and decorated. All the people who love to party they used to gather in Park st. It is a long wide road starts from J L Nehru Road to A J C Bose Road, Baithak-khana Bazar. Park hotel is on park st. Famous restaurants like BAR-B-Q, Blue-fox, Peter-cat, Mocambo (off Park st), magnolia all are on that road but very old and famous is Flury's. I feel nostalgic whenever talk about Park Street...... More

title: The centre of Calcutta
review_text: The nearest to a times square or bond street in Calcutta...restaurants, bars, pubs, shops, cafes and swanky outlets complete the picture...a must for outsiders or even locals

title: The most happening Hangout
review_text:
Park street is always lively full of some of the best restaurants Kolkata city offers. Its also has a five star hotel Park Hotel which has superb nightclub called tantra for people to shake the leg and enjoy your favourite drink made by smiling bartenders not to mention great music by DJ. 
Excellent restaurants are Kwality, Flavours of China, Trincas, Mocambo, Veda, Flury's, Peter Cat and a small roadside joint called Kusum offering Rolls to go. 
During Xmas time this street is so well lighted and various programs organized by Kolkata city to keep the crowd mesmerized. The best time to come to Park street any day is from 6pm to 11 pm. 
It has also got the Oxford book store which is a must for book lovers and you will find staff very helpful with a great vast variety of books. More

title: Hub of eating places
review_text:
Park Street iris what you call a City Center , all important eating places are there in one place,all within walking distance. In 80s this was the hub of nightlife of Kolkata or India with crooners cabarets etc but nw accept for Some Place else where you get a live music every night it is all food. 
It is a must visit area for tourists indian or foreigners.

title: The heart of Kolkata
review_text: The Road reminds me of the great historic significance that Kolkata has and for which we must be proud of!

title: park street with restaurants
review_text: The street have famous hotels & restaurants. Though these cost comparatively higher but teens and affluent throng this place which is live till well past mid night. icon of calcutta's night life

title: Full of eating joints
review_text: ParkStreet has full of eating joints and one can go for authentic Punjabi and/or Chinese style of dishes. The place does not have any restaurant though for authentic Bengali style of dishes. In case one prefers to have authentic Bengali style dish, one should instead visit a restaurant called "6, Ballygunje Place" which is located in Ballygunje - half hours drive from ParkStreet. ParkStreet is however, very close to New-Market and one can hang around for hours in New-Market and make a lot of purchases. Close to ParkStreet is National Museum. If one intends to visit National Museum, it would take a couple of hours. So visit National Museum only if you have 3-4 hours in hand. More

title: Happening place
review_text: The night life of kolkata street. Very centrally located. Restaurants with every type of food. Macdonalds, KFC, also on this street. Do not give heed to pimps who follow you.

title: A terrific place to shop and eat it out
review_text: the park street is a famous place with outlets like Mcdonald Bar b que resturent the kwality resturent and many more .the flury cake shop opposite Mcdonald is also very good.

title: Numero uno Entertainment Hub of Kolkata.
review_text:
Park Street is one of the prime commercial and entertainment zone of the city.Well decorated on Christmas Day and New Year's Eve.You think of any good restaurants of Kolkata ,you will find right here in park Street. 
Park Street is filled with landmarks. Some prominent ones are 
Asiatic Society,The Park Hotel,Queens Mansion,Park Mansions,Park Plaza,Park Centre,St. Xavier's College, Calcutta,Seventh-Day Adventist Church,Assembly of God Church school,Mercy Hospital,South Park Street Cemetery... 

Music world was a major landmark but you wont find Music World anymore from July 2013. 

I am lucky to walk across this street daily to reach my office. 

Those who will be visiting Kolkata don't forget to visit Park Street. You will love this place for sure. More

title: Park Street.
review_text: The Park street runs throught what a deer park of sir Eliajh Impey. Chief justice of the supreme court in calcutta from 1773-1789. The highlited space nearby like Maidan, Taltala, Mirza galib Street, Rafi Ahamed Kidwali steet, Wood Street, Dharmatala. Near Chatterjee Entenational, Everest Building, Tata house, Reliance house. Mother Teresa, Music world, Seconday Board office, zoological Survey of India & lot of office available here. Here lot of Resturant Jyoti Vihar,Gangahr Snacks, Malgudi Junction, Kea south Indian, Mayaran. Famous hotel near park street Park Hotel, Hotel Lindsey, Peerless In, Grand Hotel, Hotel Tajbengal(10 minute). Bazer kolkata, Mega Shop etc avilable. Metro is avilable here. Elliot park. Indian Museam is avilable here in Park street. It is very crowded area. food is also available in prevement. More

title: Makes Me Nostalgic
review_text: Park street makes me nostalgic everytime I reach there, I have spent two years of my life here walking down the street while studying in St. Xavier's college during my higher secondary education days. It has changed a lot since then - but still landmarks like "Park Street Cemetery", "The Park Hotel". "The Music World", "Seventh-Day Adventist Church" or :Peter Cat" used to give me a feeling that time has stopped a decade before. Unfortunately after "Music World" has shut down recently the reality hurts a lot. However I always visit Park Street on X-Mas eve, it makes me feel so happy, so attached to the street and to the good old days. More

title: Nothing new...its now in every city....
review_text: Park street is a place where there is everything is new as other part of kolkata is old just this difference. malls hotels restaurant and shopping. so nothing new it is in every city or town...why i will go to kolkata for that....bye bye

title: Hustle n Bustle of British India
review_text:
The place keep buzzing with activities. Call it a food street or street food junction. 
The best cafe of British era, fast food restaurants, music etc. 
travellers delight if in Kolkata

title: very crowded place
review_text: Good market, many shops with restaurants and hotels, but very crowded street. you can easily find out good food here.

title: The happening place ...
review_text: Park street has lost most of the colonial time glory but still manages to attract visitors by the million ... and rightly so. Especially during the festive time (Christmas & NY), this place teems with locals and visitors alike. Starting from the Park Hotel, just take a walk to the end (erstwhile Music World) and you see iconic building and restaurants that has shaped Kolkata's (or it should be Calcutta's) history. Must visits - Flurys for their pastries and baked stuff, Mocamo & Peter Cat for drinks and dinner. The closure of Music World has been a huge disappointment for all as this was probably the largest music store here and a meeting place for thousands of people. Sad More

title: Sarees to enrich your traditional mind
review_text: Park Street is famous for its endless saree shops......which I love to explore each time I visit Kolkata. Bar b que restaurant in Park Street was a delight to dine at. I spent fantastic times at Flury's, CD World, Titan and some boutiqe shops. I miss shopping in Park Street, Kolkata.

title: Overrated..
review_text:
To be brutally, honest this place is overrated. May be during the Clonial times it was one of the best places to be, but at present it is not what it appears to be hyped as. 
The place is stagnating, filth & crowded streets all around. 
You may find some good restaurants though..

title: Brighter side of calcutta
review_text: It has good restaurants otherwise very crowded in the evening . There is lot of traffic in the evening .

title: ALL GOOD RESTAURANTS IN PARK STREET
review_text: I like the cluster of hotels in and around park street at the same time the trafiic is very difficult to manage.

title: A 31st night
review_text: I spend my last 31st night there.To be frank, it was a pretty good time indeed.There were many bars throughout the area but as I don't drink i simply enjoyed the lighting they did in front of the bars. Many people came out with their families in intersection point of the park street, where they counted the time together right before the clock struck to midnight.there were some Indian amusements on the street as well.The atmosphere was friendly enough.

title: great for foodies
review_text: some amazing restaurants on park street.great for food and people watching.it is accessible by metro

title: Nice place, to roam around & window shop
review_text: read from some traveller accounts about flury's and peter cat.beware,casual/budget travellers are most unwelcome in these places.some nice street food joints.

title: Pride of the city
review_text: You will find all the top hotels, restaurants and bars. I frequented many bars and restaurants in the area, and all of them had a descent service and food. The shopping area of Esplanade was quite nearby.

title: The place to be...
review_text: This is the place if you wanna mingle with the crowd. Britis era restaurants mix well with modern up scale resto bars. The street buzzes with activity. Good drive...

title: A different Kolkata
review_text: This street is completely different form other areas (at least part of it) with big beautiful buildings in good shape, nice shops, good walking pavements. Further South it becomes more 'Indian' but close to the metro it looks almost 'western'

title: The speciality of Kolkata.
review_text: This is indeed the specialty of Kolkata with many famous shops and restaurants. If you are in Kolkata this place is a must visit.

title: Hub of central Kolkata
review_text: Park Street (which runs one-way) also called Mother Teresa Sarani offers a wide range of services including quality shops and restaurants hence represents a nice central base for a stay in the city. Most taxi drivers even know it! Don´t laugh, we could not believe that so many cabbies had such limited knowledge of their own city and English language. Park St is also close to some attractions like the Indian Museum, Eden Gardens, New Market and hosts the Park St Cemetery, and importantly, is relatively cleaner than some other areas with more safe walking room.

title: Special road of Kolkata
review_text: Nice place for the evening ...... some of the great food joints are here. Must spend some evening....specially during X mass.........

title: Place to be in kolkata
review_text: Park street is really the place to be in kolkata....There are some really nice Pub, restaurants to hangout...Park Hotel is a nice place to stay in....Nice for the shopping freaks.......If you are driving...difficult to find a parking and check the one way timmings...

title: The Best Place to hang out and experience Kolkata nightlife
review_text: Park Street is like the las vegas strip of nightclubs, restaurants etc. that offers a wide choice for all cuisines and drinks. There is the Park hotel with the famous ROXY nightclub inside. You can even visit Tantra (the second night club of the hotel). Right beside the Park, you can experience the famous Kolkata PAN. You also have your standard KFC, McDonalds and other fast food chains. My personal favorite is the BAR B Q Bar and Restaurant.

title: A must if you are a tourist !
